battlefieldofeternity.name: 2018-12-11 Patch Notes v 2.41.0
battlefieldofeternity.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Catapults[/b] [list] [*]When a team destroys a Fort, they'll now gain a Catapult in every 3rd Minion wave. [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] In order to keep early-game Catapults from being too devastating to defending teams, Catapult attack splash size, attack range, and damage/health will gradually increase as the game progresses. [/list] [/list] [b]Experience Changes[/b] [list] [*]Removed all Experience earned from destroying a Fort or Keep [*]Destroying a Fort or Keep will now provide your team with a stacking 20% increase in Passively-earned Experience [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] Towers of Doom is exempt from all Experience and Catapult changes. [/list] [*]Decreased Experience earned from destroying Towers by 50% [*]Passive Experience gain increased by 15% [*]Increased Experience gained by defeating defending Mercenaries by 100% [list] ​Hanamura Temple and Volsksaya Foundry Item Camps are excluded from this change. [/list] [*]Laning Mercenary Experience [list] Defeating Laning Mercenaries will now grant 100% of Defending Mercenaries Experience. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] Thank you so much for all of the feedback regarding the 2019 Gameplay Updates. While there is still a lot of community speculation about the outcome of these changes, there has been a resounding amount of concern about the loss of Fort and Keep XP. We agree that the complete loss of XP from Forts and Keeps may reduce the incentive to kill them to unhealthy levels, especially at higher levels of play. In response, we have reintroduced XP to the structures in a way that will reward players for taking them early while granting a gradual increase in power instead of large bursts. This should reinforce our goal of making matches closer while also rewarding teams for destroying enemy structures as quick as possible. [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] After listening to feedback, we have decided to pull back the laning Mercenary change outlined in our 2019 gameplay updates in order to give winning teams more opportunities to pull ahead.  [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Boss Camps, Sentinel Camps (Hanamura Temple), and Support Camps (Volskaya Foundry) will now be flagged as Elite. [list] Elite Mercenary Camps are Unstoppable & Unbribable [/list] [/list] [b]Unit Radii[/b] [list] [*]The unit radius values for most Heroes has been reduced by 5-15% [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] In an effort to improve visual clarity when many heroes are on-screen, we've updated the art for the Hero Ring displayed underneath heroes. To reinforce this effort, we've also done a pass on the Unit Radii for all heroes. We understand that these radius adjustments will have a minor but intended impact on landing and dodging abilities, and as a result, felt that the 2019 Gameplay Updates were the best time to make these changes.

battlefieldofeternity.name: 2018-06-06 Balance Update v 2.33.1
battlefieldofeternity.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,000 to 1,200 [*]Keep experience increased from 1,650 to 2,050 [*][b]Towers of Doom[/b] [list] Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,100 to 1,200. [*]Keep experience increased from 1,900 to 2,050. [list] [b][b]Note:[/b] Towers of Doom Forts upgrade to Keeps when the Tunnels open, approximately 12 minutes into a match.[/b] [/list] [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] We're taking some of the experience offered by outer Towers and distributing it amongst other Structures in an effort to keep teams closer in levels for a little while longer. We still want to reward skillful play, but a team that completes the first objective is frequently able take out a lot of the opposing team's outer Structures. Not only did this open up a strategic advantage (Healing Fountains get destroyed, Fortifications provide less safety), but it also pushes the winning team further ahead. Usually, this results in one team reaching level 10 before their opponents, allowing them to snowball to an even greater lead. We'd like to instead slow down early game leads, so that winning teams have to play well for a longer period of time.

battlefieldofeternity.name: 2018-01-09 Patch Notes v 2.29.7
battlefieldofeternity.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Total Health regen over 5 seconds reduced from 11.7% Maximum Health to 9% [*]Total Mana regen over 5 seconds reduced from 7.8% Maximum Mana to 7% [/list] [b]Forts[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33%. [*]Fort Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [/list] [b]Keeps[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Health increased from 16,000 to 17,000 [/list] ​[b]Battlefield of Eternity[/b] [list] [*]The initial stage of the first event will always be South vs North (Heaven South, Hell North) [*]The second stage of the first event will always be East vs West (Heaven East, Hell West) [list] All subsequent event stages will be randomized [/list] [*]The Minimap will now indicate upcoming Immortal spawn locations 30 seconds after the game begins. [list] Subsequent Immortal indicators will appear on the Minimap shortly after a previously summoned Immortal has been defeated. [*]Swap locations will not appear on the Minimap when an Immortal has been reduced to 50% Health. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] As expected, our gameplay update for 2018 resulted in large changes to many of our game systems. While we’re overall happy with the direction of the update, there have been some unintended side effects that we’re hoping to remedy. We overestimated how much more powerful unlimited ammo would be for Structures, and as a result pushing mechanics have become too strong, resulting in lower game times on nearly all maps. We’re giving our towers some of their teeth back with this update, which should help teams hold pushes from Mercenary Camps and map events. We’re also making some tuning changes to some of our Mercenary Camps now that we have had some time to see how they have been performing. Hellbats and Knights in particular are pushing harder than we would like, so we’re reducing their power. We’re also taking a look at the Warhead Junction boss and reducing its early and mid-game pushing power, as right now it is too strong when combined with Nukes from the map event. Lastly, we are reducing the power of Regeneration Globes. While we like the new mini-game that Neutral Regen globes provide in the laning phase, we are not comfortable with how much they are currently benefitting the team that is ahead while they are pushing into a defending team. We’re also seeing players picking up more Regeneration Globes in general, so this will help to keep the game’s overall sustain in check. These are some hefty changes, and it’s likely that there will be more needed to be done over time as things continue to settle. We’ll be keeping an eye on things, and are prepared to make more updates as they’re needed.

battlefieldofeternity.name: 2017-01-04 Patch Notes v 22.5
battlefieldofeternity.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Armor & Vulnerability[/b]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] With today’s patch you will notice that a lot of our tooltips that used to reference the Resistant/Vulnerable system have been changed. Matthew Cooper [url=https:/us.battle.net/forums/en/heroes/topic/20752266255]detailed the changes on our forums[/url] last month explaining a bit about the new system. While the tooltips may have changed, the actual functionality for the system has been in since the Varian patch hit during the week of November 14, so the game itself should not feel any different than what you are currently used to. You will also notice that we have added baseline Armor to three Heroes – Arthas, Anub'arak, and Greymane’s Worgen Form. These are the first of a handful that we are planning to release and would love to hear any feedback you have. We are hoping that the Armor System will open up future design flexibility, increase the depth of strategy (both in game, and in draft), and grant us another knob to help balance the game.  Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Battlefield of Eternity & Infernal Shrines:[/b] Fixed an animation pop affecting Towers on the Heaven side of Diablo-themed Battlegrounds. [/list] [list] [*][b]Core:[/b] Fixed an issue that could prevent the Core on the Hell side of Battlefield of Eternity and Infernal Shrines from playing certain attack sounds. [/list] [list] [*][b]Minimap:[/b] Catapult Minimap icons are now slightly lighter in color to help players more easily differentiate them from other Minions. [/list]

battlefieldofeternity.name: 2016-09-13 Patch Notes v 20.0
battlefieldofeternity.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Mounts[/b] [list] [*]Movement Speed reduced from 40 to 30% [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Time before Globes despawn reduced from 8 to 6 seconds [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Timing Changes[/b] [list] Previously all Mercenary camps spawned at 120 seconds. The following adjustments have been made to spawn times: [list] 90 seconds: Sappers, Doubloon Pirates [*]120 seconds: Siege Giants (unchanged), Impalers (unchanged) [*]150 seconds: Knights, Fallen Shaman [*]180 seconds: Grave Golem (unchanged) [*]300 seconds: Headless Horseman (unchanged) [/list] [/list] [*]Captured Mercenaries will no longer grant Experience when killed. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We started playtesting with staggered Mercenary Camp spawn times, and quickly began to realize that it added more strategic depth to the game, and coincided with some of our Battleground events. We have been happy with the changes overall, and are listening to any feedback you may have!  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Heroes can no longer push captured Mercenaries by walking into them. [/list]

battlefieldofeternity.name: 2016-07-12 Patch Notes v 19.0
battlefieldofeternity.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Victory determination is now much more precise in situations where both Cores are destroyed within fractions of a second. As a result, Victory will no longer be decided at random in cases where it appears that both Cores are destroyed at the same moment. [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 6.24% of maximum Health over 4 seconds [*]Now: Restore 12% of maximum Health over 5 seconds [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 32 Mana over 4 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 8% of maximum Mana over 5 seconds [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Thank you for all your discussion and feedback on our recent Health sustain post! We are still heavily evaluating a lot of it but wanted to get the first round of changes in. Internally, we enjoyed the increased importance on Regeneration Globes and have cleaned up the system a bit. With a larger importance, denying enemies their Globes in lane has a much larger impact.  [b]Healing Wells[/b] [list] [*]Cooldown increased from 100 to 120 seconds [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 41% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 40% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 20% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 30% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Much like the changes to Regeneration Globes, we wanted to add a larger impact to the moment you click a Healing Well. Again, we cleaned up the system a fair bit (hence the ~41% to 40% Health change) and added a larger impact for heavy Mana users. The increased cooldown should make the decision of when to tap the Healing Well slightly more interesting.  [b]Minions[/b] [list] [*][b]Ranged, Melee, and Wizard Minions[/b] [list] Now deal an additional 50% damage to Structures. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Our goal with this change is to make escorting Minions to Towns to be more impactful, such that they can really start to do some damage if left unattended. Before this change, Minions were primarily XP carriers that absorbed some Ammo shots from Towers. Now the armies of the Nexus are a bit scarier when they march down a lane.  [list] [*][b]Catapult Minions[/b] [list] Attack range increased by 20%. [*]Sight range increased by 17%. [*]Will now fixate on Structures. Catapults will not acquire a new target after fixating until the target is destroyed or the Catapult is killed. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Catapults would often reach the Core, but have a Minion wave spawn on them, distract them, and allow them to be killed off before doing any significant damage. With increased range and fixation on a Structure once they’ve started attacking, even one Catapult will more consistently punch through a Core’s Shield and do actual damage.  Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Battlefield of Eternity:[/b] AI Heroes can now halt their attacks on Immortals at the center of the Battleground in order to gank an enemy Sgt. Hammer that is attacking inner-Towers and Keeps. [/list]

battlefieldofeternity.name: 2016-05-17 Patch Notes v 18.0
battlefieldofeternity.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Healing Well[/b] [list] [*]25% of a Healing Well’s maximum Health has been converted into a Shield. Shield Regeneration delay of 8 seconds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We’ve noticed some rather un-fun behavior in the form of sniping Healing Wells over time using very long range Abilities. While we’re okay with players doing this to a degree, we found it was too effective given how little counterplay there was. To help solve this, turned a sizable portion of Healing Well Health into a Shield. This means that if you offer your Healing Well some respite from enemy attacks by chasing opponents away every now and then, it will start to regenerate some of that Shield. Only [b]you[/b] can protect Healing Wells from those pesky Arcane Orbs!  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Fixed an issue in which attacking enemy Walls at certain angles would cause the Hero’s Basic Attack animation to play, but deal no damage. [/list] [list] [*]Immortals on Battlefield of Eternity are now consistently flagged as Bosses. [/list]

battlefieldofeternity.name: 2016-02-02 Patch Notes v 16.0
battlefieldofeternity.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Battleground Monsters[/b] [list] [*]Battleground-specific creatures are now universally defined as [b]Monsters[/b] (ex: Neutral Garden Terrors, Sky Temple Guardians, etc.) [*]Several Talents and Abilities have been changed to reflect this new categorization, and the following no longer affect Monsters: [list] Mercenary Lord [*]Johanna's Knight Takes Pawn [*]Lunara's Cruel Bloom [*]Rexxar's Easy Prey and Bird of Prey [*]The Butcher's Chop Meat [/list] [*]The following now affect Monsters: [list] Anub'arak's Beetle, Juiced [*]Azmodan's Demonic Smite [/list] [*]Several Talents that could previously trigger against both captured Mercenaries and Minions will now only affect Minions (ex: Seasoned Marksman, Black Soulstone, etc.) [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Towers, Forts, and Keeps now deal 50% bonus damage to Heroes [*]Cores will now display an “Invulnerable” message if attacked by an enemy when no allied Keeps have been destroyed. [*]Structures can no longer be made Vulnerable [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] The scaling changes we released in December made it so Heroes could dive into Structures with impunity during the early game. Increasing the damage that Structures deal to Heroes allows defending players to feel a bit safer. We are exploring other fixes to help Structures feel more meaningful throughout the game and will release them when they are ready.  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Diagonally placed shrubs will now properly hide Heroes within them. [/list] [list] [*]Players punted out of an enemy Hall of Storms will no longer be persistently stunned if an enemy unit blocked the path of the punt. [/list]

battlefieldofeternity.name: 2015-11-17 Patch Notes v 15.0
battlefieldofeternity.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Scaling Changes[/b] [list] [*]Health and damage scaling for all Heroes, Battleground Events, Minions, and Mercenaries has been changed from flat, additive values to values that are multiplicative by percentage. [*]A large portion of Heroes’ total scaling amounts, which were previously gained over the course of a game, have been added to their base values. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Due to the way that our old level scaling system worked, early game level discrepancies created a larger difference in power level than we liked. This often led to situations where a team could be up two or more levels early in a game, and use this advantage to create a larger lead. We didn’t feel that games were fun for the winning or losing team in these types of scenarios. As a result of these changes, all Heroes will have more power early, but gain less from each level. Battleground Events, Minions, Mercenaries, and Structures have all been adjusted to compensate for this and should feel close to what they did previously. The aim of these adjustments to the scaling system is to make level differences have a similar impact on your Hero’s statistics at all points in a game. Now, each level offers about 4% Health and 4% damage, which mirrors what late game leads felt like in our previous version of the game. It is important to note, that while being down a few levels will be less punishing than it was previously, Talent tier advantages can and will still have a noticeable impact on enemy engagements.  [b]Respawn Timers[/b] [list] [*]Respawn timers have been increased for levels 1 – 10. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] In order to reward players for getting early game Takedowns, we’re also increasing the respawn time of dead Heroes at low levels. Now, getting early game Takedowns (and the experience associated with it) won’t give your team as much pure power as it did previously. Instead, early kills will offer a “power play” moment, in which your team can destroy enemy Structures, complete Battleground Events, or take more Mercenaries. These meaningful strategic advantages will position a team closer to victory, without giving them a large stat advantage and the ability to bully the opposing enemy team.  [b]Attack Speed Slows[/b] [list] [*]Attack speed slows now apply only to Heroes and Summons. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Fixed an issue that prevented Hero vision radiuses from displaying on Infernal Shrines and Battlefield of Eternity minimaps.  [/list]

battlefieldofeternity.name: 2015-10-06 Patch Notes v 14.0
battlefieldofeternity.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]A.I. Talent Selection[/b] [list] [*]A.I. controlled Heroes will now select their Talents from a group of preset Talent builds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] A.I. players will now choose from predetermined Talent builds instead of randomly selecting Talents. This is especially important for players who disconnect as the A.I. will now no longer randomly choose Talents, but instead try to pick builds that are closer to what players would expect. In addition, A.I. controlled Heroes in Versus A.I. games will also have their own Talent builds to choose from.  [b]Vehicles and Regeneration Globe Interaction[/b] [list] [*]Regeneration Globes will no longer heal Dragon Knights and Garden Terrors. [list] Instead, Regeneration Globe effects will now be applied directly to the Hero inside the Dragon Knight or Garden Terror. [/list] [*]Players within a Dragon Knight or Garden Terror can now also accumulate stacks for Talents such as Seasoned Marksman, Gathering Power, Regeneration Master, etc. [/list] [b]Summoned Unit Attacks[/b] [list] [*]Summoned unit Basic Attacks will now miss if that Summon is Blinded or the target is Evading. [*]Summoned unit Basic Attacks will no longer consume Block Talent stacks. [/list] Battleground Updates [list] [*][b]Immortal[/b] [list] Basic Attack damage increased from 360 (+22 per minute) to 360 (+25 per minute) after 11 minutes have passed, and 360 (+30 per minute) after 16 minutes [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Matches on Battlefield could occasionally go quite long as the Immortals weren’t scaling high enough into the late game. With this slight damage increase they’ll be more of a threat as the game progresses.

battlefieldofeternity.name: 2015-06-30 Patch Notes v 12.0
battlefieldofeternity.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  The conflict between the High Heavens and the Burning Hells has spilled into the Nexus, breeding a new Battleground that is equal parts righteous and wicked. Angels, Demons, and now Heroes clash in ceaseless combat in their struggle for dominance over the [b]Battlefield of Eternity[/b]. [list] [*]Battlefield of Eternity is a two-lane Battleground featuring two massive Immortals that battle endlessly at its center, and teams must compete to defeat the opposing Immortal. [*]Once its foe has been toppled, the victorious Immortal will be restored to full Health, and proceed to seek out enemy Structures, attacking down the lane with the most remaining defenses. [*]An attacking Immortal will also gain a Shield, proportionate to the amount of Health it had remaining at the end of the battle. [list] The Immortal will perform ranged attacks, which each consume a portion of its Shield. Taking damage will also drain the Immortal’s Shield. [*]Once its Shield has been expended, the Immortal will only attack at melee range. [/list] [/list] [b]New Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Fallen[/b] [b]Shaman[/b] [list] These malformed demons never stray too far from a pack of Fallen Hounds, and will quickly resurrect any Hounds that are killed in combat. Those who value their souls would be wise to first destroy the Shaman before targeting its Hound companions. [/list] [*][b]Khazra[/b] [list] The half human, half goat creatures that inhabit Battlefield of Eternity are tough, ranged attackers that won’t hesitate to rain spears on their foes. Defeat the Khazra at their camps to harness their destructive appetite before the enemy team. [/list] [/list] [b]New Battleground, More Often[/b] [list] [*]Starting today, the pool of Battlegrounds available in all modes, except Custom Games, will be temporarily limited to the following: [list] Battlefield of Eternity [*]Sky Temple [*]Tomb of the Spider Queen [*]Cursed Hollow [/list] [*]This has been done to increase the frequency with which players encounter the new Battleground, Battlefield of Eternity. [*]During this time, players can still select and play on any Battleground they wish using Custom Games. [*]All Battlegrounds, including Battlefield of Eternity, will once again be made available for play in all matchmaking game modes on Tuesday, July 7. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2018-12-11 Patch Notes v 2.41.0
dragonshire.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Catapults[/b] [list] [*]When a team destroys a Fort, they'll now gain a Catapult in every 3rd Minion wave. [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] In order to keep early-game Catapults from being too devastating to defending teams, Catapult attack splash size, attack range, and damage/health will gradually increase as the game progresses. [/list] [/list] [b]Experience Changes[/b] [list] [*]Removed all Experience earned from destroying a Fort or Keep [*]Destroying a Fort or Keep will now provide your team with a stacking 20% increase in Passively-earned Experience [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] Towers of Doom is exempt from all Experience and Catapult changes. [/list] [*]Decreased Experience earned from destroying Towers by 50% [*]Passive Experience gain increased by 15% [*]Increased Experience gained by defeating defending Mercenaries by 100% [list] ​Hanamura Temple and Volsksaya Foundry Item Camps are excluded from this change. [/list] [*]Laning Mercenary Experience [list] Defeating Laning Mercenaries will now grant 100% of Defending Mercenaries Experience. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] Thank you so much for all of the feedback regarding the 2019 Gameplay Updates. While there is still a lot of community speculation about the outcome of these changes, there has been a resounding amount of concern about the loss of Fort and Keep XP. We agree that the complete loss of XP from Forts and Keeps may reduce the incentive to kill them to unhealthy levels, especially at higher levels of play. In response, we have reintroduced XP to the structures in a way that will reward players for taking them early while granting a gradual increase in power instead of large bursts. This should reinforce our goal of making matches closer while also rewarding teams for destroying enemy structures as quick as possible. [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] After listening to feedback, we have decided to pull back the laning Mercenary change outlined in our 2019 gameplay updates in order to give winning teams more opportunities to pull ahead.  [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Boss Camps, Sentinel Camps (Hanamura Temple), and Support Camps (Volskaya Foundry) will now be flagged as Elite. [list] Elite Mercenary Camps are Unstoppable & Unbribable [/list] [/list] [b]Unit Radii[/b] [list] [*]The unit radius values for most Heroes has been reduced by 5-15% [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] In an effort to improve visual clarity when many heroes are on-screen, we've updated the art for the Hero Ring displayed underneath heroes. To reinforce this effort, we've also done a pass on the Unit Radii for all heroes. We understand that these radius adjustments will have a minor but intended impact on landing and dodging abilities, and as a result, felt that the 2019 Gameplay Updates were the best time to make these changes.

dragonshire.name: 2018-06-06 Balance Update v 2.33.1
dragonshire.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,000 to 1,200 [*]Keep experience increased from 1,650 to 2,050 [*][b]Towers of Doom[/b] [list] Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,100 to 1,200. [*]Keep experience increased from 1,900 to 2,050. [list] [b][b]Note:[/b] Towers of Doom Forts upgrade to Keeps when the Tunnels open, approximately 12 minutes into a match.[/b] [/list] [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] We're taking some of the experience offered by outer Towers and distributing it amongst other Structures in an effort to keep teams closer in levels for a little while longer. We still want to reward skillful play, but a team that completes the first objective is frequently able take out a lot of the opposing team's outer Structures. Not only did this open up a strategic advantage (Healing Fountains get destroyed, Fortifications provide less safety), but it also pushes the winning team further ahead. Usually, this results in one team reaching level 10 before their opponents, allowing them to snowball to an even greater lead. We'd like to instead slow down early game leads, so that winning teams have to play well for a longer period of time.

dragonshire.name: 2018-01-09 Patch Notes v 2.29.7
dragonshire.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Total Health regen over 5 seconds reduced from 11.7% Maximum Health to 9% [*]Total Mana regen over 5 seconds reduced from 7.8% Maximum Mana to 7% [/list] [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Knights[/b] [list] Defender Mage Knight [list] Spell Armor Aura amount increased from 15 to 20 [/list] [*]Laner Mage Knight [list] Spell Armor Aura amount reduced from 30 to 20 [/list] [/list] [/list] [b]Forts[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33%. [*]Fort Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [/list] [b]Keeps[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Health increased from 16,000 to 17,000  [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] As expected, our gameplay update for 2018 resulted in large changes to many of our game systems. While we’re overall happy with the direction of the update, there have been some unintended side effects that we’re hoping to remedy. We overestimated how much more powerful unlimited ammo would be for Structures, and as a result pushing mechanics have become too strong, resulting in lower game times on nearly all maps. We’re giving our towers some of their teeth back with this update, which should help teams hold pushes from Mercenary Camps and map events. We’re also making some tuning changes to some of our Mercenary Camps now that we have had some time to see how they have been performing. Hellbats and Knights in particular are pushing harder than we would like, so we’re reducing their power. We’re also taking a look at the Warhead Junction boss and reducing its early and mid-game pushing power, as right now it is too strong when combined with Nukes from the map event. Lastly, we are reducing the power of Regeneration Globes. While we like the new mini-game that Neutral Regen globes provide in the laning phase, we are not comfortable with how much they are currently benefitting the team that is ahead while they are pushing into a defending team. We’re also seeing players picking up more Regeneration Globes in general, so this will help to keep the game’s overall sustain in check. These are some hefty changes, and it’s likely that there will be more needed to be done over time as things continue to settle. We’ll be keeping an eye on things, and are prepared to make more updates as they’re needed.

[/list] [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Respawn Timers[/b] [list] Mercenary Camps will now spawn 60 seconds after the game begins [/list] [*][b]Siege Giant Camp[/b] [list] Siege Defenders [list] Defending Siege Giant attacks are now telegraphed on the terrain and can be dodged. [/list] [*]Siege Laners [list] Attack telegraphing and missile trajectory has been significantly improved. [/list] [/list] [*][b]Knight Camp[/b] [list] Wizard Knight Laner [list] Wizard Knight Laner has a Spell Armor Aura [list] Grants all nearby Allies (Minions, Mercenaries, and Heroes) 30 Spell Armor [list] Spell Armor is immediately removed upon leaving the aura area. [/list] [*]This Aura is destroyed when the Wizard is killed [/list] [/list] [*]Wizard Knight Defender [list] Grants nearby Knight Defenders a 15 Spell Armor aura [list] This Aura is destroyed when the Wizard is killed [/list] [/list] [/list] [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Structures:[/b] Auriel's Blinding Flash and Artanis' Suppression Pulse can no longer Blind Structures. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2017-09-26 Patch Notes v 2.28.0
dragonshire.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [b]Vehicles[/b] [list] [*]All vehicles, including the Dragon Knight, Garden Terror, and Triglav Protector are now Unstoppable. [*][b]Dragon Knight[/b] [list] ​Movement Speed reduced by 20% [*]Starting Health reduced from 9300 to 8350 [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] Prior to this patch, crowd control effects on vehicles were reduced by 50%. Initially, displacement effects affecting vehicles were not reduced at all. Over time, we’ve made the decision to make some abilities unable to target vehicles. As our hero roster grew, so did the amount of special rules associated with vehicle interactions. Instead of continuing to maintain a list of special interactions, we’ve opted to simplify the behavior and make vehicles Unstoppable. To compensate for the increased vehicle strength, we’ve also looked at each vehicle’s balance numbers.

dragonshire.name: 2017-01-04 Patch Notes v 22.5
dragonshire.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Armor & Vulnerability[/b]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] With today’s patch you will notice that a lot of our tooltips that used to reference the Resistant/Vulnerable system have been changed. Matthew Cooper [url=https:/us.battle.net/forums/en/heroes/topic/20752266255]detailed the changes on our forums[/url] last month explaining a bit about the new system. While the tooltips may have changed, the actual functionality for the system has been in since the Varian patch hit during the week of November 14, so the game itself should not feel any different than what you are currently used to. You will also notice that we have added baseline Armor to three Heroes – Arthas, Anub'arak, and Greymane’s Worgen Form. These are the first of a handful that we are planning to release and would love to hear any feedback you have. We are hoping that the Armor System will open up future design flexibility, increase the depth of strategy (both in game, and in draft), and grant us another knob to help balance the game.  Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Minimap:[/b] Catapult Minimap icons are now slightly lighter in color to help players more easily differentiate them from other Minions. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2016-09-13 Patch Notes v 20.0
dragonshire.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Mounts[/b] [list] [*]Movement Speed reduced from 40 to 30% [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Time before Globes despawn reduced from 8 to 6 seconds [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Timing Changes[/b] [list] Previously all Mercenary camps spawned at 120 seconds. The following adjustments have been made to spawn times: [list] 90 seconds: Sappers, Doubloon Pirates [*]120 seconds: Siege Giants (unchanged), Impalers (unchanged) [*]150 seconds: Knights, Fallen Shaman [*]180 seconds: Grave Golem (unchanged) [*]300 seconds: Headless Horseman (unchanged) [/list] [/list] [*]Captured Mercenaries will no longer grant Experience when killed. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We started playtesting with staggered Mercenary Camp spawn times, and quickly began to realize that it added more strategic depth to the game, and coincided with some of our Battleground events. We have been happy with the changes overall, and are listening to any feedback you may have!  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Heroes can no longer push captured Mercenaries by walking into them. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2016-08-09 Patch Notes v 19.4

[/list] [list] [*][b]Dragon Shire:[/b] The tooltip for the Dragon Knight’s Rubble Maker Trait no longer incorrectly states that it reduces the duration of Silence effects. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2016-07-27 Balance Update v 19.3
dragonshire.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Collision[/b]: Heroes can no longer be pushed by walking another Hero into them.  [/list] [list] [*][b]Collision[/b]: Heroes who are channeling an Ability can no longer be pushed when another Hero walks into them during the channel.  [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2016-07-12 Patch Notes v 19.0
dragonshire.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Victory determination is now much more precise in situations where both Cores are destroyed within fractions of a second. As a result, Victory will no longer be decided at random in cases where it appears that both Cores are destroyed at the same moment. [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 6.24% of maximum Health over 4 seconds [*]Now: Restore 12% of maximum Health over 5 seconds [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 32 Mana over 4 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 8% of maximum Mana over 5 seconds [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Thank you for all your discussion and feedback on our recent Health sustain post! We are still heavily evaluating a lot of it but wanted to get the first round of changes in. Internally, we enjoyed the increased importance on Regeneration Globes and have cleaned up the system a bit. With a larger importance, denying enemies their Globes in lane has a much larger impact.  [b]Healing Wells[/b] [list] [*]Cooldown increased from 100 to 120 seconds [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 41% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 40% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 20% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 30% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Much like the changes to Regeneration Globes, we wanted to add a larger impact to the moment you click a Healing Well. Again, we cleaned up the system a fair bit (hence the ~41% to 40% Health change) and added a larger impact for heavy Mana users. The increased cooldown should make the decision of when to tap the Healing Well slightly more interesting.  [b]Minions[/b] [list] [*][b]Ranged, Melee, and Wizard Minions[/b] [list] Now deal an additional 50% damage to Structures. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Our goal with this change is to make escorting Minions to Towns to be more impactful, such that they can really start to do some damage if left unattended. Before this change, Minions were primarily XP carriers that absorbed some Ammo shots from Towers. Now the armies of the Nexus are a bit scarier when they march down a lane.  [list] [*][b]Catapult Minions[/b] [list] Attack range increased by 20%. [*]Sight range increased by 17%. [*]Will now fixate on Structures. Catapults will not acquire a new target after fixating until the target is destroyed or the Catapult is killed. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Catapults would often reach the Core, but have a Minion wave spawn on them, distract them, and allow them to be killed off before doing any significant damage. With increased range and fixation on a Structure once they’ve started attacking, even one Catapult will more consistently punch through a Core’s Shield and do actual damage.  Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Dragon Shire:[/b] The Dragon Knight’s Savage Charge can no longer be cast on neutral Siege and Bruiser Mercenaries. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2016-05-17 Patch Notes v 18.0
dragonshire.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Healing Well[/b] [list] [*]25% of a Healing Well’s maximum Health has been converted into a Shield. Shield Regeneration delay of 8 seconds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We’ve noticed some rather un-fun behavior in the form of sniping Healing Wells over time using very long range Abilities. While we’re okay with players doing this to a degree, we found it was too effective given how little counterplay there was. To help solve this, turned a sizable portion of Healing Well Health into a Shield. This means that if you offer your Healing Well some respite from enemy attacks by chasing opponents away every now and then, it will start to regenerate some of that Shield. Only [b]you[/b] can protect Healing Wells from those pesky Arcane Orbs!  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Fixed an issue in which attacking enemy Walls at certain angles would cause the Hero’s Basic Attack animation to play, but deal no damage. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2016-04-27 Balance Update v 17.4
dragonshire.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*]Issuing a Mount command while holding down the right mouse button to move will no longer interrupt Mount channeling. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2016-03-29 Patch Notes v 17.0
dragonshire.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*][b]Dragon Knight[/b] [list] Now immune to Attack Speed slows applied by attacks from enemy Forts and Keeps [*][b]Savage Charge (W)[/b] [list] Targets punted by Savage Charge will no longer be stunned after landing [/list] [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We want to encourage players to be really aggressive and feel like they can tank shots from Forts and Keeps when piloting the Dragon Knight. The Attack Speed slows from these Structures were discouraging players from tanking the structures, and often led to a Dragon Knight having less than the desired impact.

dragonshire.name: 2016-03-01 Patch Notes v 16.3

dragonshire.name: 2016-02-02 Patch Notes v 16.0
dragonshire.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Battleground Monsters[/b] [list] [*]Battleground-specific creatures are now universally defined as [b]Monsters[/b] (ex: Neutral Garden Terrors, Sky Temple Guardians, etc.) [*]Several Talents and Abilities have been changed to reflect this new categorization, and the following no longer affect Monsters: [list] Mercenary Lord [*]Johanna's Knight Takes Pawn [*]Lunara's Cruel Bloom [*]Rexxar's Easy Prey and Bird of Prey [*]The Butcher's Chop Meat [/list] [*]The following now affect Monsters: [list] Anub'arak's Beetle, Juiced [*]Azmodan's Demonic Smite [/list] [*]Several Talents that could previously trigger against both captured Mercenaries and Minions will now only affect Minions (ex: Seasoned Marksman, Black Soulstone, etc.) [/list] Battleground Updates [list] [*][b]Dragon Knight[/b] [list] Damage reduction from Structures increased from 50% to 60% [*][b]Savage Charge (W)[/b] [list] Channel time reduced from 1.125 to 0.75 seconds [*]Cooldown increased from 8 to 10 seconds [/list] [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Since the Dragon Knight is flagged as a Hero, the increased structure damage was doing too much damage; Increasing Rubble Maker’s effectiveness to compensate felt appropriate. Savage Charge felt like a dead button a lot of the time due to the Ability’s long channel time. This change has made the button feel a lot better to press.  Battlegrounds [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Towers, Forts, and Keeps now deal 50% bonus damage to Heroes [*]Cores will now display an “Invulnerable” message if attacked by an enemy when no allied Keeps have been destroyed. [*]Structures can no longer be made Vulnerable [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] The scaling changes we released in December made it so Heroes could dive into Structures with impunity during the early game. Increasing the damage that Structures deal to Heroes allows defending players to feel a bit safer. We are exploring other fixes to help Structures feel more meaningful throughout the game and will release them when they are ready.  Bug Fixes [list] [*]AI-piloted Dragon Knights and Garden Terrors can now properly follow the player when pinged. [/list] [list] [*]Diagonally placed shrubs will now properly hide Heroes within them. [/list] [list] [*]Players punted out of an enemy Hall of Storms will no longer be persistently stunned if an enemy unit blocked the path of the punt. [/list] [list] [*]Silences will no longer prevent Heroes from entering a Dragon Knight or Garden Terror. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2015-12-21 Hotfix Patch v 15.4
dragonshire.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*]Fixed an issue that could cause Heroes to become stuck inside of a Gate after using certain Abilities. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2015-12-15 Patch Notes v 15.3
dragonshire.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*]Diagonally placed Shrubs will no longer sometimes fail to properly hide a Hero within. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2015-11-17 Patch Notes v 15.0
dragonshire.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Scaling Changes[/b] [list] [*]Health and damage scaling for all Heroes, Battleground Events, Minions, and Mercenaries has been changed from flat, additive values to values that are multiplicative by percentage. [*]A large portion of Heroes’ total scaling amounts, which were previously gained over the course of a game, have been added to their base values. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Due to the way that our old level scaling system worked, early game level discrepancies created a larger difference in power level than we liked. This often led to situations where a team could be up two or more levels early in a game, and use this advantage to create a larger lead. We didn’t feel that games were fun for the winning or losing team in these types of scenarios. As a result of these changes, all Heroes will have more power early, but gain less from each level. Battleground Events, Minions, Mercenaries, and Structures have all been adjusted to compensate for this and should feel close to what they did previously. The aim of these adjustments to the scaling system is to make level differences have a similar impact on your Hero’s statistics at all points in a game. Now, each level offers about 4% Health and 4% damage, which mirrors what late game leads felt like in our previous version of the game. It is important to note, that while being down a few levels will be less punishing than it was previously, Talent tier advantages can and will still have a noticeable impact on enemy engagements.  [b]Respawn Timers[/b] [list] [*]Respawn timers have been increased for levels 1 – 10. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] In order to reward players for getting early game Takedowns, we’re also increasing the respawn time of dead Heroes at low levels. Now, getting early game Takedowns (and the experience associated with it) won’t give your team as much pure power as it did previously. Instead, early kills will offer a “power play” moment, in which your team can destroy enemy Structures, complete Battleground Events, or take more Mercenaries. These meaningful strategic advantages will position a team closer to victory, without giving them a large stat advantage and the ability to bully the opposing enemy team.  [b]Attack Speed Slows[/b] [list] [*]Attack speed slows now apply only to Heroes and Summons. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2015-10-20 Patch Notes v 14.2
dragonshire.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*]Fixed an issue that caused abnormal Hero movement when a Dragon Knight or Garden Terror was killed or expired nearby. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2015-10-06 Patch Notes v 14.0
dragonshire.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]A.I. Talent Selection[/b] [list] [*]A.I. controlled Heroes will now select their Talents from a group of preset Talent builds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] A.I. players will now choose from predetermined Talent builds instead of randomly selecting Talents. This is especially important for players who disconnect as the A.I. will now no longer randomly choose Talents, but instead try to pick builds that are closer to what players would expect. In addition, A.I. controlled Heroes in Versus A.I. games will also have their own Talent builds to choose from.  [b]Vehicles and Regeneration Globe Interaction[/b] [list] [*]Regeneration Globes will no longer heal Dragon Knights and Garden Terrors. [list] Instead, Regeneration Globe effects will now be applied directly to the Hero inside the Dragon Knight or Garden Terror. [/list] [*]Players within a Dragon Knight or Garden Terror can now also accumulate stacks for Talents such as Seasoned Marksman, Gathering Power, Regeneration Master, etc. [/list] [b]Summoned Unit Attacks[/b] [list] [*]Summoned unit Basic Attacks will now miss if that Summon is Blinded or the target is Evading. [*]Summoned unit Basic Attacks will no longer consume Block Talent stacks. [/list] Battleground Updates [b]General[/b] [list] [*]A.I. controlled Heroes can now travel long distances more effectively, and will travel to take part in objectives from anywhere on the Battleground. [*]A.I. controlled Heroes will now wait near an objective until enough allies have arrived that they can commit to a team fight at that objective. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2015-08-18 Patch Notes v 13.0
dragonshire.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*]Enemy Heroes within a Dragon Knight or Garden Terror will no longer become unresponsive if that vehicle is killed by Sylvanas’ Unstable Poison.  [/list] [list] [*]Heroes that are near a Dragon Knight when it is killed will no longer exhibit unexpected movement behavior.  [/list]

dragonshire.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*]Leoric’s Drain Hope will no longer deal more damage than intended to player-controlled Dragon Knights or Garden Terrors after learning the Crushing Hope Talent. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2015-05-12 Patch Notes v 11.0
dragonshire.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*]Alerts proclaiming that the Core is under attack will no longer play when an enemy Hero is within range of the Core before a Keep has been destroyed. [/list] [list] [*]Fixed an issue that could cause Mercenary Camps on the Dragon Shire Battleground to permanently vanish when the Dragon Knight is killed. [/list] [list] [*]Heroes killed just before being struck by the Dragon Knight’s Savage Charge Ability will no longer fly to the location where they would have landed upon respawning. [/list] [list] [*]Players will no longer enter an infinite rejoin loop if both Cores are destroyed simultaneously, and victory will be assigned to one team at random. [list] [b]Please note: Randomly assigned victory/defeat is intended as a temporary solution, intended to fix the infinite rejoin loop as soon as possible. A more robust solution for games that end in a draw will be implemented with a future patch.[/b] [/list] [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2015-03-24 Patch Notes v 10.0
dragonshire.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]General[/b] [list] [*]In-game XP Changes [list] The in-game leveling curve has been adjusted slightly to slow down the first 10 team levels, though the amount of XP required to reach level 20 remains the same.  [/list] [/list] Battleground Updates [list] [*]Player-controlled Dragon Knights are now more resistant to disable effects. [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Mercenary initial and scaling XP has been reworked. [*]Mercenary Camp tooltips now indicate which Camps can be Bribed. [/list] [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Gate, Tower, Town Hall, and Wall Health reduced by approximately 10%. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Fixed a rare issue in which a Core with less than 1 Health could suddenly be destroyed without taking additional damage. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2015-02-10 Patch Notes v 9.0
dragonshire.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]General[/b] [list] [*]Human teams can now begin Coop games on either side of the Battleground, rather than only on the left side. [*]Collecting various Battleground items (Doubloons, Skulls, Seeds, Regeneration Globes) should now be more responsive. [/list] [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*][b]Core[/b] [list] The Core is now invulnerable until both the Keep and Fort in a single lane are destroyed. [list] This is now consistent with the way in which Catapult Minions are spawned. [/list] [/list] [*][b]Walls[/b] [list] Vision provided by Walls reduced by approximately 15%. [/list] [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Abathur’s Hivemind Talent can no longer benefit the Dragon Knight or player-controlled Garden Terrors. [/list] [list] [*]Battleground objective units such as Grave Golems, Garden Terrors, and Mercenaries will now become invulnerable while leashing.  [/list] [list] [*]Grave Golems, Mercenaries, and Minions will no longer completely ignore Structures affected by Zeratul’s Void Prison. [/list] [list] [*]Spirits created by Chen’s Storm, Earth, Fire Heroic Ability can no longer capture the Dragon Knight on Dragon Shire.  [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2015-01-13 Patch Notes v 8.0
dragonshire.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*][b]Core[/b] [list] Damage versus Heroes increased by 20% [*]Abathur’s Symbiote and Tassadar’s Plasma Shield can once again be cast on the Core. [/list] [*][b]Towers[/b] [list] The amount of time that towers are disabled while regenerating ammunition has been increased from 20 to 30 seconds. [list] This was done to align with a previous change, in which the rate of tower ammo regeneration was reduced to 1 per 15 seconds. As such, towers will now come back online with 2 ammunition. [/list] [/list] [/list] [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Grave Golem[/b] [list] [b]Root[/b] [list] Grave Golems will no longer pause when casting Root. [*]Root will now be cast on ranged Minions. [*]Heroic units will remain the preferred targets. [/list] [*][b]Stomp[/b] [list] The post-cast delay on Stomp has been removed. [*]Stomp will now be cast when there are at least 2 Heroic units around the Grave Golem, or at least 3 Minions. [*]Stomp will not be cast unless the Grave Golem is already stationary. [*]Stomp now deals increased damage versus Minions. [/list] [/list] [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Brightwing’s Phase Shift can no longer target the Dragon Statue while it is capturable on the Dragon Shire Battleground. [/list] [list] [*]Catapult Minions no longer deal half their intended damage, and once again deal area of effect damage around their target. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2014-12-02 Patch Notes v 7.1
dragonshire.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*]The Dragon Knight is no longer targetable by allied Abilities or Talents [/list] Battlegrounds [b]General[/b] [list] [*]Town Halls no longer contain all of a town’s experience points. While Town Halls retain a majority of the experience, the surrounding towers protecting the town now yield experience as well. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Heroes can no longer be affected by enemy abilities while within the allied Hall of Storms. [/list] [list] [*]Heroes with a permanent Cloak will now properly Decloak when exiting the Dragon Knight or Garden Terror.  [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2014-10-07 Patch Notes v 6.5
dragonshire.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]General[/b] [list] [*]Minimap icons for the underground Grave Golem on the Haunted Mines, and neutral Garden Terrors on the Garden of Terror, no longer blink when they are in combat [*]Minion damage dealt to opposing Minions has been reduced, allowing for stronger pushes with Minions in unattended lanes [/list] [b]Mercenary Camps[/b] [list] [*][b]Knight Mercenary Camp[/b] [list] The Healer Mercenary no longer heals other Mercenaries or Minions, and now casts a damaging Arcane Bolt on enemies instead. [/list] [/list] [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]The Core now regenerates Shields after it has not taken damage for [b]8 seconds[/b], rather than [b]10[/b] seconds. [*]Towers, Forts, and Keeps now regenerate Ammunition once every [b]15 seconds[/b], rather than once every [b]10 seconds[/b]. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Attacking a Mercenary Camp at the moment it spawns will no longer cause the defending Mercenaries’ Health to reset mid-fight. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2014-09-10 Patch Notes v 5.0
dragonshire.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Health Regeneration has been removed from the Core, but Shield regeneration is unchanged. [/list] [b]Siege Giants[/b] [list] [*]Health regeneration when Siege Giants are out of combat for 8 or more seconds has been removed. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Corrected an issue in which Towers could unintentionally see through certain Line of Sight blockers. [/list] [list] [*]Forts and Keeps will no longer expend ammo without firing when a player quickly moves in and out of range. [/list] [list] [*]Mercenary Camps that are captured simultaneously by one team with the Mercenary Lord Talent, and one without, no longer causes the Mercenaries from both Camps to gain the Mercenary Lord buff. [/list] [list] [*]Pings issued on Mercenary Camps no longer require the player to target an individual Mercenary in order to request assistance with capturing the Camp. [/list] [list] [*]Uncaptured Mercenary Camps now appropriately reactivate when a player exits a Dragon Knight or Garden Terror.  [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2014-07-23 Patch Notes v 2.5
dragonshire.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]General[/b] [list] [*]The amount of in-game experience required to reach levels 2-19 has been increased by approximately 6%. [/list] [b]Underdog Bonus[/b] [list] [*]The amount of XP received from Hero takedowns is now more granular. [*]This will now have less impact during close games. [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Health now scales throughout the game. [*]Splash damage radius increased from 1.5 to 2. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2014-06-25 Patch Notes v 2.5
dragonshire.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*]Player controlled Dragon Knight duration now increases by 2 seconds for each minute of elapsed game time.​ [/list] General [b]Experience and Snowballing[/b] [list] [*]Experience earned by killing Minions in-lane has been increased by 20%. [*]Bonus trickle experience granted to a team that is behind by 3 or more levels during a game has been removed. [*]Early implementation for the “Underdog Bonus” has been added. [list] A team that is behind in levels – the “underdog” – now earns bonus XP whenever an enemy hero is killed, while a team that is ahead in levels receives reduced XP for killing enemy heroes. [*]The amount of bonus takedown XP granted to the underdog team, as well as reduced takedown XP for the team that’s ahead, scale significantly up based on the level difference between teams. [*]The Underdog Bonus starts at a 1 level difference, and caps off at a 4 level gap. [*]The Underdog Bonus continues until team levels become even. [/list] [*][b][url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/14502320]Head here[/url][/b] to check out additional details on the Underdog Bonus, as well as reasoning behind why we’re trying out this new system. [/list] Mercenaries [b]General[/b] [list] [*]Mercenary Camps now scale up to 30 minutes of elapsed game time. [*]Captured Mercenaries now scale up to 60 minutes of elapsed game time. [/list] [b]Grave Golem[/b] [list] [*]Captured Mercenary Grave Golems are now roughly equivalent in strength to a 30 Skull Grave Golem on the Haunted Mines. [*]Mercenary Grave Golems now seek out structures and ignore Heroes, Minions, and Mercenaries in their path. [*]Mercenary Grave Golems no longer only stomp Minions. [list] Increased the number of Heroic targets required for a Mercenary Grave Golem to issue a stomp from [b]1[/b] to [b]2[/b]. [/list] [/list] [b]Knights[/b] [list] [*][b]Sorcerer[/b] [list] No longer shields other Knights [*]Damage aura has been removed [*]Now heals other Knights and surrounding minions. [/list] [/list] [b]Siege Giants[/b] [list] [*]Defending Siege Giant attacks can no longer be dodged. [list] Siege Giant Attack Damage has been reduced from 100 to 80 in order to compensate for this change. [/list] [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]A number of issues with Mercenary Camp and Minion A.I. have been resolved, and behaviors have been generally improved. [/list] [list] [*]Addressed issues which made shrubs that have units within difficult to enter. It is now easier to attack units which are inside a shrub, as well. [/list] [list] [*]Fixed an issue that could cause a player to lose control of their hero if the Dragon Knight was killed while they were controlling it. [/list] [list] [*]The Core’s Health bar no longer displays 0% when it has less than 100 Health remaining. [/list]

dragonshire.name: 2014-05-22 Patch Notes v 2.5
dragonshire.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Snowballing[/b] [list] [*]Additional efforts have been made to prevent snowballing for teams that are down by 3 or more levels during a game. [/list] [b]General[/b] [list] [*]The team level cap has been increased from 25 to 30 [/list] Battlegrounds [b]General[/b] [list] [*]The Grave Golem’s root ability now prioritizes MULEs [*]Knight Mercenary Camp respawn time has been increased from 240 to 270 seconds [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Combat sounds and effects are no longer audible, nor visible, through the Fog of War. [/list] [list] [*]Dragon Shire Mercenary Camp respawn timers are no longer drastically reduced when the Dragon Knight expires. [/list] [list] [*]Fixed an issue on Dragon Shire that could cause Brightwing to clip into the terrain after being punted by the Dragon Knight’s Savage Charge ability. [/list] [list] [*]Heroes should no longer attempt to path through enemy Gates when given a long-distance move command toward objectives on the opposite side of a Battleground. dragonshire.name: 2014-03-25 Hotfix Patch build 29562

infernalshrines.name: 2019-04-30 Patch Notes v 2.45.0
infernalshrines.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*]Re-tuned the damage across all three Punisher types to bring them closer in parity [list] Arcane Punisher [list] Arcane damage increased from 52 to 53 [*]Arcane damage scaling reduced from 11 to 8 per minute [/list] [*]Frozen Punisher [list] Frozen damage base increased from 110 to 120 [*]Frozen area increased from 3 to 3.25 [*]Number of Frozen explosions reduced from 6 to 5 [*]When Frozen explosions damage an enemy Structure, they are disabled for 3 seconds [/list] [*]Mortar Punisher [list] Mortar damage base increased from 90 to 115 [*]Mortar damage scaling increased from 5 to 17 per minute [/list] [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] These changes are designed to bring the 3 types of Punishers more closely aligned in power, while preserving what makes them special. Mortar is now a properly scary amount of damage up front, while Arcane had its damage reduced but maintains the highest damage over a long period of time. Frozen has had structure disabled added to it, further encouraging teams to dive into enemy towns alongside him.

infernalshrines.name: 2018-12-11 Patch Notes v 2.41.0
infernalshrines.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Catapults[/b] [list] [*]When a team destroys a Fort, they'll now gain a Catapult in every 3rd Minion wave. [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] In order to keep early-game Catapults from being too devastating to defending teams, Catapult attack splash size, attack range, and damage/health will gradually increase as the game progresses. [/list] [/list] [b]Experience Changes[/b] [list] [*]Removed all Experience earned from destroying a Fort or Keep [*]Destroying a Fort or Keep will now provide your team with a stacking 20% increase in Passively-earned Experience [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] Towers of Doom is exempt from all Experience and Catapult changes. [/list] [*]Decreased Experience earned from destroying Towers by 50% [*]Passive Experience gain increased by 15% [*]Increased Experience gained by defeating defending Mercenaries by 100% [list] ​Hanamura Temple and Volsksaya Foundry Item Camps are excluded from this change. [/list] [*]Laning Mercenary Experience [list] Defeating Laning Mercenaries will now grant 100% of Defending Mercenaries Experience. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] Thank you so much for all of the feedback regarding the 2019 Gameplay Updates. While there is still a lot of community speculation about the outcome of these changes, there has been a resounding amount of concern about the loss of Fort and Keep XP. We agree that the complete loss of XP from Forts and Keeps may reduce the incentive to kill them to unhealthy levels, especially at higher levels of play. In response, we have reintroduced XP to the structures in a way that will reward players for taking them early while granting a gradual increase in power instead of large bursts. This should reinforce our goal of making matches closer while also rewarding teams for destroying enemy structures as quick as possible. [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] After listening to feedback, we have decided to pull back the laning Mercenary change outlined in our 2019 gameplay updates in order to give winning teams more opportunities to pull ahead.  [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Boss Camps, Sentinel Camps (Hanamura Temple), and Support Camps (Volskaya Foundry) will now be flagged as Elite. [list] Elite Mercenary Camps are Unstoppable & Unbribable [/list] [/list] [b]Unit Radii[/b] [list] [*]The unit radius values for most Heroes has been reduced by 5-15% [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] In an effort to improve visual clarity when many heroes are on-screen, we've updated the art for the Hero Ring displayed underneath heroes. To reinforce this effort, we've also done a pass on the Unit Radii for all heroes. We understand that these radius adjustments will have a minor but intended impact on landing and dodging abilities, and as a result, felt that the 2019 Gameplay Updates were the best time to make these changes.

infernalshrines.name: 2018-06-06 Balance Update v 2.33.1
infernalshrines.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,000 to 1,200 [*]Keep experience increased from 1,650 to 2,050 [*][b]Towers of Doom[/b] [list] Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,100 to 1,200. [*]Keep experience increased from 1,900 to 2,050. [list] [b][b]Note:[/b] Towers of Doom Forts upgrade to Keeps when the Tunnels open, approximately 12 minutes into a match.[/b] [/list] [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] We're taking some of the experience offered by outer Towers and distributing it amongst other Structures in an effort to keep teams closer in levels for a little while longer. We still want to reward skillful play, but a team that completes the first objective is frequently able take out a lot of the opposing team's outer Structures. Not only did this open up a strategic advantage (Healing Fountains get destroyed, Fortifications provide less safety), but it also pushes the winning team further ahead. Usually, this results in one team reaching level 10 before their opponents, allowing them to snowball to an even greater lead. We'd like to instead slow down early game leads, so that winning teams have to play well for a longer period of time.

infernalshrines.name: 2018-03-06 Patch Notes v 2.30.4

infernalshrines.name: 2018-01-09 Patch Notes v 2.29.7
infernalshrines.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Total Health regen over 5 seconds reduced from 11.7% Maximum Health to 9% [*]Total Mana regen over 5 seconds reduced from 7.8% Maximum Mana to 7% [/list] [b]Forts[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33%.  [*]Fort Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [/list] [b]Keeps[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Health increased from 16,000 to 17,000 [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] As expected, our gameplay update for 2018 resulted in large changes to many of our game systems. While we’re overall happy with the direction of the update, there have been some unintended side effects that we’re hoping to remedy. We overestimated how much more powerful unlimited ammo would be for Structures, and as a result pushing mechanics have become too strong, resulting in lower game times on nearly all maps. We’re giving our towers some of their teeth back with this update, which should help teams hold pushes from Mercenary Camps and map events. We’re also making some tuning changes to some of our Mercenary Camps now that we have had some time to see how they have been performing. Hellbats and Knights in particular are pushing harder than we would like, so we’re reducing their power. We’re also taking a look at the Warhead Junction boss and reducing its early and mid-game pushing power, as right now it is too strong when combined with Nukes from the map event. Lastly, we are reducing the power of Regeneration Globes. While we like the new mini-game that Neutral Regen globes provide in the laning phase, we are not comfortable with how much they are currently benefitting the team that is ahead while they are pushing into a defending team. We’re also seeing players picking up more Regeneration Globes in general, so this will help to keep the game’s overall sustain in check. These are some hefty changes, and it’s likely that there will be more needed to be done over time as things continue to settle. We’ll be keeping an eye on things, and are prepared to make more updates as they’re needed.

infernalshrines.name: 2017-01-04 Patch Notes v 22.5
infernalshrines.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Armor & Vulnerability[/b]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] With today’s patch you will notice that a lot of our tooltips that used to reference the Resistant/Vulnerable system have been changed. Matthew Cooper [url=https:/us.battle.net/forums/en/heroes/topic/20752266255]detailed the changes on our forums[/url] last month explaining a bit about the new system. While the tooltips may have changed, the actual functionality for the system has been in since the Varian patch hit during the week of November 14, so the game itself should not feel any different than what you are currently used to. You will also notice that we have added baseline Armor to three Heroes – Arthas, Anub'arak, and Greymane’s Worgen Form. These are the first of a handful that we are planning to release and would love to hear any feedback you have. We are hoping that the Armor System will open up future design flexibility, increase the depth of strategy (both in game, and in draft), and grant us another knob to help balance the game.  Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Battlefield of Eternity & Infernal Shrines:[/b] Fixed an animation pop affecting Towers on the Heaven side of Diablo-themed Battlegrounds. [/list] [list] [*][b]Core:[/b] Fixed an issue that could prevent the Core on the Hell side of Battlefield of Eternity and Infernal Shrines from playing certain attack sounds. [/list] [list] [*][b]Minimap:[/b] Catapult Minimap icons are now slightly lighter in color to help players more easily differentiate them from other Minions. [/list]

infernalshrines.name: 2016-09-13 Patch Notes v 20.0
infernalshrines.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Mounts[/b] [list] [*]Movement Speed reduced from 40 to 30% [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Time before Globes despawn reduced from 8 to 6 seconds [/list] Battleground Updates [list] [*][b]Khazra Impaler[/b] [list] Captured Impaler attack damage increased from 40 to 46 [/list] [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Timing Changes[/b] [list] Previously all Mercenary camps spawned at 120 seconds. The following adjustments have been made to spawn times: [list] 90 seconds: Sappers, Doubloon Pirates [*]120 seconds: Siege Giants (unchanged), Impalers (unchanged) [*]150 seconds: Knights, Fallen Shaman [*]180 seconds: Grave Golem (unchanged) [*]300 seconds: Headless Horseman (unchanged) [/list] [/list] [*]Captured Mercenaries will no longer grant Experience when killed. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We started playtesting with staggered Mercenary Camp spawn times, and quickly began to realize that it added more strategic depth to the game, and coincided with some of our Battleground events. We have been happy with the changes overall, and are listening to any feedback you may have!  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Heroes can no longer push captured Mercenaries by walking into them. [/list]

infernalshrines.name: 2016-07-12 Patch Notes v 19.0
infernalshrines.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Victory determination is now much more precise in situations where both Cores are destroyed within fractions of a second. As a result, Victory will no longer be decided at random in cases where it appears that both Cores are destroyed at the same moment. [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 6.24% of maximum Health over 4 seconds [*]Now: Restore 12% of maximum Health over 5 seconds [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 32 Mana over 4 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 8% of maximum Mana over 5 seconds [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Thank you for all your discussion and feedback on our recent Health sustain post! We are still heavily evaluating a lot of it but wanted to get the first round of changes in. Internally, we enjoyed the increased importance on Regeneration Globes and have cleaned up the system a bit. With a larger importance, denying enemies their Globes in lane has a much larger impact.  [b]Healing Wells[/b] [list] [*]Cooldown increased from 100 to 120 seconds [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 41% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 40% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 20% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 30% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Much like the changes to Regeneration Globes, we wanted to add a larger impact to the moment you click a Healing Well. Again, we cleaned up the system a fair bit (hence the ~41% to 40% Health change) and added a larger impact for heavy Mana users. The increased cooldown should make the decision of when to tap the Healing Well slightly more interesting.  [b]Minions[/b] [list] [*][b]Ranged, Melee, and Wizard Minions[/b] [list] Now deal an additional 50% damage to Structures. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Our goal with this change is to make escorting Minions to Towns to be more impactful, such that they can really start to do some damage if left unattended. Before this change, Minions were primarily XP carriers that absorbed some Ammo shots from Towers. Now the armies of the Nexus are a bit scarier when they march down a lane.  [list] [*][b]Catapult Minions[/b] [list] Attack range increased by 20%. [*]Sight range increased by 17%. [*]Will now fixate on Structures. Catapults will not acquire a new target after fixating until the target is destroyed or the Catapult is killed. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Catapults would often reach the Core, but have a Minion wave spawn on them, distract them, and allow them to be killed off before doing any significant damage. With increased range and fixation on a Structure once they’ve started attacking, even one Catapult will more consistently punch through a Core’s Shield and do actual damage.  Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Infernal Shrines:[/b] Punishers will no longer prefer to attack non-Heroic enemies that are affected by Abathur’s Symbiote over enemy Heroes. [/list]

infernalshrines.name: 2016-05-17 Patch Notes v 18.0
infernalshrines.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Healing Well[/b] [list] [*]25% of a Healing Well’s maximum Health has been converted into a Shield. Shield Regeneration delay of 8 seconds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We’ve noticed some rather un-fun behavior in the form of sniping Healing Wells over time using very long range Abilities. While we’re okay with players doing this to a degree, we found it was too effective given how little counterplay there was. To help solve this, turned a sizable portion of Healing Well Health into a Shield. This means that if you offer your Healing Well some respite from enemy attacks by chasing opponents away every now and then, it will start to regenerate some of that Shield. Only [b]you[/b] can protect Healing Wells from those pesky Arcane Orbs!  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Fixed an issue in which attacking enemy Walls at certain angles would cause the Hero’s Basic Attack animation to play, but deal no damage. [/list]

infernalshrines.name: 2016-04-19 Patch Notes v 17.2
infernalshrines.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*][b]Punisher[/b] [list] Punisher starting Health has been increased, and scaling Health has been reduced to compensate. [*][b]Frozen Punisher[/b] [list] Delay between ice trap spawn and detonation decreased from 2.5 to 2 seconds. [*]Root duration while frozen decreased from 2 to 1.5 seconds. [/list] [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Although we are very happy with the current tuning of Infernal Shrines, we have been noticing a tendency to under-value the first couple of Punishers. In order to help incentivize players into valuing them, we have boosted their starting Health and decreased their early scaling values to compensate. While early event Punishers should be a bit stronger, any event past the 15-minute mark should be identical to those from the previous patch.  Frozen Punishers are great at zoning enemy teams but we felt they were a bit too easy to avoid without preliminary team initiation. These changes should increase the frequency in which players get rooted, while feeling a little less punishing when this occurs.  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Fixed an issue in which a Punisher that leaps to a Hero as that Hero activates Hearthstone could cause it to leap to the opposing Hall of Storms. infernalshrines.name: 2016-02-02 Patch Notes v 16.0
infernalshrines.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Battleground Monsters[/b] [list] [*]Battleground-specific creatures are now universally defined as [b]Monsters[/b] (ex: Neutral Garden Terrors, Sky Temple Guardians, etc.) [*]Several Talents and Abilities have been changed to reflect this new categorization, and the following no longer affect Monsters: [list] Mercenary Lord [*]Johanna's Knight Takes Pawn [*]Lunara's Cruel Bloom [*]Rexxar's Easy Prey and Bird of Prey [*]The Butcher's Chop Meat [/list] [*]The following now affect Monsters: [list] Anub'arak's Beetle, Juiced [*]Azmodan's Demonic Smite [/list] [*]Several Talents that could previously trigger against both captured Mercenaries and Minions will now only affect Minions (ex: Seasoned Marksman, Black Soulstone, etc.) [/list] Battleground Updates [list] [*]The minimap now more clearly indicates when a Shrine is ready to activate [*][b]Arcane Punisher[/b] [list] Arcane Sentry damage reduced by 20% [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] The Arcane Punishers have shown to be more effective than their Frozen and Mortar counterparts, so we lowered their Arcane Sentry damage to bring them more in line with other Punisher types.  Battlegrounds [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Towers, Forts, and Keeps now deal 50% bonus damage to Heroes [*]Cores will now display an “Invulnerable” message if attacked by an enemy when no allied Keeps have been destroyed. [*]Structures can no longer be made Vulnerable [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] The scaling changes we released in December made it so Heroes could dive into Structures with impunity during the early game. Increasing the damage that Structures deal to Heroes allows defending players to feel a bit safer. We are exploring other fixes to help Structures feel more meaningful throughout the game and will release them when they are ready.  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Diagonally placed shrubs will now properly hide Heroes within them. [/list] [list] [*]Players punted out of an enemy Hall of Storms will no longer be persistently stunned if an enemy unit blocked the path of the punt. [/list]

infernalshrines.name: 2015-12-15 Patch Notes v 15.3
