infernalshrines.name: 2015-11-17 Patch Notes v 15.0
infernalshrines.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Scaling Changes[/b] [list] [*]Health and damage scaling for all Heroes, Battleground Events, Minions, and Mercenaries has been changed from flat, additive values to values that are multiplicative by percentage. [*]A large portion of Heroes’ total scaling amounts, which were previously gained over the course of a game, have been added to their base values. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Due to the way that our old level scaling system worked, early game level discrepancies created a larger difference in power level than we liked. This often led to situations where a team could be up two or more levels early in a game, and use this advantage to create a larger lead. We didn’t feel that games were fun for the winning or losing team in these types of scenarios. As a result of these changes, all Heroes will have more power early, but gain less from each level. Battleground Events, Minions, Mercenaries, and Structures have all been adjusted to compensate for this and should feel close to what they did previously. The aim of these adjustments to the scaling system is to make level differences have a similar impact on your Hero’s statistics at all points in a game. Now, each level offers about 4% Health and 4% damage, which mirrors what late game leads felt like in our previous version of the game. It is important to note, that while being down a few levels will be less punishing than it was previously, Talent tier advantages can and will still have a noticeable impact on enemy engagements.  [b]Respawn Timers[/b] [list] [*]Respawn timers have been increased for levels 1 – 10. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] In order to reward players for getting early game Takedowns, we’re also increasing the respawn time of dead Heroes at low levels. Now, getting early game Takedowns (and the experience associated with it) won’t give your team as much pure power as it did previously. Instead, early kills will offer a “power play” moment, in which your team can destroy enemy Structures, complete Battleground Events, or take more Mercenaries. These meaningful strategic advantages will position a team closer to victory, without giving them a large stat advantage and the ability to bully the opposing enemy team.  [b]Attack Speed Slows[/b] [list] [*]Attack speed slows now apply only to Heroes and Summons. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Fixed an issue that prevented Hero vision radiuses from displaying on Infernal Shrines and Battlefield of Eternity minimaps.  [/list]

infernalshrines.name: 2015-10-06 Patch Notes v 14.0
infernalshrines.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]A.I. Talent Selection[/b] [list] [*]A.I. controlled Heroes will now select their Talents from a group of preset Talent builds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] A.I. players will now choose from predetermined Talent builds instead of randomly selecting Talents. This is especially important for players who disconnect as the A.I. will now no longer randomly choose Talents, but instead try to pick builds that are closer to what players would expect. In addition, A.I. controlled Heroes in Versus A.I. games will also have their own Talent builds to choose from.  [b]Vehicles and Regeneration Globe Interaction[/b] [list] [*]Regeneration Globes will no longer heal Dragon Knights and Garden Terrors. [list] Instead, Regeneration Globe effects will now be applied directly to the Hero inside the Dragon Knight or Garden Terror. [/list] [*]Players within a Dragon Knight or Garden Terror can now also accumulate stacks for Talents such as Seasoned Marksman, Gathering Power, Regeneration Master, etc. [/list] [b]Summoned Unit Attacks[/b] [list] [*]Summoned unit Basic Attacks will now miss if that Summon is Blinded or the target is Evading. [*]Summoned unit Basic Attacks will no longer consume Block Talent stacks. [/list] Battleground Updates [list] [*][b]Punisher[/b] [list] Starting and scaling Health decreased by 10% [*]Now leap to the nearest enemy Hero within range, rather than selecting one at random [/list] [*][b]Skeletal Defenders[/b] [list] The amount of Skeletal Defenders required to summon a Punisher has been increased from 30 to 40. [*]Skeletal Defenders will no longer take increased damage from abilities and talents that deal bonus damage to minions. [*]The range at which Skeletal Defenders will detect and attack players has been decreased by 25% [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Player feedback has been centered around how hard it is to comeback when falling behind on Infernal Shrines. We agree that the Punishers are overly punishing, so we’re nerfing their Health slightly. Teams that successfully bait the Punishers deep within their base will be able to put an end to this threat sooner.  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Corrected an issue that could cause Punishers to prioritize attacking enemy Structures after initially targeting a Hero. [/list] [list] [*]Fixed an issue that allowed Punishers to attack structures while enraged on the Infernal Shrines Battleground. [/list] [list] [*]Skeletal Defender Health will now properly scale over time on the Infernal Shrines Battleground. [/list]

infernalshrines.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*]Infernal Shrines has been added and is now available for play in all game modes. [/list] [b]Battleground Rotation: August 26 – September 2[/b] [list] [*]For one week following today’s update, the number of Battlegrounds available in matchmaking game modes will be temporarily reduced to six, so that players will have more opportunity to play on Infernal Shrines. The following Battlegrounds will be available for play in matchmaking during this time: [list] Infernal Shrines [*]Battlefield of Eternity [*]Cursed Hollow [*]Dragon Shire [*]Sky Temple [*]Tomb of the Spider Queen [/list] [*]Blackheart’s Bay, Haunted Mines, and Garden of Terror will not be available in matchmaking game modes during this time, but can still be accessed using Custom Games. [*]On Wednesday, September 2, all nine Battlegrounds will become playable in matchmaking game modes once more. [/list]

infernalshrines.name: 2015-08-18 Patch Notes v 13.0
infernalshrines.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*]This three-lane Battleground features three Infernal Shrines that will periodically gather power. Only one Shrine will gather power at any given time, and either team can activate it to unleash its might. [*]Once activated, the Shrine’s Guardians will pour forth in waves to defend it. The first team to kill 30 Guardians will summon a devastating Punisher to fight for their cause. [*]A Punisher is a powerful boss that will attack down the lane that corresponds with the Shrine it was summoned from. Punishers will hunt down any nearby enemy Heroes that cross its path, and can spawn with one of three deadly affixes: [list] [b]Arcane[/b] – The Punisher summons beams of arcane energy which rotate in a circular motion, and deal massive damage to enemy targets they pass through. [*][b]Frozen[/b] – The Punisher calls forth frigid ice shards, which explode after a short delay, dealing damage and freezing enemies in place for a short time. [*][b]Mortar[/b] – The Punisher launches a stream of firebombs high into the air, which explode and deal damage to any enemies they strike upon landing. [/list] [/list]

volskayafoundry.name: 2019-04-30 Patch Notes v 2.45.0
volskayafoundry.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*]Triglav Protector [list] Swap Vehicle (R) [list] Removed [/list] [*]Pilot [list] Now properly scales Health and Basic Attack damage at the first minute of a game [*]Basic Attacks [list] Starting damage reduced from 200 to 140 [*]Scaling damage reduced from 10 to 7 from minutes 1 to 5 [*]Scaling damage reduced from 15 to 10.5 from minutes 6 to 10 [*]Scaling damage reduced from 20 to 14 from minutes 11 to 15 [*]Scaling damage reduced from 25 to 17.5 from minutes 16 to 20 [*]Scaling damage reduced from 30 to 21 from minutes 21 to 60 [*]Now deal 50% bonus damage to Structures [/list] [*]Health [list] Health scaling increased from 1100 to 1375 from minutes 16 to 20 [*]Health scaling increased from 1375 to 1650 from minutes 21 to 25 [/list] [*]Charge (Q) [list] Impact radius reduced from 2.5 to 2 [*]Starting damage decreased from 225 to 140 [*]Scaling damage decreased from 20 to 14 per minute [*]Damage bonus to non-Heroes increased from 200% to 400% [/list] [*]Rocket Fist (W) [list] Width increased from 1 to 1.5 [*]No longer roots Heroes, but knocks them back equal to the full distance the Rocket Fist would travel instead [*]Starting damage reduced from 200 to 150 [*]Scaling damage increased from 10 to 15 per minute [/list] [/list] [*]Gunner [list] Particle Cannon (Q) [list] Starting damage decreased from 225 to 190 [*]Scaling damage increased from 15 to 19 per minute [/list] [*]Gatling Cannon (W) [list] Impact radius reduced from 0.5 to 0.3 [*]Starting damage reduced from 45 to 38 [*]Scaling damage increased from 3.5 to 3.8 per minute [/list] [*]Scorching Laser (E) [list] Impact radius reduced from 2.25 to 1.25 [*]Starting primary impact damage reduced 75 to 60 [*]Scaling primary impact damage increased from 3 to 6 per minute [*]Starting delayed explosion damage reduced from 500 to 380 [*]Scaling delayed explosion damage increased from 25 to 38 per minute [/list] [/list] [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] We're making these changes to the Triglav Protector to shift a little of the vehicles power out of its team fight potential, and into its pushing power (particularly in the early game). We believe that it has to have some teeth to discourage enemies from committing to a team fight when it pushes, but its capability to nuke someone from almost full health was a little too powerful. We've changed Rocket Fist's root into a knockback to make landing all its abilities more difficult as well, but still force enemies to disengage when it connects. We've also taken this time to adjust some of the scaling of the Protector, so that it follows a more typical power curve in relation to Heroes, Minions, and Mercenaries. We've removed the Swap Vehicle button as well. While it was cool, it was a hold out from the previous undesired gameplay of a solo player controlling both seats of a vehicle that we discouraged via the Spell Power buff to both seats being occupied.

volskayafoundry.name: 2018-12-11 Patch Notes v 2.41.0
volskayafoundry.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Catapults[/b] [list] [*]When a team destroys a Fort, they'll now gain a Catapult in every 3rd Minion wave. [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] In order to keep early-game Catapults from being too devastating to defending teams, Catapult attack splash size, attack range, and damage/health will gradually increase as the game progresses. [/list] [/list] [b]Experience Changes[/b] [list] [*]Removed all Experience earned from destroying a Fort or Keep [*]Destroying a Fort or Keep will now provide your team with a stacking 20% increase in Passively-earned Experience [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] Towers of Doom is exempt from all Experience and Catapult changes. [/list] [*]Decreased Experience earned from destroying Towers by 50% [*]Passive Experience gain increased by 15% [*]Increased Experience gained by defeating defending Mercenaries by 100% [list] ​Hanamura Temple and Volsksaya Foundry Item Camps are excluded from this change. [/list] [*]Laning Mercenary Experience [list] Defeating Laning Mercenaries will now grant 100% of Defending Mercenaries Experience. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] Thank you so much for all of the feedback regarding the 2019 Gameplay Updates. While there is still a lot of community speculation about the outcome of these changes, there has been a resounding amount of concern about the loss of Fort and Keep XP. We agree that the complete loss of XP from Forts and Keeps may reduce the incentive to kill them to unhealthy levels, especially at higher levels of play. In response, we have reintroduced XP to the structures in a way that will reward players for taking them early while granting a gradual increase in power instead of large bursts. This should reinforce our goal of making matches closer while also rewarding teams for destroying enemy structures as quick as possible. [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] After listening to feedback, we have decided to pull back the laning Mercenary change outlined in our 2019 gameplay updates in order to give winning teams more opportunities to pull ahead.  [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Boss Camps, Sentinel Camps (Hanamura Temple), and Support Camps (Volskaya Foundry) will now be flagged as Elite. [list] Elite Mercenary Camps are Unstoppable & Unbribable [/list] [/list] [b]Unit Radii[/b] [list] [*]The unit radius values for most Heroes has been reduced by 5-15% [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] In an effort to improve visual clarity when many heroes are on-screen, we've updated the art for the Hero Ring displayed underneath heroes. To reinforce this effort, we've also done a pass on the Unit Radii for all heroes. We understand that these radius adjustments will have a minor but intended impact on landing and dodging abilities, and as a result, felt that the 2019 Gameplay Updates were the best time to make these changes.  Battleground Updates [list] [*]Channelling to enter the Triglav Protector is no longer interrupted by damage. [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] This change has been live as of the week of November 19 [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] While not a bug, the interaction between Orphea's Eternal Feast and the Triglav Protector was too strong and could negate an entire objective without any opportunities for counter-play attached to it. This also highlighted an inconsistency with the battleground where a team could spend all their resources winning the objective but find themselves unable to actually use it under certain circumstances so with this change, we've addressed both issues.

volskayafoundry.name: 2018-06-06 Balance Update v 2.33.1
volskayafoundry.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,000 to 1,200 [*]Keep experience increased from 1,650 to 2,050 [*][b]Towers of Doom[/b] [list] Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,100 to 1,200. [*]Keep experience increased from 1,900 to 2,050. [list] [b][b]Note:[/b] Towers of Doom Forts upgrade to Keeps when the Tunnels open, approximately 12 minutes into a match.[/b] [/list] [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] We're taking some of the experience offered by outer Towers and distributing it amongst other Structures in an effort to keep teams closer in levels for a little while longer. We still want to reward skillful play, but a team that completes the first objective is frequently able take out a lot of the opposing team's outer Structures. Not only did this open up a strategic advantage (Healing Fountains get destroyed, Fortifications provide less safety), but it also pushes the winning team further ahead. Usually, this results in one team reaching level 10 before their opponents, allowing them to snowball to an even greater lead. We'd like to instead slow down early game leads, so that winning teams have to play well for a longer period of time.

volskayafoundry.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*][b]Mercenary Pickups[/b] [list] Healing Pulse now acts as a totem, healing all Heroes in the area after being placed. [*]Turrets can now be placed instantly. [/list] [*][b]Triglav Protector[/b] [list] The Protector will gain 10 Armor and 25% increased damage if both the Pilot and Gunner seats are occupied [*]Base Health has been increased from 9500 to 10450 [*]Health Scaling has been increased by 10% [*][b]Pilot: Rocket Fist (W)[/b] [list] Duration of structure debuff effect has been increased from 2 to 4 seconds [/list] [*][b]Gunner: Gatling Cannon (W)[/b] [list] Gatling Cannon will now fire immediately, instead of after a short delay [*]Gatling Cannon rounds will now travel 50% faster [/list] [/list] [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Volskaya Foundry:[/b] Fixed an issue that allowed Junkrat to permanently displace and leash Fortification Camps. [/list]

volskayafoundry.name: 2018-01-09 Patch Notes v 2.29.7
volskayafoundry.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Total Health regen over 5 seconds reduced from 11.7% Maximum Health to 9% [*]Total Mana regen over 5 seconds reduced from 7.8% Maximum Mana to 7% [/list] [b]Forts[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33%. [*]Fort Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [/list] [b]Keeps[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33%  [*]Keep Health increased from 16,000 to 17,000 [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] As expected, our gameplay update for 2018 resulted in large changes to many of our game systems. While we’re overall happy with the direction of the update, there have been some unintended side effects that we’re hoping to remedy. We overestimated how much more powerful unlimited ammo would be for Structures, and as a result pushing mechanics have become too strong, resulting in lower game times on nearly all maps. We’re giving our towers some of their teeth back with this update, which should help teams hold pushes from Mercenary Camps and map events. We’re also making some tuning changes to some of our Mercenary Camps now that we have had some time to see how they have been performing. Hellbats and Knights in particular are pushing harder than we would like, so we’re reducing their power. We’re also taking a look at the Warhead Junction boss and reducing its early and mid-game pushing power, as right now it is too strong when combined with Nukes from the map event. Lastly, we are reducing the power of Regeneration Globes. While we like the new mini-game that Neutral Regen globes provide in the laning phase, we are not comfortable with how much they are currently benefitting the team that is ahead while they are pushing into a defending team. We’re also seeing players picking up more Regeneration Globes in general, so this will help to keep the game’s overall sustain in check. These are some hefty changes, and it’s likely that there will be more needed to be done over time as things continue to settle. We’ll be keeping an eye on things, and are prepared to make more updates as they’re needed.

volskayafoundry.name: 2017-09-26 Patch Notes v 2.28.0
volskayafoundry.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*][b]Objective[/b] [list] [b]Control Points[/b] [list] Throughout the match a Control Point will activate at one of three locations, beginning in a neutral capture state. [*]Once a player stands on the control point without any enemies, they gain control progress for their team at a steady rate. [*]If an enemy enters the point, the point becomes contested and will not gain or lose control progress. [*]When a team's control progress hits 100, they gain control of the point. [*]As long as a team has control of the point, they gain victory progress at a steady rate. [list] Victory progress does not decay for any reason. [/list] [*]Overtime: When a point is at 99% victory progress about to tick over to 100%, it will stay at 99% and enter the overtime state if there are any enemy heroes on the point or the point just flipped from the enemy's control. [*]When a team's victory progress hits 100%, they win the event. The control point deactivates and a two-person Triglav Protector spawns on the point for the winning team after a short delay. [/list] [*][b]Triglav Protector[/b] [list] [b]Pilot Abilities[/b] [list] [b]Charge (Q)[/b] [list] After .5 seconds, charge to the target unit's current location and deal damage in an area. Deals double damage to structures and minions. 8 second cooldown [/list] [*][b]Rocket Fist (W)[/b] [list] Launch a Rocket Fist that impacts the first Hero or Structure hit. Roots Heroes for 1 second. Disables Structures for 2 seconds. Destroys all minions in its path. 14 second cooldown. [/list] [*][b]Shield Emitter (E)[/b] [list] Grants 25 armor to vehicle and grants a Shield to all nearby allies equal to 25% of their maximum health. 16 second cooldown. [/list] [/list] [*][b]Gunner Abilities[/b] [list] [b]Particle Cannon (Q)[/b] [list] Enables the Particle Cannon ability and increases its range over 3 seconds. Reactivate to launch an orb dealing damage in an area. 5 sec cooldown. [/list] [*][b]Gatling Cannon (W)[/b] [list] Fires a barrage of cannon fire at the location of your cursor for 4 seconds. 11 second cooldown. [/list] [*][b]Scorching Laser (E)[/b] [list] A laser quickly cuts a line across the terrain dealing light damage. A secondary explosion triggers 0.75 seconds later for heavy damage. 10 second cooldown. [/list] [/list] [/list] [/list] [/list] [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Impaler and Trooper Camps[/b] (Siege Mercenaries found on Volskaya Foundry, Battlefield of Eternity, and Infernal Shrines) [list] Early game health has been slightly decreased. [*]Base damage and scaling values have been increased by roughly 50% [*]Defender Mercenaries can no longer be affected by displacements effects. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] We’ve heard feedback on the lack of strength the Assault Trooper mercenaries possess. We hear and agree with this sentiment so we’ve increased their overall damage to make them more of a threat.  [list] [*]Mercenary item drops no longer require a short channel time to be picked up. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] This change is aimed at making the flow of picking up items from mercenary camps smoother and more intuitive. We found the flow of defeating a mercenary camp, capturing it, then channeling on the dropped item was disruptive to what players are accustomed to with typical mercenary camps.  [list] [*]Support Camps can no longer be captured with "Bribe" talents. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] Thanks for all of the early responses on Volskaya Foundry. We’re making this change in response to consistent community feedback.  [b]Vehicles[/b] [list] [*]All vehicles, including the Dragon Knight, Garden Terror, and Triglav Protector are now Unstoppable. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] Prior to this patch, crowd control effects on vehicles were reduced by 50%. Initially, displacement effects affecting vehicles were not reduced at all. Over time, we’ve made the decision to make some abilities unable to target vehicles. As our hero roster grew, so did the amount of special rules associated with vehicle interactions. Instead of continuing to maintain a list of special interactions, we’ve opted to simplify the behavior and make vehicles Unstoppable. To compensate for the increased vehicle strength, we’ve also looked at each vehicle’s balance numbers.

alteracpass.name: 2018-12-11 Patch Notes v 2.41.0
alteracpass.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Catapults[/b] [list] [*]When a team destroys a Fort, they'll now gain a Catapult in every 3rd Minion wave. [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] In order to keep early-game Catapults from being too devastating to defending teams, Catapult attack splash size, attack range, and damage/health will gradually increase as the game progresses. [/list] [/list] [b]Experience Changes[/b] [list] [*]Removed all Experience earned from destroying a Fort or Keep [*]Destroying a Fort or Keep will now provide your team with a stacking 20% increase in Passively-earned Experience [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] Towers of Doom is exempt from all Experience and Catapult changes. [/list] [*]Decreased Experience earned from destroying Towers by 50% [*]Passive Experience gain increased by 15% [*]Increased Experience gained by defeating defending Mercenaries by 100% [list] ​Hanamura Temple and Volsksaya Foundry Item Camps are excluded from this change. [/list] [*]Laning Mercenary Experience [list] Defeating Laning Mercenaries will now grant 100% of Defending Mercenaries Experience. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] Thank you so much for all of the feedback regarding the 2019 Gameplay Updates. While there is still a lot of community speculation about the outcome of these changes, there has been a resounding amount of concern about the loss of Fort and Keep XP. We agree that the complete loss of XP from Forts and Keeps may reduce the incentive to kill them to unhealthy levels, especially at higher levels of play. In response, we have reintroduced XP to the structures in a way that will reward players for taking them early while granting a gradual increase in power instead of large bursts. This should reinforce our goal of making matches closer while also rewarding teams for destroying enemy structures as quick as possible. [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] After listening to feedback, we have decided to pull back the laning Mercenary change outlined in our 2019 gameplay updates in order to give winning teams more opportunities to pull ahead.  [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Boss Camps, Sentinel Camps (Hanamura Temple), and Support Camps (Volskaya Foundry) will now be flagged as Elite. [list] Elite Mercenary Camps are Unstoppable & Unbribable [/list] [/list] [b]Unit Radii[/b] [list] [*]The unit radius values for most Heroes has been reduced by 5-15% [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] In an effort to improve visual clarity when many heroes are on-screen, we've updated the art for the Hero Ring displayed underneath heroes. To reinforce this effort, we've also done a pass on the Unit Radii for all heroes. We understand that these radius adjustments will have a minor but intended impact on landing and dodging abilities, and as a result, felt that the 2019 Gameplay Updates were the best time to make these changes.

alteracpass.name: 2018-07-03 Balance Update
alteracpass.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*][b]Generals[/b] [list] Health reduced from 24,000 to 20,000. [*]Now gain 405 maximum Health every minute until minute 21 (excluding minute 1). [/list] [*][b]Cavalry[/b] [list] No longer gain additional Armor for nearby Heroes. [*]Health reduced from 10,000 to 8,000. [*]Health scaling increased by 19%. [*]Damage reduced from 85 to 65. [*]Damage scaling increased by 22%. [/list] [*][b]Reaver Minions[/b] [list] Damage scaling increased by 50%. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] We're making a few changes to Alterac Pass to reduce the frequency that one team can run away with an early lead, while still keeping the average game time roughly in line with our other Battlegrounds. We're removing the mechanic that grants Cavalry additional Armor for every allied Hero in their aura, since we feel that multi-Hero pushes are already strong enough. We've also made Health scaling adjustments so that Vanndar and Drek'thar (the Core replacements) won't be demolished as quickly by late game Heroes that have outscaled them and reduced their Armor. However, we are increasing the scaling of Cavalry and Reavers (Catapult replacements), so that games still end in a timely fashion. This should only come into play during games that become prolonged.

alteracpass.name: 2018-06-12 Patch Notes v 2.34.0
alteracpass.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [b]Please Note:[/b] Alterac Pass will become available for play in two stages during the coming weeks: [list] [*][b]Non-Ranked Modes:[/b] During the week of June 19, Alterac Pass will enter Quick Match, Unranked, and Versus A.I. matchmaking queues, as well as Custom Games. [*][b]Ranked Play:[/b] During the week of July 10, Alterac Pass will enter the Ranked Battleground Rotation. [/list] [b]Learn even more about Alterac Pass by visiting the [url=https:/heroesofthestorm.com/battlegrounds/alterac-pass/]Heroes of the Storm website[/url]![/b] Alterac Pass is a 3-lane Battleground where Heroes must free imprisoned allied troops, call in their cavalry, and take down the opposing General to claim the Pass for their faction. In addition to enemy forces, the Alterac Mountains are home to many treacherous hazards! Heroes must remain vigilant, as a misstep into a mud pit can prove fatal. Teams would also be wise to recruit the Armored Gnolls and Ice Giants who inhabit the Pass before the enemy faction can harness these deadly creatures for their own gain. [b]Cores Replaced by Generals[/b] [list] [*]Each team's Core has been replaced by a General who will aid them in fending off attackers. [list] [b]Vanndar Stormpike[/b] leads the Alliance (left team) in driving back the Horde forces at Alterac Pass. [*][b]Drek'Thar[/b] has rallied the Horde (right team) to aid in defending the Pass against Alliance invaders. [/list] [*]Each General receives bonus Armor and damage based on the number of allied Keeps remaining. Destroy enemy Keeps to weaken their General. [*]When attacking a General directly, be prepared to finish the job! Vanndar and Drek'thar will regenerate Health once they are out of combat. [*]In addition to their Basic Attacks, they can also use two Abilities: [list] [b]Whirlwind:[/b] Deals damage in an area around the General. [*][b]Charge:[/b] The General dashes to the target enemy, dealing damage. [/list] [/list] [b]Capture Prison Camps to Call in the Cavalry![/b] [list] [*]Three minutes after a match begins, a Prison Camp will spawn for each team. Invade enemy territory, take out the Guards, and free the allied prisoners to call in a Cavalry Charge! [list] Channel an opposing Prison Camp to begin a breakout, and then free the prisoner by preventing the enemy team from regaining control of the Camp for 30 seconds. [list] Watch out for enemy Heroes and Guards! They will attempt to stop any attackers and Channel on their Prison Camp to retake control. [*]Each subsequent breakout will require the capturing team to maintain control for an additional 10 seconds, up to a maximum of 50 seconds. [/list] [/list] [*]Once a team frees the prisoners at an enemy camp, allied Cavalry will charge down all three lanes, attacking any enemies and Structures in their paths. [list] Cavalry units generate an aura that increases nearby Minion and Hero Movement Speeds, and grants a damage bonus to nearby allied Heroes. [list] The aura's damage bonus will increase based on the number of Prison Camp events completed so far, up to a maximum of 3 events. [list] Cavalry on both teams will benefit from these increases independent of which team won each Prison Camp event. [/list] [/list] [/list] [*]Subsequent Prison Camps will spawn at random within a range of time after all Cavalry from the previous event have been eliminated. This range of time is determined as follows: [list] From 110 – (# of game minutes elapsed * 2) seconds to 150 – (# of game minutes elapsed * 2) seconds. [*][b]For example:[/b] If all Cavalry from the most recent event are defeated at the 10-minute mark, the next set of Prison Camps will spawn at random between 90 and 130 seconds later. [/list] [/list] [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Armored Gnolls – Siege Camp[/b] [list] Watch out for the Gnolls who inhabit the Pass! They're formidable creatures who wield a cleaving attack that can shred a Hero's Armor in no time. [/list] [*][b]Ice Giants – Boss Camp[/b] [list] The Ice Giants at the northern and southernmost points of the Pass tend to mind their own business, but once provoked, they've been known to hurl deadly balls of ice and even stomp the ground in an effort to Slow or Stun their foes. [/list] [/list] [b]Mud Pits[/b] [list] [*]Combatants who don't mind where they step can fall victim to one of several mud pits that have sprung up within Alterac Pass. [list] Any Hero who enters a mud pit will find their Movement Speed reduced by 16% per second, to a maximum of 60%, for as long as they remain there. [*]Upon finding solid ground, the Hero will regain Movement Speed at 50% per second. [/list] [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2018-06-06 Balance Update v 2.33.1
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,000 to 1,200 [*]Keep experience increased from 1,650 to 2,050 [*][b]Towers of Doom[/b] [list] Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,100 to 1,200. [*]Keep experience increased from 1,900 to 2,050. [list] [b][b]Note:[/b] Towers of Doom Forts upgrade to Keeps when the Tunnels open, approximately 12 minutes into a match.[/b] [/list] [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] We're taking some of the experience offered by outer Towers and distributing it amongst other Structures in an effort to keep teams closer in levels for a little while longer. We still want to reward skillful play, but a team that completes the first objective is frequently able take out a lot of the opposing team's outer Structures. Not only did this open up a strategic advantage (Healing Fountains get destroyed, Fortifications provide less safety), but it also pushes the winning team further ahead. Usually, this results in one team reaching level 10 before their opponents, allowing them to snowball to an even greater lead. We'd like to instead slow down early game leads, so that winning teams have to play well for a longer period of time.

blackheartsbay.name: 2018-01-09 Patch Notes v 2.29.7
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Total Health regen over 5 seconds reduced from 11.7% Maximum Health to 9% [*]Total Mana regen over 5 seconds reduced from 7.8% Maximum Mana to 7% [/list] [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Knights[/b] [list] Defender Mage Knight [list] Spell Armor Aura amount increased from 15 to 20 [/list] [*]Laner Mage Knight [list] Spell Armor Aura amount reduced from 30 to 20 [/list] [/list] [/list] [b]Forts[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33%. [*]Fort Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [/list] [b]Keeps[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Health increased from 16,000 to 17,000 [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] As expected, our gameplay update for 2018 resulted in large changes to many of our game systems. While we’re overall happy with the direction of the update, there have been some unintended side effects that we’re hoping to remedy. We overestimated how much more powerful unlimited ammo would be for Structures, and as a result pushing mechanics have become too strong, resulting in lower game times on nearly all maps. We’re giving our towers some of their teeth back with this update, which should help teams hold pushes from Mercenary Camps and map events. We’re also making some tuning changes to some of our Mercenary Camps now that we have had some time to see how they have been performing. Hellbats and Knights in particular are pushing harder than we would like, so we’re reducing their power. We’re also taking a look at the Warhead Junction boss and reducing its early and mid-game pushing power, as right now it is too strong when combined with Nukes from the map event. Lastly, we are reducing the power of Regeneration Globes. While we like the new mini-game that Neutral Regen globes provide in the laning phase, we are not comfortable with how much they are currently benefitting the team that is ahead while they are pushing into a defending team. We’re also seeing players picking up more Regeneration Globes in general, so this will help to keep the game’s overall sustain in check. These are some hefty changes, and it’s likely that there will be more needed to be done over time as things continue to settle. We’ll be keeping an eye on things, and are prepared to make more updates as they’re needed.

blackheartsbay.name: 2017-01-24 Patch Notes v 23.0
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Structures:[/b] Fixed an issue in which the Core could continue to reveal enemy Stealth Heroes in a small radius outside its intended reveal range. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2017-01-04 Patch Notes v 22.5
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Armor & Vulnerability[/b]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] With today’s patch you will notice that a lot of our tooltips that used to reference the Resistant/Vulnerable system have been changed. Matthew Cooper [url=https:/us.battle.net/forums/en/heroes/topic/20752266255]detailed the changes on our forums[/url] last month explaining a bit about the new system. While the tooltips may have changed, the actual functionality for the system has been in since the Varian patch hit during the week of November 14, so the game itself should not feel any different than what you are currently used to. You will also notice that we have added baseline Armor to three Heroes – Arthas, Anub'arak, and Greymane’s Worgen Form. These are the first of a handful that we are planning to release and would love to hear any feedback you have. We are hoping that the Armor System will open up future design flexibility, increase the depth of strategy (both in game, and in draft), and grant us another knob to help balance the game.  Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Minimap:[/b] Catapult Minimap icons are now slightly lighter in color to help players more easily differentiate them from other Minions. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2016-11-22 Hotfix Patch v 22.1
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Minions:[/b] Catapult Minimap icons will now appear team-colored. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2016-11-15 Patch Notes v 22.0
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Blackheart's Bay:[/b] Area of effect indicators and Hero rings will now display properly on bridges. [/list] [list] [*][b]Mercenaries:[/b] Siege Giants will no longer deal damage if they are killed while in the middle of their attack animations. [/list] [list] [*][b]Samuro:[/b] Mirror Image Health bars will now reflect the number of Doubloons that Samuro is carrying on Blackheart's Bay. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2016-09-13 Patch Notes v 20.0
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Mounts[/b] [list] [*]Movement Speed reduced from 40 to 30% [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Time before Globes despawn reduced from 8 to 6 seconds [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Timing Changes[/b] [list] Previously all Mercenary camps spawned at 120 seconds. The following adjustments have been made to spawn times: [list] 90 seconds: Sappers, Doubloon Pirates [*]120 seconds: Siege Giants (unchanged), Impalers (unchanged) [*]150 seconds: Knights, Fallen Shaman [*]180 seconds: Grave Golem (unchanged) [*]300 seconds: Headless Horseman (unchanged) [/list] [/list] [*]Captured Mercenaries will no longer grant Experience when killed. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We started playtesting with staggered Mercenary Camp spawn times, and quickly began to realize that it added more strategic depth to the game, and coincided with some of our Battleground events. We have been happy with the changes overall, and are listening to any feedback you may have!  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Heroes can no longer push captured Mercenaries by walking into them. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2016-08-09 Patch Notes v 19.4
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Collision:[/b] Heroes can no longer push Neutral and Enemy Mercenaries by walking into them. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2016-07-27 Balance Update v 19.3
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Collision[/b]: Heroes can no longer be pushed by walking another Hero into them.  [/list] [list] [*][b]Collision[/b]: Heroes who are channeling an Ability can no longer be pushed when another Hero walks into them during the channel.  [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2016-07-12 Patch Notes v 19.0
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Victory determination is now much more precise in situations where both Cores are destroyed within fractions of a second. As a result, Victory will no longer be decided at random in cases where it appears that both Cores are destroyed at the same moment. [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 6.24% of maximum Health over 4 seconds [*]Now: Restore 12% of maximum Health over 5 seconds [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 32 Mana over 4 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 8% of maximum Mana over 5 seconds [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Thank you for all your discussion and feedback on our recent Health sustain post! We are still heavily evaluating a lot of it but wanted to get the first round of changes in. Internally, we enjoyed the increased importance on Regeneration Globes and have cleaned up the system a bit. With a larger importance, denying enemies their Globes in lane has a much larger impact.  [b]Healing Wells[/b] [list] [*]Cooldown increased from 100 to 120 seconds [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 41% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 40% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 20% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 30% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Much like the changes to Regeneration Globes, we wanted to add a larger impact to the moment you click a Healing Well. Again, we cleaned up the system a fair bit (hence the ~41% to 40% Health change) and added a larger impact for heavy Mana users. The increased cooldown should make the decision of when to tap the Healing Well slightly more interesting.  [b]Minions[/b] [list] [*][b]Ranged, Melee, and Wizard Minions[/b] [list] Now deal an additional 50% damage to Structures. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Our goal with this change is to make escorting Minions to Towns to be more impactful, such that they can really start to do some damage if left unattended. Before this change, Minions were primarily XP carriers that absorbed some Ammo shots from Towers. Now the armies of the Nexus are a bit scarier when they march down a lane.  [list] [*][b]Catapult Minions[/b] [list] Attack range increased by 20%. [*]Sight range increased by 17%. [*]Will now fixate on Structures. Catapults will not acquire a new target after fixating until the target is destroyed or the Catapult is killed. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Catapults would often reach the Core, but have a Minion wave spawn on them, distract them, and allow them to be killed off before doing any significant damage. With increased range and fixation on a Structure once they’ve started attacking, even one Catapult will more consistently punch through a Core’s Shield and do actual damage.

blackheartsbay.name: 2016-05-17 Patch Notes v 18.0
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Healing Well[/b] [list] [*]25% of a Healing Well’s maximum Health has been converted into a Shield. Shield Regeneration delay of 8 seconds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We’ve noticed some rather un-fun behavior in the form of sniping Healing Wells over time using very long range Abilities. While we’re okay with players doing this to a degree, we found it was too effective given how little counterplay there was. To help solve this, turned a sizable portion of Healing Well Health into a Shield. This means that if you offer your Healing Well some respite from enemy attacks by chasing opponents away every now and then, it will start to regenerate some of that Shield. Only [b]you[/b] can protect Healing Wells from those pesky Arcane Orbs!  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Fixed an issue in which attacking enemy Walls at certain angles would cause the Hero’s Basic Attack animation to play, but deal no damage. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2016-02-02 Patch Notes v 16.0
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Battleground Monsters[/b] [list] [*]Battleground-specific creatures are now universally defined as [b]Monsters[/b] (ex: Neutral Garden Terrors, Sky Temple Guardians, etc.) [*]Several Talents and Abilities have been changed to reflect this new categorization, and the following no longer affect Monsters: [list] Mercenary Lord [*]Johanna's Knight Takes Pawn [*]Lunara's Cruel Bloom [*]Rexxar's Easy Prey and Bird of Prey [*]The Butcher's Chop Meat [/list] [*]The following now affect Monsters: [list] Anub'arak's Beetle, Juiced [*]Azmodan's Demonic Smite [/list] [*]Several Talents that could previously trigger against both captured Mercenaries and Minions will now only affect Minions (ex: Seasoned Marksman, Black Soulstone, etc.) [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Towers, Forts, and Keeps now deal 50% bonus damage to Heroes [*]Cores will now display an “Invulnerable” message if attacked by an enemy when no allied Keeps have been destroyed. [*]Structures can no longer be made Vulnerable [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] The scaling changes we released in December made it so Heroes could dive into Structures with impunity during the early game. Increasing the damage that Structures deal to Heroes allows defending players to feel a bit safer. We are exploring other fixes to help Structures feel more meaningful throughout the game and will release them when they are ready.  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Diagonally placed shrubs will now properly hide Heroes within them. [/list] [list] [*]Players punted out of an enemy Hall of Storms will no longer be persistently stunned if an enemy unit blocked the path of the punt. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2015-12-21 Hotfix Patch v 15.4
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*]Fixed an issue that could cause Heroes to become stuck inside of a Gate after using certain Abilities. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2015-12-15 Patch Notes v 15.3
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*]Diagonally placed Shrubs will no longer sometimes fail to properly hide a Hero within. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2015-11-17 Patch Notes v 15.0
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Scaling Changes[/b] [list] [*]Health and damage scaling for all Heroes, Battleground Events, Minions, and Mercenaries has been changed from flat, additive values to values that are multiplicative by percentage. [*]A large portion of Heroes’ total scaling amounts, which were previously gained over the course of a game, have been added to their base values. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Due to the way that our old level scaling system worked, early game level discrepancies created a larger difference in power level than we liked. This often led to situations where a team could be up two or more levels early in a game, and use this advantage to create a larger lead. We didn’t feel that games were fun for the winning or losing team in these types of scenarios. As a result of these changes, all Heroes will have more power early, but gain less from each level. Battleground Events, Minions, Mercenaries, and Structures have all been adjusted to compensate for this and should feel close to what they did previously. The aim of these adjustments to the scaling system is to make level differences have a similar impact on your Hero’s statistics at all points in a game. Now, each level offers about 4% Health and 4% damage, which mirrors what late game leads felt like in our previous version of the game. It is important to note, that while being down a few levels will be less punishing than it was previously, Talent tier advantages can and will still have a noticeable impact on enemy engagements.  [b]Respawn Timers[/b] [list] [*]Respawn timers have been increased for levels 1 – 10. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] In order to reward players for getting early game Takedowns, we’re also increasing the respawn time of dead Heroes at low levels. Now, getting early game Takedowns (and the experience associated with it) won’t give your team as much pure power as it did previously. Instead, early kills will offer a “power play” moment, in which your team can destroy enemy Structures, complete Battleground Events, or take more Mercenaries. These meaningful strategic advantages will position a team closer to victory, without giving them a large stat advantage and the ability to bully the opposing enemy team.  [b]Attack Speed Slows[/b] [list] [*]Attack speed slows now apply only to Heroes and Summons. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2015-10-06 Patch Notes v 14.0
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]A.I. Talent Selection[/b] [list] [*]A.I. controlled Heroes will now select their Talents from a group of preset Talent builds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] A.I. players will now choose from predetermined Talent builds instead of randomly selecting Talents. This is especially important for players who disconnect as the A.I. will now no longer randomly choose Talents, but instead try to pick builds that are closer to what players would expect. In addition, A.I. controlled Heroes in Versus A.I. games will also have their own Talent builds to choose from.  [b]Vehicles and Regeneration Globe Interaction[/b] [list] [*]Regeneration Globes will no longer heal Dragon Knights and Garden Terrors. [list] Instead, Regeneration Globe effects will now be applied directly to the Hero inside the Dragon Knight or Garden Terror. [/list] [*]Players within a Dragon Knight or Garden Terror can now also accumulate stacks for Talents such as Seasoned Marksman, Gathering Power, Regeneration Master, etc. [/list] [b]Summoned Unit Attacks[/b] [list] [*]Summoned unit Basic Attacks will now miss if that Summon is Blinded or the target is Evading. [*]Summoned unit Basic Attacks will no longer consume Block Talent stacks. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2015-08-18 Patch Notes v 13.0
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*]Fixed an issue in which certain movement-based Abilities, such as Kerrigan’s Ravage or Chen’s Flying Kick, could not target the Doubloon Chests on Blackheart's Bay, or Plant Terror Overgrowths on Garden of Terror. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2015-05-12 Patch Notes v 11.0
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*]Alerts proclaiming that the Core is under attack will no longer play when an enemy Hero is within range of the Core before a Keep has been destroyed. [/list] [list] [*]Players will no longer enter an infinite rejoin loop if both Cores are destroyed simultaneously, and victory will be assigned to one team at random. [list] [b]Please note: Randomly assigned victory/defeat is intended as a temporary solution, intended to fix the infinite rejoin loop as soon as possible. A more robust solution for games that end in a draw will be implemented with a future patch.[/b] [/list] [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2015-03-24 Patch Notes v 10.0
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]General[/b] [list] [*]In-game XP Changes [list] The in-game leveling curve has been adjusted slightly to slow down the first 10 team levels, though the amount of XP required to reach level 20 remains the same.  [/list] [/list] Battleground Updates [list] [*]Doubloon Chest status bars are now segmented, and each segment represents when a Doubloon will spawn. [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Mercenary initial and scaling XP has been reworked. [*]Mercenary Camp tooltips now indicate which Camps can be Bribed. [/list] [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Gate, Tower, Town Hall, and Wall Health reduced by approximately 10%. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Fixed a rare issue in which a Core with less than 1 Health could suddenly be destroyed without taking additional damage. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2015-02-10 Patch Notes v 9.0
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]General[/b] [list] [*]Human teams can now begin Coop games on either side of the Battleground, rather than only on the left side. [*]Collecting various Battleground items (Doubloons, Skulls, Seeds, Regeneration Globes) should now be more responsive. [/list] [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*][b]Core[/b] [list] The Core is now invulnerable until both the Keep and Fort in a single lane are destroyed. [list] This is now consistent with the way in which Catapult Minions are spawned. [/list] [/list] [*][b]Walls[/b] [list] Vision provided by Walls reduced by approximately 15%. [/list] [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Battleground objective units such as Grave Golems, Garden Terrors, and Mercenaries will now become invulnerable while leashing.  [/list] [list] [*]Fixed an issue that could cause Grave Golems to deviate from their intended attack paths (Hotfixed on January 22). [/list] [list] [*]Grave Golems will now properly ignore Tassadar’s Force Wall. [/list] [list] [*]Grave Golems, Mercenaries, and Minions will no longer completely ignore Structures affected by Zeratul’s Void Prison. [/list] [list] [*]Kerrigan’s Ultralisk can now properly walk through uncollected Doubloons on Blackheart's Bay. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2015-01-13 Patch Notes v 8.0
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*][b]Core[/b] [list] Damage versus Heroes increased by 20% [*]Abathur’s Symbiote and Tassadar’s Plasma Shield can once again be cast on the Core. [/list] [*][b]Towers[/b] [list] The amount of time that towers are disabled while regenerating ammunition has been increased from 20 to 30 seconds. [list] This was done to align with a previous change, in which the rate of tower ammo regeneration was reduced to 1 per 15 seconds. As such, towers will now come back online with 2 ammunition. [/list] [/list] [/list] [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Grave Golem[/b] [list] [b]Root[/b] [list] Grave Golems will no longer pause when casting Root. [*]Root will now be cast on ranged Minions. [*]Heroic units will remain the preferred targets. [/list] [*][b]Stomp[/b] [list] The post-cast delay on Stomp has been removed. [*]Stomp will now be cast when there are at least 2 Heroic units around the Grave Golem, or at least 3 Minions. [*]Stomp will not be cast unless the Grave Golem is already stationary. [*]Stomp now deals increased damage versus Minions. [/list] [/list] [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Catapult Minions no longer deal half their intended damage, and once again deal area of effect damage around their target. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2014-12-02 Patch Notes v 7.1
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]General[/b] [list] [*]Town Halls no longer contain all of a town’s experience points. While Town Halls retain a majority of the experience, the surrounding towers protecting the town now yield experience as well. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Heroes can no longer be affected by enemy abilities while within the allied Hall of Storms. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2014-10-07 Patch Notes v 6.5
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]General[/b] [list] [*]Minimap icons for the underground Grave Golem on the Haunted Mines, and neutral Garden Terrors on the Garden of Terror, no longer blink when they are in combat [*]Minion damage dealt to opposing Minions has been reduced, allowing for stronger pushes with Minions in unattended lanes [/list] [b]Mercenary Camps[/b] [list] [*][b]Knight Mercenary Camp[/b] [list] The Healer Mercenary no longer heals other Mercenaries or Minions, and now casts a damaging Arcane Bolt on enemies instead. [/list] [/list] [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]The Core now regenerates Shields after it has not taken damage for [b]8 seconds[/b], rather than [b]10[/b] seconds. [*]Towers, Forts, and Keeps now regenerate Ammunition once every [b]15 seconds[/b], rather than once every [b]10 seconds[/b]. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Attacking a Mercenary Camp at the moment it spawns will no longer cause the defending Mercenaries’ Health to reset mid-fight. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2014-09-10 Patch Notes v 5.0
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Health Regeneration has been removed from the Core, but Shield regeneration is unchanged. [/list] [b]Siege Giants[/b] [list] [*]Health regeneration when Siege Giants are out of combat for 8 or more seconds has been removed. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Corrected an issue in which Towers could unintentionally see through certain Line of Sight blockers. [/list] [list] [*]Forts and Keeps will no longer expend ammo without firing when a player quickly moves in and out of range. [/list] [list] [*]Mercenary Camps that are captured simultaneously by one team with the Mercenary Lord Talent, and one without, no longer causes the Mercenaries from both Camps to gain the Mercenary Lord buff. [/list] [list] [*]Pings issued on Mercenary Camps no longer require the player to target an individual Mercenary in order to request assistance with capturing the Camp. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2014-07-23 Patch Notes v 2.5
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]General[/b] [list] [*]The amount of in-game experience required to reach levels 2-19 has been increased by approximately 6%. [/list] [b]Underdog Bonus[/b] [list] [*]The amount of XP received from Hero takedowns is now more granular. [*]This will now have less impact during close games. [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Health now scales throughout the game. [*]Splash damage radius increased from 1.5 to 2. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Treasure Chests on Blackheart's Bay no longer visibly persist through the Fog of War, nor on the minimap, after they are destroyed.  [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2014-06-25 Patch Notes v 2.5
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*]Treasure Chest Health has been increased to account for changes to Hero Basic Attack Speeds. [*]Skeleton Camp respawn time increased from 120 to 150 seconds [/list] General [b]Experience and Snowballing[/b] [list] [*]Experience earned by killing Minions in-lane has been increased by 20%. [*]Bonus trickle experience granted to a team that is behind by 3 or more levels during a game has been removed. [*]Early implementation for the “Underdog Bonus” has been added. [list] A team that is behind in levels – the “underdog” – now earns bonus XP whenever an enemy hero is killed, while a team that is ahead in levels receives reduced XP for killing enemy heroes. [*]The amount of bonus takedown XP granted to the underdog team, as well as reduced takedown XP for the team that’s ahead, scale significantly up based on the level difference between teams. [*]The Underdog Bonus starts at a 1 level difference, and caps off at a 4 level gap. [*]The Underdog Bonus continues until team levels become even. [/list] [*][b][url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/14502320]Head here[/url][/b] to check out additional details on the Underdog Bonus, as well as reasoning behind why we’re trying out this new system. [/list] Mercenaries [b]General[/b] [list] [*]Mercenary Camps now scale up to 30 minutes of elapsed game time. [*]Captured Mercenaries now scale up to 60 minutes of elapsed game time. [/list] [b]Grave Golem[/b] [list] [*]Captured Mercenary Grave Golems are now roughly equivalent in strength to a 30 Skull Grave Golem on the Haunted Mines. [*]Mercenary Grave Golems now seek out structures and ignore Heroes, Minions, and Mercenaries in their path. [*]Mercenary Grave Golems no longer only stomp Minions. [list] Increased the number of Heroic targets required for a Mercenary Grave Golem to issue a stomp from [b]1[/b] to [b]2[/b]. [/list] [/list] [b]Knights[/b] [list] [*][b]Sorcerer[/b] [list] No longer shields other Knights [*]Damage aura has been removed [*]Now heals other Knights and surrounding minions. [/list] [/list] [b]Siege Giants[/b] [list] [*]Defending Siege Giant attacks can no longer be dodged. [list] Siege Giant Attack Damage has been reduced from 100 to 80 in order to compensate for this change. [/list] [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]A number of issues with Mercenary Camp and Minion A.I. have been resolved, and behaviors have been generally improved. [/list] [list] [*]Addressed issues which made shrubs that have units within difficult to enter. It is now easier to attack units which are inside a shrub, as well. [/list] [list] [*]The Core’s Health bar no longer displays 0% when it has less than 100 Health remaining. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2014-05-22 Patch Notes v 2.5
blackheartsbay.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Snowballing[/b] [list] [*]Additional efforts have been made to prevent snowballing for teams that are down by 3 or more levels during a game. [/list] [b]General[/b] [list] [*]The team level cap has been increased from 25 to 30 [/list] Battlegrounds [b]General[/b] [list] [*]The Grave Golem’s root ability now prioritizes MULEs [*]Knight Mercenary Camp respawn time has been increased from 240 to 270 seconds [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Combat sounds and effects are no longer audible, nor visible, through the Fog of War. [/list] [list] [*]Heroes should no longer attempt to path through enemy Gates when given a long-distance move command toward objectives on the opposite side of a Battleground. [/list] [list] [*]The northwest Knight Mercenary Camp on Blackheart's Bay now properly displays a banner which indicates difficulty and description text. [/list]

blackheartsbay.name: 2014-03-25 Hotfix Patch build 29562
blackheartsbay.content: [h]General[/h]  [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Knights [list] Knight Health reduced by 20% [*]Time between Knight and Sorcerer attacks increased from 1.0 to 1.25 [/list] [/list]

braxisholdout.name: 2018-12-11 Patch Notes v 2.41.0
braxisholdout.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Catapults[/b] [list] [*]When a team destroys a Fort, they'll now gain a Catapult in every 3rd Minion wave. [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] In order to keep early-game Catapults from being too devastating to defending teams, Catapult attack splash size, attack range, and damage/health will gradually increase as the game progresses. [/list] [/list] [b]Experience Changes[/b] [list] [*]Removed all Experience earned from destroying a Fort or Keep [*]Destroying a Fort or Keep will now provide your team with a stacking 20% increase in Passively-earned Experience [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] Towers of Doom is exempt from all Experience and Catapult changes. [/list] [*]Decreased Experience earned from destroying Towers by 50% [*]Passive Experience gain increased by 15% [*]Increased Experience gained by defeating defending Mercenaries by 100% [list] ​Hanamura Temple and Volsksaya Foundry Item Camps are excluded from this change. [/list] [*]Laning Mercenary Experience [list] Defeating Laning Mercenaries will now grant 100% of Defending Mercenaries Experience. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] Thank you so much for all of the feedback regarding the 2019 Gameplay Updates. While there is still a lot of community speculation about the outcome of these changes, there has been a resounding amount of concern about the loss of Fort and Keep XP. We agree that the complete loss of XP from Forts and Keeps may reduce the incentive to kill them to unhealthy levels, especially at higher levels of play. In response, we have reintroduced XP to the structures in a way that will reward players for taking them early while granting a gradual increase in power instead of large bursts. This should reinforce our goal of making matches closer while also rewarding teams for destroying enemy structures as quick as possible. [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] After listening to feedback, we have decided to pull back the laning Mercenary change outlined in our 2019 gameplay updates in order to give winning teams more opportunities to pull ahead.  [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Boss Camps, Sentinel Camps (Hanamura Temple), and Support Camps (Volskaya Foundry) will now be flagged as Elite. [list] Elite Mercenary Camps are Unstoppable & Unbribable [/list] [/list] [b]Unit Radii[/b] [list] [*]The unit radius values for most Heroes has been reduced by 5-15% [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] In an effort to improve visual clarity when many heroes are on-screen, we've updated the art for the Hero Ring displayed underneath heroes. To reinforce this effort, we've also done a pass on the Unit Radii for all heroes. We understand that these radius adjustments will have a minor but intended impact on landing and dodging abilities, and as a result, felt that the 2019 Gameplay Updates were the best time to make these changes.

braxisholdout.name: 2018-01-09 Patch Notes v 2.29.7
braxisholdout.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Total Health regen over 5 seconds reduced from 11.7% Maximum Health to 9% [*]Total Mana regen over 5 seconds reduced from 7.8% Maximum Mana to 7% [/list] [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Hellbats[/b] [list] Defender [list] Armor Shred amount reduced from 5 to 4% per stack [*]Base Health reduced from 4275 to 3420 [/list] [*]Laner [list] Armor Shred amount reduced from 5 to 4% per stack [*]Base Health reduced from 4700 to 3760 [list] Health Scaling (Minutes 1-5) reduced from 50 to 40 [*]Health Scaling (Minutes 6-10) increased from 75 to 110 [*]Health Scaling (Minutes 11 -15) increased from 100 to 150 [*]Health Scaling (Minutes 16-20) increased from 125 to 235 [/list] [/list] [/list] [/list] [b]Forts[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33%. [*]Fort Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [/list] [b]Keeps[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Health increased from 16,000 to 17,000 [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] As expected, our gameplay update for 2018 resulted in large changes to many of our game systems. While we’re overall happy with the direction of the update, there have been some unintended side effects that we’re hoping to remedy. We overestimated how much more powerful unlimited ammo would be for Structures, and as a result pushing mechanics have become too strong, resulting in lower game times on nearly all maps. We’re giving our towers some of their teeth back with this update, which should help teams hold pushes from Mercenary Camps and map events. We’re also making some tuning changes to some of our Mercenary Camps now that we have had some time to see how they have been performing. Hellbats and Knights in particular are pushing harder than we would like, so we’re reducing their power. We’re also taking a look at the Warhead Junction boss and reducing its early and mid-game pushing power, as right now it is too strong when combined with Nukes from the map event. Lastly, we are reducing the power of Regeneration Globes. While we like the new mini-game that Neutral Regen globes provide in the laning phase, we are not comfortable with how much they are currently benefitting the team that is ahead while they are pushing into a defending team. We’re also seeing players picking up more Regeneration Globes in general, so this will help to keep the game’s overall sustain in check. These are some hefty changes, and it’s likely that there will be more needed to be done over time as things continue to settle. We’ll be keeping an eye on things, and are prepared to make more updates as they’re needed.

Not only did this open up a strategic advantage (Healing Fountains get destroyed, Fortifications provide less safety), but it also pushes the winning team further ahead. We'd like to instead slow down early game leads, so that winning teams have to play well for a longer period of time.

cursedhollow.name: 2018-01-09 Patch Notes v 2.29.7
cursedhollow.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Total Health regen over 5 seconds reduced from 11.7% Maximum Health to 9% [*]Total Mana regen over 5 seconds reduced from 7.8% Maximum Mana to 7% [/list] [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Knights[/b] [list] Defender Mage Knight [list] Spell Armor Aura amount increased from 15 to 20  [/list] [*]Laner Mage Knight [list] Spell Armor Aura amount reduced from 30 to 20 [/list] [/list] [/list] [b]Forts[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Fort Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [/list] [b]Keeps[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Health increased from 16,000 to 17,000 [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] As expected, our gameplay update for 2018 resulted in large changes to many of our game systems. While we’re overall happy with the direction of the update, there have been some unintended side effects that we’re hoping to remedy. We overestimated how much more powerful unlimited ammo would be for Structures, and as a result pushing mechanics have become too strong, resulting in lower game times on nearly all maps. We’re giving our towers some of their teeth back with this update, which should help teams hold pushes from Mercenary Camps and map events. We’re also making some tuning changes to some of our Mercenary Camps now that we have had some time to see how they have been performing. Hellbats and Knights in particular are pushing harder than we would like, so we’re reducing their power. We’re also taking a look at the Warhead Junction boss and reducing its early and mid-game pushing power, as right now it is too strong when combined with Nukes from the map event. Lastly, we are reducing the power of Regeneration Globes. While we like the new mini-game that Neutral Regen globes provide in the laning phase, we are not comfortable with how much they are currently benefitting the team that is ahead while they are pushing into a defending team. We’re also seeing players picking up more Regeneration Globes in general, so this will help to keep the game’s overall sustain in check. These are some hefty changes, and it’s likely that there will be more needed to be done over time as things continue to settle. We’ll be keeping an eye on things, and are prepared to make more updates as they’re needed.

cursedhollow.name: 2017-01-04 Patch Notes v 22.5
cursedhollow.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Armor & Vulnerability[/b]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] With today’s patch you will notice that a lot of our tooltips that used to reference the Resistant/Vulnerable system have been changed. Matthew Cooper [url=https:/us.battle.net/forums/en/heroes/topic/20752266255]detailed the changes on our forums[/url] last month explaining a bit about the new system. While the tooltips may have changed, the actual functionality for the system has been in since the Varian patch hit during the week of November 14, so the game itself should not feel any different than what you are currently used to. You will also notice that we have added baseline Armor to three Heroes – Arthas, Anub'arak, and Greymane’s Worgen Form. These are the first of a handful that we are planning to release and would love to hear any feedback you have. We are hoping that the Armor System will open up future design flexibility, increase the depth of strategy (both in game, and in draft), and grant us another knob to help balance the game.  Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Minimap:[/b] Catapult Minimap icons are now slightly lighter in color to help players more easily differentiate them from other Minions. [/list]

cursedhollow.name: 2016-07-12 Patch Notes v 19.0
cursedhollow.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Victory determination is now much more precise in situations where both Cores are destroyed within fractions of a second. As a result, Victory will no longer be decided at random in cases where it appears that both Cores are destroyed at the same moment. [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 6.24% of maximum Health over 4 seconds [*]Now: Restore 12% of maximum Health over 5 seconds [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 32 Mana over 4 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 8% of maximum Mana over 5 seconds [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Thank you for all your discussion and feedback on our recent Health sustain post! We are still heavily evaluating a lot of it but wanted to get the first round of changes in. Internally, we enjoyed the increased importance on Regeneration Globes and have cleaned up the system a bit. With a larger importance, denying enemies their Globes in lane has a much larger impact.  [b]Healing Wells[/b] [list] [*]Cooldown increased from 100 to 120 seconds [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 41% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 40% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 20% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 30% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Much like the changes to Regeneration Globes, we wanted to add a larger impact to the moment you click a Healing Well. Again, we cleaned up the system a fair bit (hence the ~41% to 40% Health change) and added a larger impact for heavy Mana users. The increased cooldown should make the decision of when to tap the Healing Well slightly more interesting.  [b]Minions[/b] [list] [*][b]Ranged, Melee, and Wizard Minions[/b] [list] Now deal an additional 50% damage to Structures. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Our goal with this change is to make escorting Minions to Towns to be more impactful, such that they can really start to do some damage if left unattended. Before this change, Minions were primarily XP carriers that absorbed some Ammo shots from Towers. Now the armies of the Nexus are a bit scarier when they march down a lane.  [list] [*][b]Catapult Minions[/b] [list] Attack range increased by 20%. [*]Sight range increased by 17%. [*]Will now fixate on Structures. Catapults will not acquire a new target after fixating until the target is destroyed or the Catapult is killed. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Catapults would often reach the Core, but have a Minion wave spawn on them, distract them, and allow them to be killed off before doing any significant damage. With increased range and fixation on a Structure once they’ve started attacking, even one Catapult will more consistently punch through a Core’s Shield and do actual damage.

cursedhollow.name: 2016-05-17 Patch Notes v 18.0
cursedhollow.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Healing Well[/b] [list] [*]25% of a Healing Well’s maximum Health has been converted into a Shield. Shield Regeneration delay of 8 seconds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We’ve noticed some rather un-fun behavior in the form of sniping Healing Wells over time using very long range Abilities. While we’re okay with players doing this to a degree, we found it was too effective given how little counterplay there was. To help solve this, turned a sizable portion of Healing Well Health into a Shield. This means that if you offer your Healing Well some respite from enemy attacks by chasing opponents away every now and then, it will start to regenerate some of that Shield. Only [b]you[/b] can protect Healing Wells from those pesky Arcane Orbs!  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Fixed an issue in which attacking enemy Walls at certain angles would cause the Hero’s Basic Attack animation to play, but deal no damage. [/list]

cursedhollow.name: 2016-02-02 Patch Notes v 16.0
cursedhollow.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Battleground Monsters[/b] [list] [*]Battleground-specific creatures are now universally defined as [b]Monsters[/b] (ex: Neutral Garden Terrors, Sky Temple Guardians, etc.) [*]Several Talents and Abilities have been changed to reflect this new categorization, and the following no longer affect Monsters: [list] Mercenary Lord [*]Johanna's Knight Takes Pawn [*]Lunara's Cruel Bloom [*]Rexxar's Easy Prey and Bird of Prey [*]The Butcher's Chop Meat [/list] [*]The following now affect Monsters: [list] Anub'arak's Beetle, Juiced [*]Azmodan's Demonic Smite [/list] [*]Several Talents that could previously trigger against both captured Mercenaries and Minions will now only affect Minions (ex: Seasoned Marksman, Black Soulstone, etc.) [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Towers, Forts, and Keeps now deal 50% bonus damage to Heroes [*]Cores will now display an “Invulnerable” message if attacked by an enemy when no allied Keeps have been destroyed. [*]Structures can no longer be made Vulnerable [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] The scaling changes we released in December made it so Heroes could dive into Structures with impunity during the early game. Increasing the damage that Structures deal to Heroes allows defending players to feel a bit safer. We are exploring other fixes to help Structures feel more meaningful throughout the game and will release them when they are ready.  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Diagonally placed shrubs will now properly hide Heroes within them. [/list] [list] [*]Players punted out of an enemy Hall of Storms will no longer be persistently stunned if an enemy unit blocked the path of the punt. [/list]
