[list] [b]Please note: Randomly assigned victory/defeat is intended as a temporary solution, intended to fix the infinite rejoin loop as soon as possible. A more robust solution for games that end in a draw will be implemented with a future patch.[/b] [/list] [/list]

hauntedmines.name: 2015-03-24 Patch Notes v 10.0
hauntedmines.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]General[/b] [list] [*]In-game XP Changes [list] The in-game leveling curve has been adjusted slightly to slow down the first 10 team levels, though the amount of XP required to reach level 20 remains the same.  [/list] [/list] Battleground Updates [list] [*]Grave Golem Health and damage will no longer scale after either of the following conditions have been met: [list] The Haunted Mines have been open for at least 4 minutes [*]60 Skulls have been collected [*]This change has been made in order to prevent situations in which a team would leave a single skull in the Haunted Mines in order to gain more Golem power.  [/list] [*]The power difference between Lane Golems has been reduced in situations where there is a large skull-count disparity. [*]High skull-count Lane Golem Health has been slightly reduced. [*]The first round of Lane Golems have had their Health reduced. [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Mercenary initial and scaling XP has been reworked. [*]Mercenary Camp tooltips now indicate which Camps can be Bribed. [/list] [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Gate, Tower, Town Hall, and Wall Health reduced by approximately 10%. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Fixed a rare issue in which a Core with less than 1 Health could suddenly be destroyed without taking additional damage. [/list]

hauntedmines.name: 2015-02-10 Patch Notes v 9.0
hauntedmines.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]General[/b] [list] [*]Human teams can now begin Coop games on either side of the Battleground, rather than only on the left side. [*]Collecting various Battleground items (Doubloons, Skulls, Seeds, Regeneration Globes) should now be more responsive. [/list] [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*][b]Core[/b] [list] The Core is now invulnerable until both the Keep and Fort in a single lane are destroyed. [list] This is now consistent with the way in which Catapult Minions are spawned. [/list] [/list] [*][b]Walls[/b] [list] Vision provided by Walls reduced by approximately 15%. [/list] [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Battleground objective units such as Grave Golems, Garden Terrors, and Mercenaries will now become invulnerable while leashing.  [/list] [list] [*]Fixed a rare issue in which Skulls occasionally spawn outside of the playable area on Haunted Mines. [/list] [list] [*]Fixed an issue that could cause Grave Golems to deviate from their intended attack paths (Hotfixed on January 22). [/list] [list] [*]Grave Golems will now properly ignore Tassadar’s Force Wall. [/list] [list] [*]Grave Golems, Mercenaries, and Minions will no longer completely ignore Structures affected by Zeratul’s Void Prison. [/list]

hauntedmines.name: 2015-01-13 Patch Notes v 8.0
hauntedmines.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*][b]Core[/b] [list] Damage versus Heroes increased by 20% [*]Abathur’s Symbiote and Tassadar’s Plasma Shield can once again be cast on the Core. [/list] [*][b]Towers[/b] [list] The amount of time that towers are disabled while regenerating ammunition has been increased from 20 to 30 seconds. [list] This was done to align with a previous change, in which the rate of tower ammo regeneration was reduced to 1 per 15 seconds. As such, towers will now come back online with 2 ammunition. [/list] [/list] [/list] [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Grave Golem[/b] [list] [b]Root[/b] [list] Grave Golems will no longer pause when casting Root. [*]Root will now be cast on ranged Minions. [*]Heroic units will remain the preferred targets. [/list] [*][b]Stomp[/b] [list] The post-cast delay on Stomp has been removed. [*]Stomp will now be cast when there are at least 2 Heroic units around the Grave Golem, or at least 3 Minions. [*]Stomp will not be cast unless the Grave Golem is already stationary. [*]Stomp now deals increased damage versus Minions. [/list] [/list] [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Catapult Minions no longer deal half their intended damage, and once again deal area of effect damage around their target. [/list] [list] [*]Fixed an issue in which summoned Grave Golems on the Haunted Mines dealt significantly more damage to Heroes than expected. [/list] [list] [*]Muradin’s Haymaker will no longer knock enemies out of the playable area in the Haunted Mines. [/list] [list] [*]Summoned Grave Golems on the Haunted Mines now properly ignore summoned units. [/list]

hauntedmines.name: 2014-12-02 Patch Notes v 7.1
hauntedmines.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*]Underground Minions [list] Starting Health and Health scaling increased by 20% [/list] [*]Underground Grave Golem [list] Starting Health and Health scaling increased by 20% [/list] [*]Grave Golem (Summoned) [list] Damage scaling decreased by 20% [*]Health scaling decreased by 20% [/list] [/list] Battlegrounds [b]General[/b] [list] [*]Town Halls no longer contain all of a town’s experience points. While Town Halls retain a majority of the experience, the surrounding towers protecting the town now yield experience as well. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Corrected a minor area of unintentionally pathable terrain within the Haunted Mines. [/list] [list] [*]Heroes can no longer be affected by enemy abilities while within the allied Hall of Storms. [/list]

hauntedmines.name: 2014-10-07 Patch Notes v 6.5
hauntedmines.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]General[/b] [list] [*]Minimap icons for the underground Grave Golem on the Haunted Mines, and neutral Garden Terrors on the Garden of Terror, no longer blink when they are in combat [*]Minion damage dealt to opposing Minions has been reduced, allowing for stronger pushes with Minions in unattended lanes [/list] [b]Mercenary Camps[/b] [list] [*][b]Knight Mercenary Camp[/b] [list] The Healer Mercenary no longer heals other Mercenaries or Minions, and now casts a damaging Arcane Bolt on enemies instead. [/list] [/list] [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]The Core now regenerates Shields after it has not taken damage for [b]8 seconds[/b], rather than [b]10[/b] seconds. [*]Towers, Forts, and Keeps now regenerate Ammunition once every [b]15 seconds[/b], rather than once every [b]10 seconds[/b]. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Attacking a Mercenary Camp at the moment it spawns will no longer cause the defending Mercenaries’ Health to reset mid-fight. [/list]

hauntedmines.name: 2014-09-10 Patch Notes v 5.0
hauntedmines.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*]This Battleground has received significant updates. [list] The underground mines have been reduced in size and received layout changes, which will allow the mines to be cleared more quickly. [*]Skull collection has changed: [list] The underground mines now contain 35 Skeletons, each of which drop 2 Skulls upon death. [*]The Grave Golem in the underground mines now drops 30 skulls. [/list] [*]Mercenary Camp count reduced from [b]5[/b] to [b]3.[/b] [list] Merc Camps include two Siege Giant Camps and one Knight Camp. [*]Mercenaries captured by a team now only attack down the lane opposite from that team's Grave Golem. [/list] [*]The [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/battlegrounds/haunted-mines/]Haunted Mines Battleground page[/url] has been updated to reflect all of the layout changes included in today's patch. [/list] [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Health Regeneration has been removed from the Core, but Shield regeneration is unchanged. [/list] [b]Siege Giants[/b] [list] [*]Health regeneration when Siege Giants are out of combat for 8 or more seconds has been removed. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Corrected an issue in which Towers could unintentionally see through certain Line of Sight blockers. [/list] [list] [*]Forts and Keeps will no longer expend ammo without firing when a player quickly moves in and out of range. [/list] [list] [*]Mercenary Camps that are captured simultaneously by one team with the Mercenary Lord Talent, and one without, no longer causes the Mercenaries from both Camps to gain the Mercenary Lord buff. [/list] [list] [*]Mounted Heroes on the Haunted Mines Battleground will no longer automatically dismount and attack enemy minions when exiting the underground mines. [/list] [list] [*]Pings issued on Mercenary Camps no longer require the player to target an individual Mercenary in order to request assistance with capturing the Camp. [/list]

hauntedmines.name: 2014-07-23 Patch Notes v 2.5
hauntedmines.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]General[/b] [list] [*]The amount of in-game experience required to reach levels 2-19 has been increased by approximately 6%. [/list] [b]Underdog Bonus[/b] [list] [*]The amount of XP received from Hero takedowns is now more granular. [*]This will now have less impact during close games. [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Health now scales throughout the game. [*]Splash damage radius increased from 1.5 to 2. [/list]

hauntedmines.name: 2014-06-25 Patch Notes v 2.5
hauntedmines.content: [h]General[/h]  [b]Experience and Snowballing[/b] [list] [*]Experience earned by killing Minions in-lane has been increased by 20%. [*]Bonus trickle experience granted to a team that is behind by 3 or more levels during a game has been removed. [*]Early implementation for the “Underdog Bonus” has been added. [list] A team that is behind in levels – the “underdog” – now earns bonus XP whenever an enemy hero is killed, while a team that is ahead in levels receives reduced XP for killing enemy heroes. [*]The amount of bonus takedown XP granted to the underdog team, as well as reduced takedown XP for the team that’s ahead, scale significantly up based on the level difference between teams. [*]The Underdog Bonus starts at a 1 level difference, and caps off at a 4 level gap. [*]The Underdog Bonus continues until team levels become even. [/list] [*][b][url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/14502320]Head here[/url][/b] to check out additional details on the Underdog Bonus, as well as reasoning behind why we’re trying out this new system. [/list] Mercenaries [b]General[/b] [list] [*]Mercenary Camps now scale up to 30 minutes of elapsed game time. [*]Captured Mercenaries now scale up to 60 minutes of elapsed game time. [/list] [b]Grave Golem[/b] [list] [*]Captured Mercenary Grave Golems are now roughly equivalent in strength to a 30 Skull Grave Golem on the Haunted Mines. [*]Mercenary Grave Golems now seek out structures and ignore Heroes, Minions, and Mercenaries in their path. [*]Mercenary Grave Golems no longer only stomp Minions. [list] Increased the number of Heroic targets required for a Mercenary Grave Golem to issue a stomp from [b]1[/b] to [b]2[/b]. [/list] [/list] [b]Knights[/b] [list] [*][b]Sorcerer[/b] [list] No longer shields other Knights [*]Damage aura has been removed [*]Now heals other Knights and surrounding minions. [/list] [/list] [b]Siege Giants[/b] [list] [*]Defending Siege Giant attacks can no longer be dodged. [list] Siege Giant Attack Damage has been reduced from 100 to 80 in order to compensate for this change. [/list] [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]A number of issues with Mercenary Camp and Minion A.I. have been resolved, and behaviors have been generally improved. [/list] [list] [*]Addressed issues which made shrubs that have units within difficult to enter. It is now easier to attack units which are inside a shrub, as well. [/list] [list] [*]The Core’s Health bar no longer displays 0% when it has less than 100 Health remaining. [/list]

hauntedmines.name: 2014-05-22 Patch Notes v 2.5
hauntedmines.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Snowballing[/b] [list] [*]Additional efforts have been made to prevent snowballing for teams that are down by 3 or more levels during a game. [/list] [b]General[/b] [list] [*]The team level cap has been increased from 25 to 30 [/list] Battleground Updates [list] [*]There have been significant layout changes to the jungle area of this map, including mercenary camp locations [*]Two Watch Towers have also been added to the jungle [*]Skeletons and the golem no long auto-acquire you; you have to engage them first now [/list] Battlegrounds [b]General[/b] [list] [*]The Grave Golem’s root ability now prioritizes MULEs [*]Knight Mercenary Camp respawn time has been increased from 240 to 270 seconds [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Combat sounds and effects are no longer audible, nor visible, through the Fog of War. [/list] [list] [*]Heroes should no longer attempt to path through enemy Gates when given a long-distance move command toward objectives on the opposite side of a Battleground. [/list]

hauntedmines.name: 2014-04-15 Patch Notes v 2.5
hauntedmines.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*]Scaling Health for the underground Grave Golem increased from [b]625[/b] to [b]750[/b] per minute. [/list]

hauntedmines.name: 2014-04-01 Hotfix Patch build 29666
hauntedmines.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  In order to help emphasize and reward the Legendary event on the Haunted Mines Battleground, we made the following changes: [b]Goal:[/b] Shorten the time commitment of clearing the mines. [list] [*]Skeletons now spawn in larger groups and continue to become more concentrated with each event. [*]The number of Skeletons decrease in subsequent mine openings and the skulls are added to the Golem reward. [/list] [b]Goal:[/b] Increase the reward for clearing the Mines. Early Golems will mean more while late Golems will remain at the same relative strength. [list] [*]The base health of the Golem has been increased by 37.5%. [*]The scaling health of the Golem was decreased from 750 to 700 per minute. [/list] Additionally, the lane your team’s Golem will attack down will now be displayed to you from the start of a game on Haunted Mines.

hauntedmines.name: 2014-03-25 Hotfix Patch build 29562
hauntedmines.content: [h]General[/h]  [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Knights [list] Knight Health reduced by 20% [*]Time between Knight and Sorcerer attacks increased from 1.0 to 1.25 [/list] [/list]

lostcavern.name: 2018-12-11 Patch Notes v 2.41.0
lostcavern.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Catapults[/b] [list] [*]When a team destroys a Fort, they'll now gain a Catapult in every 3rd Minion wave. [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] In order to keep early-game Catapults from being too devastating to defending teams, Catapult attack splash size, attack range, and damage/health will gradually increase as the game progresses. [/list] [/list] [b]Experience Changes[/b] [list] [*]Removed all Experience earned from destroying a Fort or Keep [*]Destroying a Fort or Keep will now provide your team with a stacking 20% increase in Passively-earned Experience [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] Towers of Doom is exempt from all Experience and Catapult changes. [/list] [*]Decreased Experience earned from destroying Towers by 50% [*]Passive Experience gain increased by 15% [*]Increased Experience gained by defeating defending Mercenaries by 100% [list] ​Hanamura Temple and Volsksaya Foundry Item Camps are excluded from this change. [/list] [*]Laning Mercenary Experience [list] Defeating Laning Mercenaries will now grant 100% of Defending Mercenaries Experience. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] Thank you so much for all of the feedback regarding the 2019 Gameplay Updates. While there is still a lot of community speculation about the outcome of these changes, there has been a resounding amount of concern about the loss of Fort and Keep XP. We agree that the complete loss of XP from Forts and Keeps may reduce the incentive to kill them to unhealthy levels, especially at higher levels of play. In response, we have reintroduced XP to the structures in a way that will reward players for taking them early while granting a gradual increase in power instead of large bursts. This should reinforce our goal of making matches closer while also rewarding teams for destroying enemy structures as quick as possible. [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] After listening to feedback, we have decided to pull back the laning Mercenary change outlined in our 2019 gameplay updates in order to give winning teams more opportunities to pull ahead.  [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Boss Camps, Sentinel Camps (Hanamura Temple), and Support Camps (Volskaya Foundry) will now be flagged as Elite. [list] Elite Mercenary Camps are Unstoppable & Unbribable [/list] [/list] [b]Unit Radii[/b] [list] [*]The unit radius values for most Heroes has been reduced by 5-15% [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] In an effort to improve visual clarity when many heroes are on-screen, we've updated the art for the Hero Ring displayed underneath heroes. To reinforce this effort, we've also done a pass on the Unit Radii for all heroes. We understand that these radius adjustments will have a minor but intended impact on landing and dodging abilities, and as a result, felt that the 2019 Gameplay Updates were the best time to make these changes.

lostcavern.name: 2018-11-13 Patch Notes v 2.40.0
lostcavern.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [list] [*]Experience gains from Mercenary Camp captures have been unified. All Mercenary Camps now grant all Experience on capture. [/list]

lostcavern.name: 2018-07-10 Patch Notes v 2.35.0
lostcavern.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Heroes can no longer Heal, Shield, or target allied Mercenaries with Abilities unless an Ability specifically states that Mercenaries are valid targets. [/list]

lostcavern.name: 2018-06-06 Balance Update v 2.33.1
lostcavern.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,000 to 1,200 [*]Keep experience increased from 1,650 to 2,050 [*][b]Towers of Doom[/b] [list] Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,100 to 1,200. [*]Keep experience increased from 1,900 to 2,050. [list] [b][b]Note:[/b] Towers of Doom Forts upgrade to Keeps when the Tunnels open, approximately 12 minutes into a match.[/b] [/list] [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] We're taking some of the experience offered by outer Towers and distributing it amongst other Structures in an effort to keep teams closer in levels for a little while longer. We still want to reward skillful play, but a team that completes the first objective is frequently able take out a lot of the opposing team's outer Structures. Not only did this open up a strategic advantage (Healing Fountains get destroyed, Fortifications provide less safety), but it also pushes the winning team further ahead. Usually, this results in one team reaching level 10 before their opponents, allowing them to snowball to an even greater lead. We'd like to instead slow down early game leads, so that winning teams have to play well for a longer period of time.

lostcavern.name: 2018-03-30 Hotfix Patch v 2.31.1
lostcavern.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Structures:[/b] Fixed an issue in which certain Abilities could be used to move Structures. [/list]

lostcavern.name: 2018-03-06 Patch Notes v 2.30.4
lostcavern.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Mercenaries:[/b] Fixed an issue in which neutral Mercenaries could spawn twice at their Mercenary Camp under specific circumstances. [/list]

lostcavern.name: 2018-01-09 Patch Notes v 2.29.7
lostcavern.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Total Health regen over 5 seconds reduced from 11.7% Maximum Health to 9% [*]Total Mana regen over 5 seconds reduced from 7.8% Maximum Mana to 7% [/list] [b]Forts[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33%. [*]Fort Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [/list] [b]Keeps[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33%  [*]Keep Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Health increased from 16,000 to 17,000 [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] As expected, our gameplay update for 2018 resulted in large changes to many of our game systems. While we’re overall happy with the direction of the update, there have been some unintended side effects that we’re hoping to remedy. We overestimated how much more powerful unlimited ammo would be for Structures, and as a result pushing mechanics have become too strong, resulting in lower game times on nearly all maps. We’re giving our towers some of their teeth back with this update, which should help teams hold pushes from Mercenary Camps and map events. We’re also making some tuning changes to some of our Mercenary Camps now that we have had some time to see how they have been performing. Hellbats and Knights in particular are pushing harder than we would like, so we’re reducing their power. We’re also taking a look at the Warhead Junction boss and reducing its early and mid-game pushing power, as right now it is too strong when combined with Nukes from the map event. Lastly, we are reducing the power of Regeneration Globes. While we like the new mini-game that Neutral Regen globes provide in the laning phase, we are not comfortable with how much they are currently benefitting the team that is ahead while they are pushing into a defending team. We’re also seeing players picking up more Regeneration Globes in general, so this will help to keep the game’s overall sustain in check. These are some hefty changes, and it’s likely that there will be more needed to be done over time as things continue to settle. We’ll be keeping an eye on things, and are prepared to make more updates as they’re needed.

lostcavern.name: 2017-12-12 Patch Notes v 2.29.3
lostcavern.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Regeneration Globes will now become neutral (claimable by both teams) if not claimed within 3 seconds. [/list] [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]All attacking structures no longer have ammunition. [*]Walls will now be destroyed if their connected Towers and Gate are also destroyed. Walls can still be attacked normally. [list] After reviewing community feedback, we’ve decided to revert this change. Destroying the Gate and Towers will no longer automatically destroy connected Walls. [/list] [*]Tower vision range has been increased by 25% [*]Tower damage to minions has been reduced by 25% [*]Structures now have a warmup period of .5 seconds before firing and must face their targets completely [list] Structure attack warning responsiveness has been significantly improved [/list] [*]Standalone Towers (found next to Forts and Keeps) have been removed. [list] The Health, granted Experience, and Damage of Standalone Towers has been redistributed into their surrounding gate Towers, Forts, and Keeps. [/list] [*]Forts and Keeps now have True Sight, meaning they will reveal and attack Stealthed Heroes. [list] True Sight is disabled while the Structure is disabled by effects such as the Raven Lord’s Curse or Sylvanas’ Black Arrow Trait. [/list] [/list] [b]Minions[/b] [list] [*]Minion base damage has been increased by roughly 10% [*]Minion base health has been increased by roughly 10% [url=http://www.teamliquid.net/forum/heroes/529088-mots-2018-gameplay-update-battlegrounds]Undocumented [/i][/url] [*]The 5 second delay before Minions spawn after the game begins has been removed. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Structures:[/b] Auriel's Blinding Flash and Artanis' Suppression Pulse can no longer Blind Structures. [/list]

lostcavern.name: 2017-08-08 Patch Notes v 2.27.0
lostcavern.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Mercenaries:[/b] Heroes will no longer be pushed when allied Mercenaries path into them. [/list]

lostcavern.name: 2017-06-13 Patch Notes v 2.26.0
lostcavern.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Mercenaries:[/b] Captured enemy Mercenaries will no longer drop Fresh Meat stacks for The Butcher or Mineral stacks for Probius. [/list]

lostcavern.name: 2017-04-25 2.0 Launch Notes v 2.25.0

[/list]

lostcavern.name: 2017-02-08 Hotfix Patch v 23.2
lostcavern.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Color Blind Mode:[/b] Fixed an issue causing Minimap icons for uncaptured Merc Camp to appear very similar in color to Merc Camps that have been captured by allies. [/list]

lostcavern.name: 2017-01-24 Patch Notes v 23.0
lostcavern.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Structures:[/b] Fixed an issue in which the Core could continue to reveal enemy Stealth Heroes in a small radius outside its intended reveal range. [/list]

lostcavern.name: 2017-01-04 Patch Notes v 22.5
lostcavern.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Armor & Vulnerability[/b]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] With today’s patch you will notice that a lot of our tooltips that used to reference the Resistant/Vulnerable system have been changed. Matthew Cooper [url=https:/us.battle.net/forums/en/heroes/topic/20752266255]detailed the changes on our forums[/url] last month explaining a bit about the new system. While the tooltips may have changed, the actual functionality for the system has been in since the Varian patch hit during the week of November 14, so the game itself should not feel any different than what you are currently used to. You will also notice that we have added baseline Armor to three Heroes – Arthas, Anub'arak, and Greymane’s Worgen Form. These are the first of a handful that we are planning to release and would love to hear any feedback you have. We are hoping that the Armor System will open up future design flexibility, increase the depth of strategy (both in game, and in draft), and grant us another knob to help balance the game.  Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Minimap:[/b] Catapult Minimap icons are now slightly lighter in color to help players more easily differentiate them from other Minions. [/list]

lostcavern.name: 2016-09-13 Patch Notes v 20.0
lostcavern.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Mounts[/b] [list] [*]Movement Speed reduced from 40 to 30% [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Time before Globes despawn reduced from 8 to 6 seconds [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Timing Changes[/b] [list] Previously all Mercenary camps spawned at 120 seconds. The following adjustments have been made to spawn times: [list] 90 seconds: Sappers, Doubloon Pirates [*]120 seconds: Siege Giants (unchanged), Impalers (unchanged) [*]150 seconds: Knights, Fallen Shaman [*]180 seconds: Grave Golem (unchanged) [*]300 seconds: Headless Horseman (unchanged) [/list] [/list] [*]Captured Mercenaries will no longer grant Experience when killed. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We started playtesting with staggered Mercenary Camp spawn times, and quickly began to realize that it added more strategic depth to the game, and coincided with some of our Battleground events. We have been happy with the changes overall, and are listening to any feedback you may have!  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Heroes can no longer push captured Mercenaries by walking into them. [/list]

lostcavern.name: 2016-08-09 Patch Notes v 19.4
lostcavern.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Collision:[/b] Heroes can no longer push Neutral and Enemy Mercenaries by walking into them. [/list]

lostcavern.name: 2016-07-27 Balance Update v 19.3
lostcavern.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Collision[/b]: Heroes can no longer be pushed by walking another Hero into them.  [/list] [list] [*][b]Collision[/b]: Heroes who are channeling an Ability can no longer be pushed when another Hero walks into them during the channel.  [/list]

lostcavern.name: 2016-07-12 Patch Notes v 19.0
lostcavern.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Victory determination is now much more precise in situations where both Cores are destroyed within fractions of a second. As a result, Victory will no longer be decided at random in cases where it appears that both Cores are destroyed at the same moment. [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 6.24% of maximum Health over 4 seconds [*]Now: Restore 12% of maximum Health over 5 seconds [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 32 Mana over 4 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 8% of maximum Mana over 5 seconds [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Thank you for all your discussion and feedback on our recent Health sustain post! We are still heavily evaluating a lot of it but wanted to get the first round of changes in. Internally, we enjoyed the increased importance on Regeneration Globes and have cleaned up the system a bit. With a larger importance, denying enemies their Globes in lane has a much larger impact.  [b]Healing Wells[/b] [list] [*]Cooldown increased from 100 to 120 seconds [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 41% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 40% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 20% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 30% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Much like the changes to Regeneration Globes, we wanted to add a larger impact to the moment you click a Healing Well. Again, we cleaned up the system a fair bit (hence the ~41% to 40% Health change) and added a larger impact for heavy Mana users. The increased cooldown should make the decision of when to tap the Healing Well slightly more interesting.  [b]Minions[/b] [list] [*][b]Ranged, Melee, and Wizard Minions[/b] [list] Now deal an additional 50% damage to Structures. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Our goal with this change is to make escorting Minions to Towns to be more impactful, such that they can really start to do some damage if left unattended. Before this change, Minions were primarily XP carriers that absorbed some Ammo shots from Towers. Now the armies of the Nexus are a bit scarier when they march down a lane.  [list] [*][b]Catapult Minions[/b] [list] Attack range increased by 20%. [*]Sight range increased by 17%. [*]Will now fixate on Structures. Catapults will not acquire a new target after fixating until the target is destroyed or the Catapult is killed. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Catapults would often reach the Core, but have a Minion wave spawn on them, distract them, and allow them to be killed off before doing any significant damage. With increased range and fixation on a Structure once they’ve started attacking, even one Catapult will more consistently punch through a Core’s Shield and do actual damage.

lostcavern.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Healing Well[/b] [list] [*]25% of a Healing Well’s maximum Health has been converted into a Shield. Shield Regeneration delay of 8 seconds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We’ve noticed some rather un-fun behavior in the form of sniping Healing Wells over time using very long range Abilities. While we’re okay with players doing this to a degree, we found it was too effective given how little counterplay there was. To help solve this, turned a sizable portion of Healing Well Health into a Shield. This means that if you offer your Healing Well some respite from enemy attacks by chasing opponents away every now and then, it will start to regenerate some of that Shield. Only [b]you[/b] can protect Healing Wells from those pesky Arcane Orbs! skytemple.name: 2018-12-11 Patch Notes v 2.41.0
skytemple.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Catapults[/b] [list] [*]When a team destroys a Fort, they'll now gain a Catapult in every 3rd Minion wave. [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] In order to keep early-game Catapults from being too devastating to defending teams, Catapult attack splash size, attack range, and damage/health will gradually increase as the game progresses. [/list] [/list] [b]Experience Changes[/b] [list] [*]Removed all Experience earned from destroying a Fort or Keep [*]Destroying a Fort or Keep will now provide your team with a stacking 20% increase in Passively-earned Experience [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] Towers of Doom is exempt from all Experience and Catapult changes. [/list] [*]Decreased Experience earned from destroying Towers by 50% [*]Passive Experience gain increased by 15% [*]Increased Experience gained by defeating defending Mercenaries by 100% [list] ​Hanamura Temple and Volsksaya Foundry Item Camps are excluded from this change. [/list] [*]Laning Mercenary Experience [list] Defeating Laning Mercenaries will now grant 100% of Defending Mercenaries Experience. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] Thank you so much for all of the feedback regarding the 2019 Gameplay Updates. While there is still a lot of community speculation about the outcome of these changes, there has been a resounding amount of concern about the loss of Fort and Keep XP. We agree that the complete loss of XP from Forts and Keeps may reduce the incentive to kill them to unhealthy levels, especially at higher levels of play. In response, we have reintroduced XP to the structures in a way that will reward players for taking them early while granting a gradual increase in power instead of large bursts. This should reinforce our goal of making matches closer while also rewarding teams for destroying enemy structures as quick as possible. [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] After listening to feedback, we have decided to pull back the laning Mercenary change outlined in our 2019 gameplay updates in order to give winning teams more opportunities to pull ahead.  [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Boss Camps, Sentinel Camps (Hanamura Temple), and Support Camps (Volskaya Foundry) will now be flagged as Elite. [list] Elite Mercenary Camps are Unstoppable & Unbribable [/list] [/list] [b]Unit Radii[/b] [list] [*]The unit radius values for most Heroes has been reduced by 5-15% [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] In an effort to improve visual clarity when many heroes are on-screen, we've updated the art for the Hero Ring displayed underneath heroes. To reinforce this effort, we've also done a pass on the Unit Radii for all heroes. We understand that these radius adjustments will have a minor but intended impact on landing and dodging abilities, and as a result, felt that the 2019 Gameplay Updates were the best time to make these changes.

skytemple.name: 2018-06-06 Balance Update v 2.33.1
skytemple.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,000 to 1,200 [*]Keep experience increased from 1,650 to 2,050 [*][b]Towers of Doom[/b] [list] Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,100 to 1,200. [*]Keep experience increased from 1,900 to 2,050. [list] [b][b]Note:[/b] Towers of Doom Forts upgrade to Keeps when the Tunnels open, approximately 12 minutes into a match.[/b] [/list] [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] We're taking some of the experience offered by outer Towers and distributing it amongst other Structures in an effort to keep teams closer in levels for a little while longer. We still want to reward skillful play, but a team that completes the first objective is frequently able take out a lot of the opposing team's outer Structures. Not only did this open up a strategic advantage (Healing Fountains get destroyed, Fortifications provide less safety), but it also pushes the winning team further ahead. Usually, this results in one team reaching level 10 before their opponents, allowing them to snowball to an even greater lead. We'd like to instead slow down early game leads, so that winning teams have to play well for a longer period of time.

skytemple.name: 2018-01-09 Patch Notes v 2.29.7
skytemple.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Total Health regen over 5 seconds reduced from 11.7% Maximum Health to 9% [*]Total Mana regen over 5 seconds reduced from 7.8% Maximum Mana to 7% [/list] [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Knights[/b] [list] Defender Mage Knight [list] Spell Armor Aura amount increased from 15 to 20 [/list] [*]Laner Mage Knight [list] Spell Armor Aura amount reduced from 30 to 20 [/list] [/list] [/list] [b]Forts[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33%. [*]Fort Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [/list] [b]Keeps[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Health increased from 16,000 to 17,000 [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] As expected, our gameplay update for 2018 resulted in large changes to many of our game systems. While we’re overall happy with the direction of the update, there have been some unintended side effects that we’re hoping to remedy. We overestimated how much more powerful unlimited ammo would be for Structures, and as a result pushing mechanics have become too strong, resulting in lower game times on nearly all maps. We’re giving our towers some of their teeth back with this update, which should help teams hold pushes from Mercenary Camps and map events. We’re also making some tuning changes to some of our Mercenary Camps now that we have had some time to see how they have been performing. Hellbats and Knights in particular are pushing harder than we would like, so we’re reducing their power. We’re also taking a look at the Warhead Junction boss and reducing its early and mid-game pushing power, as right now it is too strong when combined with Nukes from the map event. Lastly, we are reducing the power of Regeneration Globes. While we like the new mini-game that Neutral Regen globes provide in the laning phase, we are not comfortable with how much they are currently benefitting the team that is ahead while they are pushing into a defending team. We’re also seeing players picking up more Regeneration Globes in general, so this will help to keep the game’s overall sustain in check. These are some hefty changes, and it’s likely that there will be more needed to be done over time as things continue to settle. We’ll be keeping an eye on things, and are prepared to make more updates as they’re needed.

skytemple.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Battleground Monsters[/b] [list] [*]Battleground-specific creatures are now universally defined as [b]Monsters[/b] (ex: Neutral Garden Terrors, Sky Temple Guardians, etc.) [*]Several Talents and Abilities have been changed to reflect this new categorization, and the following no longer affect Monsters: [list] Mercenary Lord [*]Johanna's Knight Takes Pawn [*]Lunara's Cruel Bloom [*]Rexxar's Easy Prey and Bird of Prey [*]The Butcher's Chop Meat [/list] [*]The following now affect Monsters: [list] Anub'arak's Beetle, Juiced [*]Azmodan's Demonic Smite [/list] [*]Several Talents that could previously trigger against both captured Mercenaries and Minions will now only affect Minions (ex: Seasoned Marksman, Black Soulstone, etc.) [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Towers, Forts, and Keeps now deal 50% bonus damage to Heroes [*]Cores will now display an “Invulnerable” message if attacked by an enemy when no allied Keeps have been destroyed. [*]Structures can no longer be made Vulnerable [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] The scaling changes we released in December made it so Heroes could dive into Structures with impunity during the early game. Increasing the damage that Structures deal to Heroes allows defending players to feel a bit safer. We are exploring other fixes to help Structures feel more meaningful throughout the game and will release them when they are ready.  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Diagonally placed shrubs will now properly hide Heroes within them. [/list] [list] [*]Players punted out of an enemy Hall of Storms will no longer be persistently stunned if an enemy unit blocked the path of the punt. [/list]

skytemple.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*]Fixed an issue that could cause Heroes to become stuck inside of a Gate after using certain Abilities. [/list]

skytemple.name: 2015-12-15 Patch Notes v 15.3

skytemple.name: 2015-11-17 Patch Notes v 15.0
skytemple.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Scaling Changes[/b] [list] [*]Health and damage scaling for all Heroes, Battleground Events, Minions, and Mercenaries has been changed from flat, additive values to values that are multiplicative by percentage. [*]A large portion of Heroes’ total scaling amounts, which were previously gained over the course of a game, have been added to their base values. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Due to the way that our old level scaling system worked, early game level discrepancies created a larger difference in power level than we liked. This often led to situations where a team could be up two or more levels early in a game, and use this advantage to create a larger lead. We didn’t feel that games were fun for the winning or losing team in these types of scenarios. As a result of these changes, all Heroes will have more power early, but gain less from each level. Battleground Events, Minions, Mercenaries, and Structures have all been adjusted to compensate for this and should feel close to what they did previously. The aim of these adjustments to the scaling system is to make level differences have a similar impact on your Hero’s statistics at all points in a game. Now, each level offers about 4% Health and 4% damage, which mirrors what late game leads felt like in our previous version of the game. It is important to note, that while being down a few levels will be less punishing than it was previously, Talent tier advantages can and will still have a noticeable impact on enemy engagements.  [b]Respawn Timers[/b] [list] [*]Respawn timers have been increased for levels 1 – 10. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] In order to reward players for getting early game Takedowns, we’re also increasing the respawn time of dead Heroes at low levels. Now, getting early game Takedowns (and the experience associated with it) won’t give your team as much pure power as it did previously. Instead, early kills will offer a “power play” moment, in which your team can destroy enemy Structures, complete Battleground Events, or take more Mercenaries. These meaningful strategic advantages will position a team closer to victory, without giving them a large stat advantage and the ability to bully the opposing enemy team.  [b]Attack Speed Slows[/b] [list] [*]Attack speed slows now apply only to Heroes and Summons. [/list]

skytemple.name: 2015-10-06 Patch Notes v 14.0
skytemple.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]A.I. Talent Selection[/b] [list] [*]A.I. controlled Heroes will now select their Talents from a group of preset Talent builds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] A.I. players will now choose from predetermined Talent builds instead of randomly selecting Talents. This is especially important for players who disconnect as the A.I. will now no longer randomly choose Talents, but instead try to pick builds that are closer to what players would expect. In addition, A.I. controlled Heroes in Versus A.I. games will also have their own Talent builds to choose from.  [b]Vehicles and Regeneration Globe Interaction[/b] [list] [*]Regeneration Globes will no longer heal Dragon Knights and Garden Terrors. [list] Instead, Regeneration Globe effects will now be applied directly to the Hero inside the Dragon Knight or Garden Terror. [/list] [*]Players within a Dragon Knight or Garden Terror can now also accumulate stacks for Talents such as Seasoned Marksman, Gathering Power, Regeneration Master, etc. [/list] [b]Summoned Unit Attacks[/b] [list] [*]Summoned unit Basic Attacks will now miss if that Summon is Blinded or the target is Evading. [*]Summoned unit Basic Attacks will no longer consume Block Talent stacks. [/list] Battleground Updates [list] [*]Events in which all three Temples activate simultaneously will no longer occur. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] While the three temple event could be fun, it didn’t leave the defending team with many options. It almost always meant whoever had the advantage at that point in time could secure the majority of the temples and win the match with little for the other team to do.  [b]General[/b] [list] [*]A.I. controlled Heroes can now travel long distances more effectively, and will travel to take part in objectives from anywhere on the Battleground. [*]A.I. controlled Heroes will now wait near an objective until enough allies have arrived that they can commit to a team fight at that objective. [/list]

skytemple.name: 2015-01-13 Patch Notes v 8.0
skytemple.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [b]Sky Temple[/b], a brand new 3-lane Battleground, has been added to Heroes of the Storm and is now available for play in all game modes! [list] [*]Temples at the center of each lane will activate after 90 seconds, and can be captured to fire devastating beams of energy at enemy Structures. [list] Beware! Once a Temple has been captured, its Guardians will rise and attempt to remove players by force. Defeat them to maintain control of an active Temple. [*]A Temple will cease firing shortly after all players have left its grounds, and can then be recaptured by either team. Be ready to fend off enemy players who seek to wrest control of the Temples for their own benefit. [/list] [*]One, two, or three Temples will activate at a time, and Temple activation will occur periodically throughout a game. [*]Temples will deactivate once their Ammunition is depleted. [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*][b]Core[/b] [list] Damage versus Heroes increased by 20% [*]Abathur’s Symbiote and Tassadar’s Plasma Shield can once again be cast on the Core. [/list] [*][b]Towers[/b] [list] The amount of time that towers are disabled while regenerating ammunition has been increased from 20 to 30 seconds. [list] This was done to align with a previous change, in which the rate of tower ammo regeneration was reduced to 1 per 15 seconds. As such, towers will now come back online with 2 ammunition. [/list] [/list] [/list] [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Grave Golem[/b] [list] [b]Root[/b] [list] Grave Golems will no longer pause when casting Root. [*]Root will now be cast on ranged Minions. [*]Heroic units will remain the preferred targets. [/list] [*][b]Stomp[/b] [list] The post-cast delay on Stomp has been removed. [*]Stomp will now be cast when there are at least 2 Heroic units around the Grave Golem, or at least 3 Minions. [*]Stomp will not be cast unless the Grave Golem is already stationary. [*]Stomp now deals increased damage versus Minions. [/list] [/list] [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Catapult Minions no longer deal half their intended damage, and once again deal area of effect damage around their target. [/list]

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2018-12-11 Patch Notes v 2.41.0
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Catapults[/b] [list] [*]When a team destroys a Fort, they'll now gain a Catapult in every 3rd Minion wave. [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] In order to keep early-game Catapults from being too devastating to defending teams, Catapult attack splash size, attack range, and damage/health will gradually increase as the game progresses. [/list] [/list] [b]Experience Changes[/b] [list] [*]Removed all Experience earned from destroying a Fort or Keep [*]Destroying a Fort or Keep will now provide your team with a stacking 20% increase in Passively-earned Experience [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] Towers of Doom is exempt from all Experience and Catapult changes. [/list] [*]Decreased Experience earned from destroying Towers by 50% [*]Passive Experience gain increased by 15% [*]Increased Experience gained by defeating defending Mercenaries by 100% [list] ​Hanamura Temple and Volsksaya Foundry Item Camps are excluded from this change. [/list] [*]Laning Mercenary Experience [list] Defeating Laning Mercenaries will now grant 100% of Defending Mercenaries Experience. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] Thank you so much for all of the feedback regarding the 2019 Gameplay Updates. While there is still a lot of community speculation about the outcome of these changes, there has been a resounding amount of concern about the loss of Fort and Keep XP. We agree that the complete loss of XP from Forts and Keeps may reduce the incentive to kill them to unhealthy levels, especially at higher levels of play. In response, we have reintroduced XP to the structures in a way that will reward players for taking them early while granting a gradual increase in power instead of large bursts. This should reinforce our goal of making matches closer while also rewarding teams for destroying enemy structures as quick as possible. [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] After listening to feedback, we have decided to pull back the laning Mercenary change outlined in our 2019 gameplay updates in order to give winning teams more opportunities to pull ahead.  [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Boss Camps, Sentinel Camps (Hanamura Temple), and Support Camps (Volskaya Foundry) will now be flagged as Elite. [list] Elite Mercenary Camps are Unstoppable & Unbribable [/list] [/list] [b]Unit Radii[/b] [list] [*]The unit radius values for most Heroes has been reduced by 5-15% [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] In an effort to improve visual clarity when many heroes are on-screen, we've updated the art for the Hero Ring displayed underneath heroes. To reinforce this effort, we've also done a pass on the Unit Radii for all heroes. We understand that these radius adjustments will have a minor but intended impact on landing and dodging abilities, and as a result, felt that the 2019 Gameplay Updates were the best time to make these changes.

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2018-06-06 Balance Update v 2.33.1
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,000 to 1,200 [*]Keep experience increased from 1,650 to 2,050 [*][b]Towers of Doom[/b] [list] Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,100 to 1,200. [*]Keep experience increased from 1,900 to 2,050. [list] [b][b]Note:[/b] Towers of Doom Forts upgrade to Keeps when the Tunnels open, approximately 12 minutes into a match.[/b] [/list] [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] We're taking some of the experience offered by outer Towers and distributing it amongst other Structures in an effort to keep teams closer in levels for a little while longer. We still want to reward skillful play, but a team that completes the first objective is frequently able take out a lot of the opposing team's outer Structures. Not only did this open up a strategic advantage (Healing Fountains get destroyed, Fortifications provide less safety), but it also pushes the winning team further ahead. Usually, this results in one team reaching level 10 before their opponents, allowing them to snowball to an even greater lead. We'd like to instead slow down early game leads, so that winning teams have to play well for a longer period of time.

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2018-01-09 Patch Notes v 2.29.7
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Total Health regen over 5 seconds reduced from 11.7% Maximum Health to 9% [*]Total Mana regen over 5 seconds reduced from 7.8% Maximum Mana to 7% [/list] [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Knights[/b] [list] Defender Mage Knight [list] Spell Armor Aura amount increased from 15 to 20  [/list] [*]Laner Mage Knight [list] Spell Armor Aura amount reduced from 30 to 20 [/list] [/list] [/list] [b]Forts[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33%. [*]Fort Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [/list] [b]Keeps[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Health increased from 16,000 to 17,000 [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] As expected, our gameplay update for 2018 resulted in large changes to many of our game systems. While we’re overall happy with the direction of the update, there have been some unintended side effects that we’re hoping to remedy. We overestimated how much more powerful unlimited ammo would be for Structures, and as a result pushing mechanics have become too strong, resulting in lower game times on nearly all maps. We’re giving our towers some of their teeth back with this update, which should help teams hold pushes from Mercenary Camps and map events. We’re also making some tuning changes to some of our Mercenary Camps now that we have had some time to see how they have been performing. Hellbats and Knights in particular are pushing harder than we would like, so we’re reducing their power. We’re also taking a look at the Warhead Junction boss and reducing its early and mid-game pushing power, as right now it is too strong when combined with Nukes from the map event. Lastly, we are reducing the power of Regeneration Globes. While we like the new mini-game that Neutral Regen globes provide in the laning phase, we are not comfortable with how much they are currently benefitting the team that is ahead while they are pushing into a defending team. We’re also seeing players picking up more Regeneration Globes in general, so this will help to keep the game’s overall sustain in check. These are some hefty changes, and it’s likely that there will be more needed to be done over time as things continue to settle. We’ll be keeping an eye on things, and are prepared to make more updates as they’re needed.

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2017-01-04 Patch Notes v 22.5
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Armor & Vulnerability[/b]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] With today’s patch you will notice that a lot of our tooltips that used to reference the Resistant/Vulnerable system have been changed. Matthew Cooper [url=https:/us.battle.net/forums/en/heroes/topic/20752266255]detailed the changes on our forums[/url] last month explaining a bit about the new system. While the tooltips may have changed, the actual functionality for the system has been in since the Varian patch hit during the week of November 14, so the game itself should not feel any different than what you are currently used to. You will also notice that we have added baseline Armor to three Heroes – Arthas, Anub'arak, and Greymane’s Worgen Form. These are the first of a handful that we are planning to release and would love to hear any feedback you have. We are hoping that the Armor System will open up future design flexibility, increase the depth of strategy (both in game, and in draft), and grant us another knob to help balance the game.  Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Minimap:[/b] Catapult Minimap icons are now slightly lighter in color to help players more easily differentiate them from other Minions. [/list]

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2016-11-22 Hotfix Patch v 22.1
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Minions:[/b] Catapult Minimap icons will now appear team-colored. [/list]

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2016-11-15 Patch Notes v 22.0
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Mercenaries:[/b] Siege Giants will no longer deal damage if they are killed while in the middle of their attack animations. [/list]

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2016-09-13 Patch Notes v 20.0
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Mounts[/b] [list] [*]Movement Speed reduced from 40 to 30% [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Time before Globes despawn reduced from 8 to 6 seconds [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Timing Changes[/b] [list] Previously all Mercenary camps spawned at 120 seconds. The following adjustments have been made to spawn times: [list] 90 seconds: Sappers, Doubloon Pirates [*]120 seconds: Siege Giants (unchanged), Impalers (unchanged) [*]150 seconds: Knights, Fallen Shaman [*]180 seconds: Grave Golem (unchanged) [*]300 seconds: Headless Horseman (unchanged) [/list] [/list] [*]Captured Mercenaries will no longer grant Experience when killed. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We started playtesting with staggered Mercenary Camp spawn times, and quickly began to realize that it added more strategic depth to the game, and coincided with some of our Battleground events. We have been happy with the changes overall, and are listening to any feedback you may have!  Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Tomb of the Spider Queen:[/b] Medivh will now properly fly over the Spider Queen’s Altars while in Raven form, rather than path around them. [/list] [list] [*]Heroes can no longer push captured Mercenaries by walking into them. [/list]

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2016-08-09 Patch Notes v 19.4
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Collision:[/b] Heroes can no longer push Neutral and Enemy Mercenaries by walking into them. [/list]

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2016-07-27 Balance Update v 19.3
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Collision[/b]: Heroes can no longer be pushed by walking another Hero into them.  [/list] [list] [*][b]Collision[/b]: Heroes who are channeling an Ability can no longer be pushed when another Hero walks into them during the channel.  [/list]

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2016-07-12 Patch Notes v 19.0
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Victory determination is now much more precise in situations where both Cores are destroyed within fractions of a second. As a result, Victory will no longer be decided at random in cases where it appears that both Cores are destroyed at the same moment. [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 6.24% of maximum Health over 4 seconds [*]Now: Restore 12% of maximum Health over 5 seconds [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 32 Mana over 4 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 8% of maximum Mana over 5 seconds [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Thank you for all your discussion and feedback on our recent Health sustain post! We are still heavily evaluating a lot of it but wanted to get the first round of changes in. Internally, we enjoyed the increased importance on Regeneration Globes and have cleaned up the system a bit. With a larger importance, denying enemies their Globes in lane has a much larger impact.  [b]Healing Wells[/b] [list] [*]Cooldown increased from 100 to 120 seconds [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 41% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 40% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 20% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 30% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Much like the changes to Regeneration Globes, we wanted to add a larger impact to the moment you click a Healing Well. Again, we cleaned up the system a fair bit (hence the ~41% to 40% Health change) and added a larger impact for heavy Mana users. The increased cooldown should make the decision of when to tap the Healing Well slightly more interesting.  [b]Minions[/b] [list] [*][b]Ranged, Melee, and Wizard Minions[/b] [list] Now deal an additional 50% damage to Structures. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Our goal with this change is to make escorting Minions to Towns to be more impactful, such that they can really start to do some damage if left unattended. Before this change, Minions were primarily XP carriers that absorbed some Ammo shots from Towers. Now the armies of the Nexus are a bit scarier when they march down a lane.  [list] [*][b]Catapult Minions[/b] [list] Attack range increased by 20%. [*]Sight range increased by 17%. [*]Will now fixate on Structures. Catapults will not acquire a new target after fixating until the target is destroyed or the Catapult is killed. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Catapults would often reach the Core, but have a Minion wave spawn on them, distract them, and allow them to be killed off before doing any significant damage. With increased range and fixation on a Structure once they’ve started attacking, even one Catapult will more consistently punch through a Core’s Shield and do actual damage.  Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Tomb of the Spider Queen:[/b] The number of Spider Gems held by each team will now always display, even if zero Gems are currently being carried. [/list] [list] [*][b]Tomb of the Spider Queen:[/b] The Top-lane Keep on the left side of the Battleground can no longer attack enemies who are standing next to the Gate. [/list]

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2016-06-14 Patch Notes v 18.4
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*]Tomb of the Spider Queen: Fixed an issue that caused Webweavers to spawn at the friendly Core if enemy minions were present. [/list]

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2016-05-17 Patch Notes v 18.0
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Healing Well[/b] [list] [*]25% of a Healing Well’s maximum Health has been converted into a Shield. Shield Regeneration delay of 8 seconds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We’ve noticed some rather un-fun behavior in the form of sniping Healing Wells over time using very long range Abilities. While we’re okay with players doing this to a degree, we found it was too effective given how little counterplay there was. To help solve this, turned a sizable portion of Healing Well Health into a Shield. This means that if you offer your Healing Well some respite from enemy attacks by chasing opponents away every now and then, it will start to regenerate some of that Shield. Only [b]you[/b] can protect Healing Wells from those pesky Arcane Orbs!  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Fixed an issue in which attacking enemy Walls at certain angles would cause the Hero’s Basic Attack animation to play, but deal no damage. [/list]
