tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2016-02-02 Patch Notes v 16.0
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Battleground Monsters[/b] [list] [*]Battleground-specific creatures are now universally defined as [b]Monsters[/b] (ex: Neutral Garden Terrors, Sky Temple Guardians, etc.) [*]Several Talents and Abilities have been changed to reflect this new categorization, and the following no longer affect Monsters: [list] Mercenary Lord [*]Johanna's Knight Takes Pawn [*]Lunara's Cruel Bloom [*]Rexxar's Easy Prey and Bird of Prey [*]The Butcher's Chop Meat [/list] [*]The following now affect Monsters: [list] Anub'arak's Beetle, Juiced [*]Azmodan's Demonic Smite [/list] [*]Several Talents that could previously trigger against both captured Mercenaries and Minions will now only affect Minions (ex: Seasoned Marksman, Black Soulstone, etc.) [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Towers, Forts, and Keeps now deal 50% bonus damage to Heroes [*]Cores will now display an “Invulnerable” message if attacked by an enemy when no allied Keeps have been destroyed. [*]Structures can no longer be made Vulnerable [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] The scaling changes we released in December made it so Heroes could dive into Structures with impunity during the early game. Increasing the damage that Structures deal to Heroes allows defending players to feel a bit safer. We are exploring other fixes to help Structures feel more meaningful throughout the game and will release them when they are ready.  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Diagonally placed shrubs will now properly hide Heroes within them. [/list] [list] [*]Players punted out of an enemy Hall of Storms will no longer be persistently stunned if an enemy unit blocked the path of the punt. [/list]

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2015-12-21 Hotfix Patch v 15.4
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*]Fixed an issue that could cause Heroes to become stuck inside of a Gate after using certain Abilities. [/list]

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2015-12-15 Patch Notes v 15.3
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*]Diagonally placed Shrubs will no longer sometimes fail to properly hide a Hero within. [/list]

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2015-11-17 Patch Notes v 15.0
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Scaling Changes[/b] [list] [*]Health and damage scaling for all Heroes, Battleground Events, Minions, and Mercenaries has been changed from flat, additive values to values that are multiplicative by percentage. [*]A large portion of Heroes’ total scaling amounts, which were previously gained over the course of a game, have been added to their base values. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Due to the way that our old level scaling system worked, early game level discrepancies created a larger difference in power level than we liked. This often led to situations where a team could be up two or more levels early in a game, and use this advantage to create a larger lead. We didn’t feel that games were fun for the winning or losing team in these types of scenarios. As a result of these changes, all Heroes will have more power early, but gain less from each level. Battleground Events, Minions, Mercenaries, and Structures have all been adjusted to compensate for this and should feel close to what they did previously. The aim of these adjustments to the scaling system is to make level differences have a similar impact on your Hero’s statistics at all points in a game. Now, each level offers about 4% Health and 4% damage, which mirrors what late game leads felt like in our previous version of the game. It is important to note, that while being down a few levels will be less punishing than it was previously, Talent tier advantages can and will still have a noticeable impact on enemy engagements.  [b]Respawn Timers[/b] [list] [*]Respawn timers have been increased for levels 1 – 10. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] In order to reward players for getting early game Takedowns, we’re also increasing the respawn time of dead Heroes at low levels. Now, getting early game Takedowns (and the experience associated with it) won’t give your team as much pure power as it did previously. Instead, early kills will offer a “power play” moment, in which your team can destroy enemy Structures, complete Battleground Events, or take more Mercenaries. These meaningful strategic advantages will position a team closer to victory, without giving them a large stat advantage and the ability to bully the opposing enemy team.  [b]Attack Speed Slows[/b] [list] [*]Attack speed slows now apply only to Heroes and Summons. [/list]

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2015-10-06 Patch Notes v 14.0
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]A.I. Talent Selection[/b] [list] [*]A.I. controlled Heroes will now select their Talents from a group of preset Talent builds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] A.I. players will now choose from predetermined Talent builds instead of randomly selecting Talents. This is especially important for players who disconnect as the A.I. will now no longer randomly choose Talents, but instead try to pick builds that are closer to what players would expect. In addition, A.I. controlled Heroes in Versus A.I. games will also have their own Talent builds to choose from.  [b]Vehicles and Regeneration Globe Interaction[/b] [list] [*]Regeneration Globes will no longer heal Dragon Knights and Garden Terrors. [list] Instead, Regeneration Globe effects will now be applied directly to the Hero inside the Dragon Knight or Garden Terror. [/list] [*]Players within a Dragon Knight or Garden Terror can now also accumulate stacks for Talents such as Seasoned Marksman, Gathering Power, Regeneration Master, etc. [/list] [b]Summoned Unit Attacks[/b] [list] [*]Summoned unit Basic Attacks will now miss if that Summon is Blinded or the target is Evading. [*]Summoned unit Basic Attacks will no longer consume Block Talent stacks. [/list]

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2015-08-18 Patch Notes v 13.0
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]   [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] A small number of Tomb games tend to run significantly longer than intended, so we altered the scaling of the Spider mechanic to prevent drawn out stalemates in the late game. Our hope is to see shorter matches overall.  [list] [*]Increased the damage and Health scaling of Webweavers and their minions by 50% past the 15 minute mark. [/list]

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2015-06-30 Patch Notes v 12.0
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*]Fixed an issue that could prevent Mercenary Camps from respawning appropriately after turning in enough Gems to summon Webweavers on Tomb of the Spider Queen. [/list]

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2015-05-12 Patch Notes v 11.0
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*]Alerts proclaiming that the Core is under attack will no longer play when an enemy Hero is within range of the Core before a Keep has been destroyed. [/list] [list] [*]Players will no longer enter an infinite rejoin loop if both Cores are destroyed simultaneously, and victory will be assigned to one team at random. [list] [b]Please note: Randomly assigned victory/defeat is intended as a temporary solution, intended to fix the infinite rejoin loop as soon as possible. A more robust solution for games that end in a draw will be implemented with a future patch.[/b] [/list] [/list]

tombofthespiderqueen.name: 2015-03-24 Patch Notes v 10.0
tombofthespiderqueen.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]General[/b] [list] [*]In-game XP Changes [list] The in-game leveling curve has been adjusted slightly to slow down the first 10 team levels, though the amount of XP required to reach level 20 remains the same.  [/list] [/list] Battleground Updates [b]Tomb of the Spider Queen[/b], a brand new 3-lane Battleground, has been added to Heroes of the Storm and is now available for play in all game modes! [list] [*]Spider Minions and enemy Heroes will drop magical Gems of Power upon death. [list] Collect these Gems and turn them in to the Spider Queen’s Altars, which can be found in-between lanes at the center of the Battleground. [/list] [*]Once either team has relinquished enough Gems to the Spider Queen, her Webweavers will descend and travel down each lane to siege the opposing team on three fronts. [list] Each team can summon Webweavers by turning in 50 Gems. The number of required Gems will increase by 5 for each subsequent wave. [*]Be sure to turn in Gems promptly! Gems collected by a player will be dropped upon death, but can be picked up by allied Heroes. [/list] [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Mercenary initial and scaling XP has been reworked. [*]Mercenary Camp tooltips now indicate which Camps can be Bribed. [/list] [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Gate, Tower, Town Hall, and Wall Health reduced by approximately 10%. [/list] Bug Fixes [list] [*]Fixed a rare issue in which a Core with less than 1 Health could suddenly be destroyed without taking additional damage. [/list]

towersofdoom.name: 2018-12-11 Patch Notes v 2.41.0
towersofdoom.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Catapults[/b] [list] [*]When a team destroys a Fort, they'll now gain a Catapult in every 3rd Minion wave. [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] In order to keep early-game Catapults from being too devastating to defending teams, Catapult attack splash size, attack range, and damage/health will gradually increase as the game progresses. [/list] [/list] [b]Experience Changes[/b] [list] [*]Removed all Experience earned from destroying a Fort or Keep [*]Destroying a Fort or Keep will now provide your team with a stacking 20% increase in Passively-earned Experience [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] Towers of Doom is exempt from all Experience and Catapult changes. [/list] [*]Decreased Experience earned from destroying Towers by 50% [*]Passive Experience gain increased by 15% [*]Increased Experience gained by defeating defending Mercenaries by 100% [list] ​Hanamura Temple and Volsksaya Foundry Item Camps are excluded from this change. [/list] [*]Laning Mercenary Experience [list] Defeating Laning Mercenaries will now grant 100% of Defending Mercenaries Experience. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] Thank you so much for all of the feedback regarding the 2019 Gameplay Updates. While there is still a lot of community speculation about the outcome of these changes, there has been a resounding amount of concern about the loss of Fort and Keep XP. We agree that the complete loss of XP from Forts and Keeps may reduce the incentive to kill them to unhealthy levels, especially at higher levels of play. In response, we have reintroduced XP to the structures in a way that will reward players for taking them early while granting a gradual increase in power instead of large bursts. This should reinforce our goal of making matches closer while also rewarding teams for destroying enemy structures as quick as possible. [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] After listening to feedback, we have decided to pull back the laning Mercenary change outlined in our 2019 gameplay updates in order to give winning teams more opportunities to pull ahead.  [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Boss Camps, Sentinel Camps (Hanamura Temple), and Support Camps (Volskaya Foundry) will now be flagged as Elite. [list] Elite Mercenary Camps are Unstoppable & Unbribable [/list] [/list] [b]Unit Radii[/b] [list] [*]The unit radius values for most Heroes has been reduced by 5-15% [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] In an effort to improve visual clarity when many heroes are on-screen, we've updated the art for the Hero Ring displayed underneath heroes. To reinforce this effort, we've also done a pass on the Unit Radii for all heroes. We understand that these radius adjustments will have a minor but intended impact on landing and dodging abilities, and as a result, felt that the 2019 Gameplay Updates were the best time to make these changes.

towersofdoom.name: 2018-11-13 Patch Notes v 2.40.0
towersofdoom.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [list] [*]Experience gains from Mercenary Camp captures have been unified. All Mercenary Camps now grant all Experience on capture. [/list]

towersofdoom.name: 2018-10-16 Patch Notes v 2.39.0
towersofdoom.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*][b]Mercenaries:[/b] Sappers can no longer have their charge attack interrupted by a Silence effect. Silencing Sappers will still prevent them from starting to channel this ability [/list]

towersofdoom.name: 2018-07-10 Patch Notes v 2.35.0
towersofdoom.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Heroes can no longer Heal, Shield, or target allied Mercenaries with Abilities unless an Ability specifically states that Mercenaries are valid targets. [/list]

towersofdoom.name: 2018-06-12 Patch Notes v 2.34.0
towersofdoom.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Ragnaros:[/b] Lava Wave now correctly dissipates after reaching the end of the targeted lane on Towers of Doom. [/list]

towersofdoom.name: 2018-06-06 Balance Update v 2.33.1
towersofdoom.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,000 to 1,200 [*]Keep experience increased from 1,650 to 2,050 [*][b]Towers of Doom[/b] [list] Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,100 to 1,200. [*]Keep experience increased from 1,900 to 2,050. [list] [b][b]Note:[/b] Towers of Doom Forts upgrade to Keeps when the Tunnels open, approximately 12 minutes into a match.[/b] [/list] [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] We're taking some of the experience offered by outer Towers and distributing it amongst other Structures in an effort to keep teams closer in levels for a little while longer. We still want to reward skillful play, but a team that completes the first objective is frequently able take out a lot of the opposing team's outer Structures. Not only did this open up a strategic advantage (Healing Fountains get destroyed, Fortifications provide less safety), but it also pushes the winning team further ahead. Usually, this results in one team reaching level 10 before their opponents, allowing them to snowball to an even greater lead. We'd like to instead slow down early game leads, so that winning teams have to play well for a longer period of time.

towersofdoom.name: 2018-05-01 Hotfix Patch v 2.32.1
towersofdoom.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Objectives:[/b] Channeling is now correctly paused if a Hero is hit by a Time Stop effect, like Zeratul's Void Prison, while attempting to capture the following Battleground Objectives: [list] Dragon Shire: Dragon Knight [*]Towers of Doom: Altars [*]Warhead Junction: Warhead collection [/list] [/list]

towersofdoom.name: 2018-03-30 Hotfix Patch v 2.31.1
towersofdoom.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Structures:[/b] Fixed an issue in which certain Abilities could be used to move Structures. [/list]

towersofdoom.name: 2018-03-21 Balance Update v 2.30.6
towersofdoom.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*]Increased the respawn timer of Sapper Camps by 30 seconds. [/list]

towersofdoom.name: 2018-03-06 Patch Notes v 2.30.4
towersofdoom.content: [h]Bug Fixes[/h]  [list] [*][b]Mercenaries:[/b] Fixed an issue in which neutral Mercenaries could spawn twice at their Mercenary Camp under specific circumstances. [/list]

towersofdoom.name: 2018-01-09 Patch Notes v 2.29.7
towersofdoom.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Total Health regen over 5 seconds reduced from 11.7% Maximum Health to 9% [*]Total Mana regen over 5 seconds reduced from 7.8% Maximum Mana to 7% [/list] [b]Forts[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33%. [*]Fort Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [/list] [b]Keeps[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Health increased from 16,000 to 17,000 [/list] [b]Towers of Doom[/b] [list] [*]Altar respawn time increased from 90 to 110 seconds. [/list] ​> [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] As expected, our gameplay update for 2018 resulted in large changes to many of our game systems. While we’re overall happy with the direction of the update, there have been some unintended side effects that we’re hoping to remedy. We overestimated how much more powerful unlimited ammo would be for Structures, and as a result pushing mechanics have become too strong, resulting in lower game times on nearly all maps. We’re giving our towers some of their teeth back with this update, which should help teams hold pushes from Mercenary Camps and map events. We’re also making some tuning changes to some of our Mercenary Camps now that we have had some time to see how they have been performing. Hellbats and Knights in particular are pushing harder than we would like, so we’re reducing their power. We’re also taking a look at the Warhead Junction boss and reducing its early and mid-game pushing power, as right now it is too strong when combined with Nukes from the map event. Lastly, we are reducing the power of Regeneration Globes. While we like the new mini-game that Neutral Regen globes provide in the laning phase, we are not comfortable with how much they are currently benefitting the team that is ahead while they are pushing into a defending team. We’re also seeing players picking up more Regeneration Globes in general, so this will help to keep the game’s overall sustain in check. These are some hefty changes, and it’s likely that there will be more needed to be done over time as things continue to settle. We’ll be keeping an eye on things, and are prepared to make more updates as they’re needed.

towersofdoom.name: 2017-12-12 Patch Notes v 2.29.3
towersofdoom.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [b]Battleground Objectives[/b] [list] [*]The first Battleground objective event will now activate 3 minutes into the match, following a 30-second warning, for the following Battlegrounds: [list] Towers of Doom [/list] [*]The Minimap will now indicate the next objective spawn location for the following Battlegrounds: [list] Towers of Doom [list] The first Altar indicators will appear on the Minimap 30 seconds after the game begins, as well as 30 seconds after the final Altars in an event has been captured. [/list] [/list] [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Regeneration Globes will now become neutral (claimable by both teams) if not claimed within 3 seconds. [/list] [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]All attacking structures no longer have ammunition. [*]Walls will now be destroyed if their connected Towers and Gate are also destroyed. Walls can still be attacked normally. [list] After reviewing community feedback, we’ve decided to revert this change. towersofdoom.name: 2017-01-04 Patch Notes v 22.5
towersofdoom.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Armor & Vulnerability[/b]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] With today’s patch you will notice that a lot of our tooltips that used to reference the Resistant/Vulnerable system have been changed. Matthew Cooper [url=https:/us.battle.net/forums/en/heroes/topic/20752266255]detailed the changes on our forums[/url] last month explaining a bit about the new system. While the tooltips may have changed, the actual functionality for the system has been in since the Varian patch hit during the week of November 14, so the game itself should not feel any different than what you are currently used to. You will also notice that we have added baseline Armor to three Heroes – Arthas, Anub'arak, and Greymane’s Worgen Form. These are the first of a handful that we are planning to release and would love to hear any feedback you have. We are hoping that the Armor System will open up future design flexibility, increase the depth of strategy (both in game, and in draft), and grant us another knob to help balance the game.  Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Minimap:[/b] Catapult Minimap icons are now slightly lighter in color to help players more easily differentiate them from other Minions. [/list]

towersofdoom.name: 2016-09-13 Patch Notes v 20.0

The following adjustments have been made to spawn times: [list] 90 seconds: Sappers, Doubloon Pirates [*]120 seconds: Siege Giants (unchanged), Impalers (unchanged) [*]150 seconds: Knights, Fallen Shaman [*]180 seconds: Grave Golem (unchanged) [*]300 seconds: Headless Horseman (unchanged) [/list] [/list] [*]Captured Mercenaries will no longer grant Experience when killed. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We started playtesting with staggered Mercenary Camp spawn times, and quickly began to realize that it added more strategic depth to the game, and coincided with some of our Battleground events. We have been happy with the changes overall, and are listening to any feedback you may have! towersofdoom.name: 2016-07-12 Patch Notes v 19.0
towersofdoom.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Core[/b] [list] [*]Victory determination is now much more precise in situations where both Cores are destroyed within fractions of a second. As a result, Victory will no longer be decided at random in cases where it appears that both Cores are destroyed at the same moment. [/list] [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 6.24% of maximum Health over 4 seconds [*]Now: Restore 12% of maximum Health over 5 seconds [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 32 Mana over 4 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 8% of maximum Mana over 5 seconds [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Thank you for all your discussion and feedback on our recent Health sustain post! We are still heavily evaluating a lot of it but wanted to get the first round of changes in. Internally, we enjoyed the increased importance on Regeneration Globes and have cleaned up the system a bit. With a larger importance, denying enemies their Globes in lane has a much larger impact.  [b]Healing Wells[/b] [list] [*]Cooldown increased from 100 to 120 seconds [*][b]Health Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 41% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 40% of maximum Health over 20 seconds. [/list] [*][b]Mana Regeneration[/b] [list] Previously: Restore 20% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [*]Now: Restore 30% of maximum Mana over 20 seconds. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Much like the changes to Regeneration Globes, we wanted to add a larger impact to the moment you click a Healing Well. Again, we cleaned up the system a fair bit (hence the ~41% to 40% Health change) and added a larger impact for heavy Mana users. The increased cooldown should make the decision of when to tap the Healing Well slightly more interesting.  [b]Minions[/b] [list] [*][b]Ranged, Melee, and Wizard Minions[/b] [list] Now deal an additional 50% damage to Structures. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Our goal with this change is to make escorting Minions to Towns to be more impactful, such that they can really start to do some damage if left unattended. Before this change, Minions were primarily XP carriers that absorbed some Ammo shots from Towers. Now the armies of the Nexus are a bit scarier when they march down a lane.  [list] [*][b]Catapult Minions[/b] [list] Attack range increased by 20%. [*]Sight range increased by 17%. [*]Will now fixate on Structures. Catapults will not acquire a new target after fixating until the target is destroyed or the Catapult is killed. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Catapults would often reach the Core, but have a Minion wave spawn on them, distract them, and allow them to be killed off before doing any significant damage. With increased range and fixation on a Structure once they’ve started attacking, even one Catapult will more consistently punch through a Core’s Shield and do actual damage.

towersofdoom.name: 2016-05-17 Patch Notes v 18.0
towersofdoom.content: [h]Battlegrounds[/h]  [b]Healing Well[/b] [list] [*]25% of a Healing Well’s maximum Health has been converted into a Shield. Shield Regeneration delay of 8 seconds. [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We’ve noticed some rather un-fun behavior in the form of sniping Healing Wells over time using very long range Abilities. While we’re okay with players doing this to a degree, we found it was too effective given how little counterplay there was. To help solve this, turned a sizable portion of Healing Well Health into a Shield. This means that if you offer your Healing Well some respite from enemy attacks by chasing opponents away every now and then, it will start to regenerate some of that Shield. Only [b]you[/b] can protect Healing Wells from those pesky Arcane Orbs!  Bug Fixes [list] [*]Cores on Towers of Doom will no longer appear to lose their Invulnerability Shields after a Fort is destroyed. towersofdoom.name: 2016-02-02 Patch Notes v 16.0
towersofdoom.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Battleground Monsters[/b] [list] [*]Battleground-specific creatures are now universally defined as [b]Monsters[/b] (ex: Neutral Garden Terrors, Sky Temple Guardians, etc.) [*]Several Talents and Abilities have been changed to reflect this new categorization, and the following no longer affect Monsters: [list] Mercenary Lord [*]Johanna's Knight Takes Pawn [*]Lunara's Cruel Bloom [*]Rexxar's Easy Prey and Bird of Prey [*]The Butcher's Chop Meat [/list] [*]The following now affect Monsters: [list] Anub'arak's Beetle, Juiced [*]Azmodan's Demonic Smite [/list] [*]Several Talents that could previously trigger against both captured Mercenaries and Minions will now only affect Minions (ex: Seasoned Marksman, Black Soulstone, etc.) [/list] Battleground Updates [list] [*]Ownership of nearby Bell Towers will no longer determine which lane Sapper Mercenaries will travel down. The two southern Sapper camps will now always travel down the bottom lane. [*]Text has been added to the Tunnels to help clarify their one-way use. [/list] Battlegrounds [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Towers, Forts, and Keeps now deal 50% bonus damage to Heroes [*]Cores will now display an “Invulnerable” message if attacked by an enemy when no allied Keeps have been destroyed. [*]Structures can no longer be made Vulnerable [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] The scaling changes we released in December made it so Heroes could dive into Structures with impunity during the early game. Increasing the damage that Structures deal to Heroes allows defending players to feel a bit safer. We are exploring other fixes to help Structures feel more meaningful throughout the game and will release them when they are ready.  Bug Fixes [list] [*]AI players on Towers of Doom will no longer path through the opposing team’s invulnerable defenses when traveling from the enemy’s side of the Battleground to an active Altar. [/list] [list] [*]Diagonally placed shrubs will now properly hide Heroes within them. [/list] [list] [*]Missiles will now travel at one consistent speed on Towers of Doom. [/list] [list] [*]Pinging the Tunnel Entrance on Towers of Doom in a French game client will now display the proper message in French.  [/list] [list] [*]Players punted out of an enemy Hall of Storms will no longer be persistently stunned if an enemy unit blocked the path of the punt. [/list]

towersofdoom.name: 2015-11-17 Patch Notes v 15.0
towersofdoom.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Scaling Changes[/b] [list] [*]Health and damage scaling for all Heroes, Battleground Events, Minions, and Mercenaries has been changed from flat, additive values to values that are multiplicative by percentage. [*]A large portion of Heroes’ total scaling amounts, which were previously gained over the course of a game, have been added to their base values. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] Due to the way that our old level scaling system worked, early game level discrepancies created a larger difference in power level than we liked. This often led to situations where a team could be up two or more levels early in a game, and use this advantage to create a larger lead. We didn’t feel that games were fun for the winning or losing team in these types of scenarios. As a result of these changes, all Heroes will have more power early, but gain less from each level. Battleground Events, Minions, Mercenaries, and Structures have all been adjusted to compensate for this and should feel close to what they did previously. The aim of these adjustments to the scaling system is to make level differences have a similar impact on your Hero’s statistics at all points in a game. Now, each level offers about 4% Health and 4% damage, which mirrors what late game leads felt like in our previous version of the game. It is important to note, that while being down a few levels will be less punishing than it was previously, Talent tier advantages can and will still have a noticeable impact on enemy engagements.  [b]Respawn Timers[/b] [list] [*]Respawn timers have been increased for levels 1 – 10. [list] Please review our recent [url=http://us.battle.net/heroes/en/blog/19906095]blog on scaling and respawn timer changes[/url] for more details. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] In order to reward players for getting early game Takedowns, we’re also increasing the respawn time of dead Heroes at low levels. Now, getting early game Takedowns (and the experience associated with it) won’t give your team as much pure power as it did previously. Instead, early kills will offer a “power play” moment, in which your team can destroy enemy Structures, complete Battleground Events, or take more Mercenaries. These meaningful strategic advantages will position a team closer to victory, without giving them a large stat advantage and the ability to bully the opposing enemy team.  [b]Attack Speed Slows[/b] [list] [*]Attack speed slows now apply only to Heroes and Summons. [/list] Battleground Updates The Grave Keeper and Raven Lord have risen over a dark and mysterious city, each seeking to add it to the territories under their control. Now, these Realm Lords call upon the aid of Heroes in their battle for dominance over the Towers of Doom. [list] [*][b]Please note[/b]: Towers of Doom is not currently available in the live version of Heroes of the Storm, as PTR testing has not yet concluded. Click here for more information. [*]Each Core on this Battleground is surrounded by an indestructible barrier, and cannot be razed by Heroes, Minions, or Mercenaries. [list] Instead, Heroes must capture the Altars that periodically activate within the city. Upon doing so, each of the Bell Towers controlled by the capturing team will fire a payload that damages the opposing Core. [/list] [*]Bell Tower allegiance is fickle! A Bell Tower that has been destroyed will respawn after a short delay, aligning itself with the team that took it down. [list] Toppling a Bell Tower not only increases a team’s area of control over the Battleground, but also grants an additional payload in the volleys that fire on the enemy Core after capturing an Altar. [/list] [/list] [b]Towers of Doom Available Now on PTR[/b] [list] [*]Towers of Doom is the only Battleground available for play in PTR matchmaking queues. [list] Battleground pools on the PTR have been reduced so that more thorough Towers of Doom playtesting can be done, and any bugs discovered during this time can be fixed before the Battleground is officially released. [/list] [*][b]Please note[/b]: Towers of Doom will not be available in the live version of Heroes immediately on patch day, but will remain playable on the PTR until playtesting concludes on November 24.  [/list]

warheadjunction.name: 2018-12-11 Patch Notes v 2.41.0
warheadjunction.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Catapults[/b] [list] [*]When a team destroys a Fort, they'll now gain a Catapult in every 3rd Minion wave. [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] In order to keep early-game Catapults from being too devastating to defending teams, Catapult attack splash size, attack range, and damage/health will gradually increase as the game progresses. [/list] [/list] [b]Experience Changes[/b] [list] [*]Removed all Experience earned from destroying a Fort or Keep [*]Destroying a Fort or Keep will now provide your team with a stacking 20% increase in Passively-earned Experience [list] [b]NOTE:[/b] Towers of Doom is exempt from all Experience and Catapult changes. [/list] [*]Decreased Experience earned from destroying Towers by 50% [*]Passive Experience gain increased by 15% [*]Increased Experience gained by defeating defending Mercenaries by 100% [list] ​Hanamura Temple and Volsksaya Foundry Item Camps are excluded from this change. [/list] [*]Laning Mercenary Experience [list] Defeating Laning Mercenaries will now grant 100% of Defending Mercenaries Experience. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] Thank you so much for all of the feedback regarding the 2019 Gameplay Updates. While there is still a lot of community speculation about the outcome of these changes, there has been a resounding amount of concern about the loss of Fort and Keep XP. We agree that the complete loss of XP from Forts and Keeps may reduce the incentive to kill them to unhealthy levels, especially at higher levels of play. In response, we have reintroduced XP to the structures in a way that will reward players for taking them early while granting a gradual increase in power instead of large bursts. This should reinforce our goal of making matches closer while also rewarding teams for destroying enemy structures as quick as possible. [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] After listening to feedback, we have decided to pull back the laning Mercenary change outlined in our 2019 gameplay updates in order to give winning teams more opportunities to pull ahead.  [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*]Boss Camps, Sentinel Camps (Hanamura Temple), and Support Camps (Volskaya Foundry) will now be flagged as Elite. [list] Elite Mercenary Camps are Unstoppable & Unbribable [/list] [/list] [b]Unit Radii[/b] [list] [*]The unit radius values for most Heroes has been reduced by 5-15% [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] In an effort to improve visual clarity when many heroes are on-screen, we've updated the art for the Hero Ring displayed underneath heroes. To reinforce this effort, we've also done a pass on the Unit Radii for all heroes. We understand that these radius adjustments will have a minor but intended impact on landing and dodging abilities, and as a result, felt that the 2019 Gameplay Updates were the best time to make these changes.

warheadjunction.name: 2018-06-06 Balance Update v 2.33.1
warheadjunction.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Structures[/b] [list] [*]Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,000 to 1,200 [*]Keep experience increased from 1,650 to 2,050 [*][b]Towers of Doom[/b] [list] Fort Tower experience reduced from 500 to 250. [*]Fort experience increased from 1,100 to 1,200. [*]Keep experience increased from 1,900 to 2,050. [list] [b][b]Note:[/b] Towers of Doom Forts upgrade to Keeps when the Tunnels open, approximately 12 minutes into a match.[/b] [/list] [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] We're taking some of the experience offered by outer Towers and distributing it amongst other Structures in an effort to keep teams closer in levels for a little while longer. We still want to reward skillful play, but a team that completes the first objective is frequently able take out a lot of the opposing team's outer Structures. Not only did this open up a strategic advantage (Healing Fountains get destroyed, Fortifications provide less safety), but it also pushes the winning team further ahead. Usually, this results in one team reaching level 10 before their opponents, allowing them to snowball to an even greater lead. We'd like to instead slow down early game leads, so that winning teams have to play well for a longer period of time.

warheadjunction.name: 2018-05-22 Patch Notes v 2.33.0
warheadjunction.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*][b]Nuke (F)[/b] [list] Bonus damage has been removed and Nukes now deal a flat amount of damage across the entire area of impact. [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] The bonus damage dealt by Warheads had very little counterplay in late-game situations. Teams could hoard Warheads and kill any Structure—including the Core—very quickly. Although this center bonus damage presented players with interesting decision points, the mechanic's problems outweighed its positives. We feel encouraging players to hit as many structures as possible is a similarly fun mechanic that is healthier for the game.

warheadjunction.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [b]Regeneration Globes[/b] [list] [*]Total Health regen over 5 seconds reduced from 11.7% Maximum Health to 9% [*]Total Mana regen over 5 seconds reduced from 7.8% Maximum Mana to 7% [/list] [b]Mercenaries[/b] [list] [*][b]Hellbats[/b] [list] Defender [list] Armor Shred amount reduced from 5 to 4% per stack [*]Base Health reduced from 4275 to (Minutes 6-10) increased from 75 to 110 [*]Health Scaling (Minutes 11 -15) increased from 100 to 150 [*]Health Scaling (Minutes 16-20) increased from 125 to 235 [/list] [/list] [/list] [*][b]Slime Boss (Warhead Junction)[/b] [list] Laner [list] Base Health amount reduced from 20000 to 16000 [list] Scaling (Minutes 1-5) reduced from 630 to 500 [*]Scaling (Minutes 6-10) increased from 945 to 1050 [*]Scaling (Minutes 11 -15) increased from 1260 to 1400 [*]Scaling (Minutes 16-20) increased from 1575 to 2250 [/list] [*]Base Basic Attack damage reduced from 400 to 320 [list] Scaling (Minutes 1-5) reduced from 10 to 8 [*]Scaling (Minutes 6-10) increased from 15 to 17 [*]Scaling (Minutes 11 -15) increased from 20 to 23 [*]Scaling (Minutes 16-20) increased from 25 to 38 [/list] [*]Base Spit impact damage reduced from 250 to 200 [list] Scaling (Minutes 6-10) increased from 5 to 6.25% [*]Scaling (Minutes 11 -15) increased from 6 to 7.25% [*]Scaling (Minutes 16-20) increased from 6 to 8.25% [/list] [*]Base Spit ‘Damage over Time’ damage reduced from 150 to 120 [list] Scaling (Minutes 6-10) increased from 5 to 6.25% [*]Scaling (Minutes 11 -15) increased from 6 to 7.25% [*]Scaling (Minutes 16-20) increased from 6 to 8.25% [/list] [*]Acid Trail Base damage reduced from 80 to 64 [list] Scaling (Minutes 6-10) increased from 5 to 6.25% [*]Scaling (Minutes 11 -15) increased from 6 to 7.25% [*]Scaling (Minutes 16-20) increased from 6 to 8.25% [/list] [/list] [/list] [/list] [b]Forts[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33%. [*]Fort Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [/list] [b]Keeps[/b] [list] [*]Gate Tower Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Damage to Minions, Mercenaries, Monsters, and Heroes increased by 33% [*]Keep Health increased from 16,000 to 17,000 [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comment:[/b][/b] As expected, our gameplay update for 2018 resulted in large changes to many of our game systems. While we’re overall happy with the direction of the update, there have been some unintended side effects that we’re hoping to remedy. We overestimated how much more powerful unlimited ammo would be for Structures, and as a result pushing mechanics have become too strong, resulting in lower game times on nearly all maps. We’re giving our towers some of their teeth back with this update, which should help teams hold pushes from Mercenary Camps and map events. We’re also making some tuning changes to some of our Mercenary Camps now that we have had some time to see how they have been performing. Hellbats and Knights in particular are pushing harder than we would like, so we’re reducing their power. We’re also taking a look at the Warhead Junction boss and reducing its early and mid-game pushing power, as right now it is too strong when combined with Nukes from the map event. Lastly, we are reducing the power of Regeneration Globes. While we like the new mini-game that Neutral Regen globes provide in the laning phase, we are not comfortable with how much they are currently benefitting the team that is ahead while they are pushing into a defending team. We’re also seeing players picking up more Regeneration Globes in general, so this will help to keep the game’s overall sustain in check. These are some hefty changes, and it’s likely that there will be more needed to be done over time as things continue to settle. We’ll be keeping an eye on things, and are prepared to make more updates as they’re needed.

warheadjunction.name: 2017-01-04 Patch Notes v 22.5
warheadjunction.content: [h]Design & Gameplay[/h]  [b]Armor & Vulnerability[/b]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] With today’s patch you will notice that a lot of our tooltips that used to reference the Resistant/Vulnerable system have been changed. Matthew Cooper [url=https:/us.battle.net/forums/en/heroes/topic/20752266255]detailed the changes on our forums[/url] last month explaining a bit about the new system. While the tooltips may have changed, the actual functionality for the system has been in since the Varian patch hit during the week of November 14, so the game itself should not feel any different than what you are currently used to. You will also notice that we have added baseline Armor to three Heroes – Arthas, Anub'arak, and Greymane’s Worgen Form. These are the first of a handful that we are planning to release and would love to hear any feedback you have. We are hoping that the Armor System will open up future design flexibility, increase the depth of strategy (both in game, and in draft), and grant us another knob to help balance the game.  Bug Fixes [list] [*][b]Minimap:[/b] Catapult Minimap icons are now slightly lighter in color to help players more easily differentiate them from other Minions. [/list]

warheadjunction.name: 2016-12-14 Patch Notes v 22.3
warheadjunction.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  [list] [*][b]Warheads[/b] [list] Base damage reduced from 2750 to 2300. [*]Warhead damage now scales by a flat 70 every minute, and no longer has a large jump at 18 minutes. [*]Inner Warhead damage is still a 50% bonus. [/list] [*][b]Warheads[/b] [url=https:/redd.it/5k8orf]Undocumented [/i][/url] [list] Deal 70% more damage in the center (50% more damage to Heroes) [/list] [/list]  [b][b]Developer Comments:[/b][/b] We didn’t like the gameplay of holding off on using a Warhead for a sudden unintuitive damage spike, so we’ve smoothed out their damage curve over a longer period. This should end up playing mostly the same across the game, with only about 10% differences in damage at various points in the match.

warheadjunction.name: 2016-09-27 Patch Notes v 20.2
warheadjunction.content: [h]Battleground Updates[/h]  Once a testing facility for nuclear weapons, Warhead Junction has since fallen into ruin. However, the site's abandonment hasn't stopped its glitchy adjutant from continuing to produce and hand out nuclear weapons. Join the arms race of Warhead Junction, build up your stockpile, and rain hell on your enemies! [list] [*][b]Warhead Deployment[/b] [list] Multiple Warheads will spawn periodically across the battleground. [/list] [*][b]Collect Warheads[/b] [list] Pick up a Warhead to activate your Nuke. Use it or you will drop it when you die! [/list] [*][b]Call Down the Thunder[/b] [list] Launch Nukes to devastate the enemy team's fortifications. [/list] [/list]
